Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Company Overview

At Veo, we are on a mission to end car dependency by making clean transportation accessible to all and advancing the next generation of fully electric micromobility systems. Our fleets are constantly evolving and feature a range of vehicles - from pedal and electric bicycles, to standing and seated e-scooters, e-cargo bikes, and ADA accessible devices. We design and build our own vehicles, hardware, and software systems in house and run all our local operations to provide safe, efficient, and responsive mobility services that make communities more sustainable and livable. We are looking for exceptionally talented individuals who are ready to develop and implement new solutions to these exciting challenges.

Job Summary

VeoRide is at the forefront of transforming urban mobility through innovative solutions. Our mission is to make transportation smarter, safer, and more accessible to everyone. We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and harness the power of data to propel us into the future of urban mobility. As a Data Analyst, you will help us create an outstanding experience for our riders in markets all over the U.S. You will apply your passion for problem solving, planning and execution through data-based decision making by driving day-to-day execution of new initiatives and providing critical insights that will guide decisions on future enhancements and net new functionality to accelerate growth. This role is a hybrid role and you will be required to go into the office 3 days a week.

Responsibilities:


Perform advanced analytics to unlock actionable insights and solve specific problems
Design analytics tools/visualizations used in real time for Customers and Operations teams
Provide actionable insights and reports to support decision-making processes
Use SQL to aggregate disparate data sources to help decision makers understand the core story
Maintain DBT Pipelines
Interact with key APIs to pipe data into our data warehouse
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand all aspects of Veo's business and support their respective goals and initiatives
Ensure data integrity and consistency across all retail properties and internal systems


Competencies


Bachelor's degree required; Master's degree preferred in an analytical subject (physics, economics, engineering, social sciences, computer science, business analytics, etc.)
Self-motivated with very close attention to detail
2+ years performing quantitative analysis and building analytics products with an ability to work cross-functionally
Experience in SQL
Experience with Python/R (Python preferred)
Experience with Looker/Tableau/Power BI
Familiarity with data warehouses such as BigQuery, Snowflake, etc,
Obsesses over data quality, analysis accuracy, and clean code
Able to formulate tractable problems for solution development as well as able to effectively communicate key findings through written and verbal mediums
Strategic thinker with a bias for execution
Able to quickly learn new coding and analysis skills that are needed to effectively complete aspects of insight development


Perks


Dental/medical/vision coverage
Unlimited PTO
Opportunity to work in a fast-paced, hyper-growth technology company
Unlimited Veo credits
Commitment to professional development and career growth
Opportunity to work on one of the world's most challenging problems


Compensation:

The base salary range for this full-time position is $84,000 - $94,000 + Annual Performance Bonus + Equity (Stock Options) + Full Range of Benefits. Veo is a total compensation company, and pay is determined by geographic cost of labor and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training - so not all candidates will be eligible for the upper end of the salary range. Our total compensation package for this role, including bonus potential, ranges from $87,000 to $100,000 per year.

Note: Veo benefit, bonus and stock programs may be subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program. The listed range is a good faith estimate, and exact compensation and total package may vary depending on market conditions and performance.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stenzo Tech:

At Stenzo Tech, we are dedicated to transforming businesses through innovative technology solutions. As a newly established company, we offer a range of services, including cutting-edge software development, data analytics, and digital transformation strategies. Our mission is to create lasting impacts for our clients while fostering a supportive and growth-driven environment for our team members.

We believe in nurturing talent, providing international exposure, and offering exciting career development opportunities. Join us as we build the future of technology together!

Connect with us on LinkedIn -https://lnkd.in/dRSiqzJ6 or visit our website at www.stenzo.co to learn more about our vision and services.

Job Title: Data Analyst

Location:Multiple location in USA

Job Type:Full-Time

Job Overview:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly skilled Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis and a passion for using data to drive business decisions. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, processing, and analyzing data to provide actionable insights and support strategic decision-making across various departments.

Key Responsibilities:


Data Collection and Cleaning:
Gather and preprocess data from various sources including databases, spreadsheets, and APIs
Ensure data integrity and accuracy by performing data cleaning and validation
Data Analysis:
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Use statistical techniques and data visualization tools to interpret and present data findings
Reporting and Visualization:
Create comprehensive reports and dashboards to communicate findings to stakeholders
Develop visualizations that effectively convey complex data insights to non-technical audiences
Business Intelligence:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and objectives
Provide data-driven recommendations to support business strategies and decision-making
Performance Tracking:
Monitor and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess business performance
Identify areas for improvement and propose actionable solutions
Tool Management:
Utilize analytical tools and software such as Excel, SQL, Python, R, Tableau, or Power BI
Stay updated on industry trends and new technologies to continuously enhance analytical capabilities
Documentation and Communication:
Document data analysis processes, methodologies, and findings
Present data insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner

Qualifications:


Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred
Experience:
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a strong portfolio of completed projects
Experience with data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Python, R, or similar
Skills:
Proficiency in data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Ability to work with large datasets and perform complex data analysis
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Attributes:
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
A proactive and collaborative approach to problem-solving
Enthusiasm for learning and staying updated on industry best practices

Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with advanced analytics and machine learning techniques
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and experience with ETL processes
Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)


What We Offer:


Competitive salary and benefits package
Opportunities for professional growth and development
A collaborative and dynamic work environment
[Any other company-specific perks or benefits]

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, processing, and analyzing data to provide actionable insights and support strategic decision-making across various departments.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Data Collection and Cleaning:
    • Gather and preprocess data from various sources including databases, spreadsheets, and APIs
    • Ensure data integrity and accuracy by performing data cleaning and validation
  • Data Analysis:
    • Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights
    • Use statistical techniques and data visualization tools to interpret and present data findings
  • Reporting and Visualization:
    • Create comprehensive reports and dashboards to communicate findings to stakeholders
    • Develop visualizations that effectively convey complex data insights to non-technical audiences
  • Business Intelligence:
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and objectives
    • Provide data-driven recommendations to support business strategies and decision-making
  • Performance Tracking:
    • Monitor and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess business performance
    • Identify areas for improvement and propose actionable solutions
  • Tool Management:
    • Utilize analytical tools and software such as Excel, SQL, Python, R, Tableau, or Power BI
    • Stay updated on industry trends and new technologies to continuously enhance analytical capabilities
  • Documentation and Communication:
    • Document data analysis processes, methodologies, and findings
    • Present data insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Qualifications:

  • Education:
    • Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred
  • Experience:
    • Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a strong portfolio of completed projects
    • Experience with data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Python, R, or similar
  • Skills:
    • Proficiency in data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar
    • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
    • Ability to work with large datasets and perform complex data analysis
    • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
  • Attributes:
    • Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
    • A proactive and collaborative approach to problem-solving
    • Enthusiasm for learning and staying updated on industry best practices
Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with advanced analytics and machine learning techniques
  • Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and experience with ETL processes
  • Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)

What We Offer:

  • Competitive salary and benefits package
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development
  • A collaborative and dynamic work environment
  • [Any other company-specific perks or benefits]

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

6-month contract

On-Site

Pay Rate: $30/hr W2 (Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, LTD insurance)




Join our client as a Data Analyst and play a key role in optimizing their data processes to enhance business decision-making and operational efficiency. You will work with large datasets from multiple sources, such as Workday, and provide critical insights that inform strategic planning and process improvements. If you're skilled in data mining, pattern recognition, and problem-solving, this role is a great fit for you.




Key Responsibilities - Data Analyst:

Perform ad-hoc data analysis to compare and reconcile discrepancies between Workday and client resource systems.
Design and implement manual controls and mitigation strategies to address data inconsistencies and gaps.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and enhance data analysis processes, ensuring efficiency and accuracy.
Identify patterns and trends within large datasets, offering valuable insights to improve decision-making, optimize processes, and assess solutions.
Engage in exploratory and confirmatory data analysis to drive impactful business outcomes.
Address and resolve complex data-related challenges that require innovative solutions.




Required Skills - Data Analyst:

Strong ability to work with large datasets, demonstrating a solid understanding of data structures and analytical techniques.
Expertise in data tracing, mining, visualization, and root cause analysis, with an eye for identifying trends and anomalies.
Proficiency in Workday systems.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with a strong sense of urgency.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel for data manipulation and reporting.
Experience with HR technology is a plus.

Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Boston, MA (Onsite – 4 days)

Employment Type: Full-time

Years of Experience: 8+

Job Description:

Responsibilities:

Analyze complex healthcare data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Develop and maintain data pipelines using Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
Create and manage dashboards and reports to support decision-making processes.
Ensure data quality and integrity across various data sources.

Strong SQL skills and experience with data visualization tools like Tableau or Looker.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Title: Data/Business Analyst
Description:
Armand Corporation, an award-winning M/WBE Construction Management firm celebrating over 33 years in the industry, is seeking a full-time Data/Business Analystfor a federal construction project related to complex rail, transit, and other transportation projects in NY & NJ.

The ideal candidate has at least 5years of full-time experience in data structure management, analytics, and report generation via Power BI, as well as a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university with a major in Computer Science, Information Systems, Construction,or related fields.

This position will be full-time, on-site. Candidates are expected to live in or near the New York metropolitan area.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIESinclude, but are not limited to, the following:


Develop and track project performance metrics, reports, and collaboration sites to assist with project/program schedule monitoring andcommunicate status updates tomanagement teams
Analyze and use data via Power BI to identify key project issues andvariancefrom approved plans
Perform data visualization and forecast trendsusing statistics and established pattern-finding techniques
Managing data sets, ensuring they are clean, accurate, and ready for analysis, involving data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes
Prepares and assists in various levels of project reporting
Assists in process development and implementation of project control reporting procedures


QUALIFICATIONSinclude, but are not limited to, the following:


A Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university with a major in Computer Science, Information Systems, Construction,or related fields
5+ years of professional experience working directly as a full-time Data/Business Analyst using Power BI
Strong understanding of data analysis and visualization principles and proficiency in Power BI and other data tools
Excel expertise including macro development, look-up tables, complex formulas, and pivot tables
Proficiency indata management, production, and report development isrequired
Strong computer skills (MS Office, MS Project, Adobe Acrobat)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
**W2 & C2C**

Local Only.

Westlake, TX(First Preference) OR Durham, NC (Second Preference)

SUMMARY:

The client is initiating a migration project to enhance and update their current reporting infrastructure, aiming to move away from the existing ecosystem of Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE) and Oracle Exadata towards a new setup involving Snowflake and Power BI hosted on AWS and Azure platforms, respectively. The migration is driven by the need to address various challenges including data quality issues, lack of self-service capabilities, and alignment with Enterprise Information (EI) and Workplace Investing (WI) cloud strategies. The transition aims to provide a better reporting experience, faster time to market, and support the decommissioning of legacy hardware and data warehouses.

Responsibilities: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand reporting requirements and data analysis needs. Assist in the design of the database by providing insights into data usage and reporting patterns. Validate data quality and integrity in the new AWS RDS database. Support the development of data governance and data quality frameworks.

Qualifications: Strong analytical skills with experience in data analysis methodologies. Knowledge of database design principles and experience with SQL queries. Familiarity with AWS, Azure and data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI). Understanding of financial data and reporting standards.

Must Have Skills: AWS, Azure, PowerBI, SQL Quieres

Preferred Skills: data warehousing and database performance tuning

Domain Knowledge: Retirement, 401K, Defined Contribution

Title: DATA ANALYST - CONTROLLING
Description:
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en más de 115 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 110 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 78% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

DATA ANALYST - CONTROLLING

¿CÓMO SERIA TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

Para formar parte de nuestro equipo de Reporting dentro del departamento de Control de gestión buscamos un/a Data Analyst.

Participarás en proyectos con el objetivo de simplificar el acceso a la información, generar valor con los datos y capacitar a los usuarios de herramientas para acelerar la toma de decisiones.

Funciones


Participarás en proyectos con el objetivo de simplificar el acceso a la información, generar valor con los datos y capacitar a los usuarios de herramientas para acelerar la toma de decisiones
Crearás una red de contactos multidisciplinares en la organización para garantizar el éxito de los proyectos
Darás soporte en la elaboración y análisis del reporting mensual financiero
Darás soporte en la creación y mantenimiento de dashboards en diferentes herramientas de BI: Looker, PowerBI y SAP BO
Liderarás la automatización y simplificación del reporting mensual financiero a través de PowerBI
Realizarás análisis complejos para permitir la toma de decisiones basada en datos
Sintetizarás los datos procedentes de múltiples fuentes y desarrollar hipótesis
Proporcionarás ideas clave, recomendaciones y presentarlas a los diferentes interlocutores


¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?


Master en Ingeniería, ADE, Estadística o Matemáticas
Experiencia mínima de 1-2 años en Análisis de datos, consultoría de BI o consultoría de negocio
Conocimientos en SQL, herramientas de BI y lenguajes de programación
Dominio de Excel
Buscamos personas con Learning Agility, influyentes, analíticas, rigurosas, con buenas dotes de comunicación, capacidad resolutiva y altamente orientada a cliente interno & negocio
Orientación a negocio y mentalidad resolutiva: capacidad de analizar, interpretar, sintetizar y comunicar impactos y tendencias a través de los datos


¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?


Horario Flexible (entrada de 8h a 9h30 y salida de 17h a 18h30), jornada intensiva los viernes (de 8h a 9h hasta las 14h / 15h) y mayoría de vigilias de festivos
Posibilidad de Teletrabajo
Descuento en todas nuestras líneas (Woman, Man, Kids, Teen & Home) además de un Market de muestrario para renovar tu armario dos veces al año
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería
Retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc.
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallés
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo y cursos específicos en función de tus necesidades
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings sobre transformación digital, moda y actividades de nuestros equipos
Servicio médico propio, servicio de fisioterapia una vez a la semana, sala de fitness y vestuarios en nuestras oficinas centrales
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad con un ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso


You got it?

We like you!

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Sabadell Digital nace para impulsar el proceso de transformación digital del banco. Para ello proporcionamos soluciones globales, apoyándonos en la última tecnología, en nuestra capacidad de innovar y en la experiencia de un equipo que nos ayuda a construir el futuro. Pero esto solo es posible gracias a personas como tu. Profesionales con alto expertise en el sector tecnológico capaces de hacer "que las cosas pasen" asegurando la máxima calidad y eficiencia.




Qué estamos buscando?




Buscamos un / una Analista de Datos para analizar, transformar y presentar los datos contenidos en las solicitudes de diferentes colectivos: operativa, productos y procesos de la Dirección de Operaciones de Cuentas, Personas y Caja de acuerdo con los procedimientos y políticas definidas, haciendo uso de las herramientas específicas para el tratamiento de datos para conseguir garantizar su fiabilidad, generar conclusiones y poner a disposición de los interesados la información clave. Ubicación: Sabadell.







Hablemos del proyecto...




Tus principales responsabilidades serían:




Obtención de datos de distintos orígenes e interlocutores para su modelado y explotación.




Analizar la información para entender el negocio, proceso o producto.




Modelar los conjuntos de datos para optimizar y organizar el acceso a la información.




Diseñar y construir informes, cuadros de mando, métricas e indicadores para obtener conclusiones sobre el negocio, proceso o producto mediante la visualización de datos.




Presentar resultados y/o conclusiones obtenidas para ayudar a tomar decisiones a los diferentes stakeholders.




Colaborar con los distintos equipos multidisciplinares para ofrecer soluciones innovadoras, facilitar el consumo y entendimiento de los datos propietarios.




- Liderar tareas y proyectos con alto grado de autonomía y calidad en la entrega.







¿Qué valoramos de tu candidatura?




Formación y Experiencia:




Carrera técnica: Ingeniería (Prioritariamente en Informática o Datos), Estadística o Matemáticas.




Conocimientos/skills:




- Al menos 3 años de experiencia en Análisis, modelado y presentación de datos. SAS (Nivel medio-avanzado) Office (Excel, Powerpoint, Acces. Nivel medio-avanzado) SQL (Nivel medio-avanzado) Gestión de proyectos (Nivel medio-avanzado)




Idiomas:




Se valorará conocimientos de inglés y catalán hablado / escrito.




Información adicional




Si estás buscando nuevos retos profesionales, esta es tu oportunidad!




Sabadell Digital está comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, orientación sexual, religión, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.




Sabadell Digital forma parte de la red de empresas con el distintivo de “Igualdad en la Empresa” otorgado por el Ministerio de Igualdad.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
What You'll Do:

As an Data Analyst Project Manager in the OPS Excellence team, you will be working with a team of Project Managers acting as a key player in understanding every aspect of Criteo’s complex processes.

This role offers a unique opportunity to combine data analytics and project management skills to gain a comprehensive understanding of our internal processes working globally with leaders across different functions. You will be at the forefront of answering intricate analytical questions pertaining to the performance and impact of our internal projects, helping us monitor and optimise our solutions. Your responsibilities will encompass both technically rigorous work, utilizing state-of-the-art data analysis technologies, and daily collaboration with cross-functional business units.

Criteo’s high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position involves dealing with a considerable amount of complex, real-world data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking of new and innovative ways to analyse data and solve problems. The ideal candidate can function with minimal oversight and has a strong ability to learn new concepts quickly.

As an Analytical Project Manager Intern, your responsibilities will encompass a wide range of tasks to support project management and data analysis.

Key responsibilities include:


Tableau Reporting: Develop and maintain Tableau dashboards and reports to monitor project progress and key performance indicators, ensuring data-driven decision-making.
Data Analysis: Use SQL to gather, clean, and analyze data, providing valuable insights that support project predictions, sizing, and overall strategy.
Meeting Leadership: Lead and actively participate in project meetings, ensuring clear communication, documentation of outcomes, and alignment with project objectives.
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams and key stakeholders, building strong relationships and contributing to the successful execution of projects.
Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for process enhancements, propose solutions, and play a proactive role in continuous improvement efforts within the team.



Who You Are:

To thrive in this role, you should possess the following qualifications and characteristics:


Academic Pursuit: Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Analytics, Data Science, etc.).
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Tableau for data visualization and reporting, as well as strong SQL skills for data extraction, transformation, and analysis. Knowledge of Python is considered an advantage.
Analytical Mindset: Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a knack for extracting actionable insights from data.
Communication Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders.
Proactive Attitude: A proactive and well-organized approach that enables you to manage multiple tasks, meet deadlines, and take initiative in a fast-paced environment.
Visibility Seeker: A strong commitment to making a meaningful impact on projects with high visibility within the organization.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.


Show more

You will be at the forefront of answering intricate analytical questions pertaining to the performance and impact of our internal projects, helping us monitor and optimise our solutions. Title: Analista de datos
Place: Santa Perpètua de Mogoda, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
B&B TRENDS – UFESA empresa de pequeños electrodomésticos quiere contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar de tu familia con productos prácticos y fáciles de usar.

Ya sea con nuestra línea de productos de salud, terapia por calor, belleza, bienestar o nuestros productos para el hogar, te ofrecemos la máxima calidad y las últimas tecnologías para tu día a día.




En nuestro proceso continuo de expansión, queremos incorporar a un/a ANALISTA DE DATOS (POWER BI) que será el responsable de mejorar y automatizar los procesos de datos dentro de la plataforma Power BI. Este rol implica trabajar estrechamente con equipos de desarrollo y operaciones para implementar soluciones que optimicen el flujo de datos y la generación de informes, asegurando al mismo tiempo la calidad y la gobernanza de los datos. El candidato deberá:

Desarrollar, mantener y optimizar dashboards y reportes en Power BI que permitan visualizar y analizar datos de manera efectiva
Colaborar con diferentes equipos para entender sus necesidades de datos y desarrollar soluciones analíticas que las satisfagan.
Proporcionar soporte y capacitación a otros usuarios en el uso de Power BI y herramientas relacionadas con Azure.




Requisitos mínimos:

Grado en Ingeniería, Informática, Telecomunicaciones.
Experiencia de 3 años en PowerBI, Dax, Modelado de datos, PowerQuery.
Dominio y conocimiento avanzado de Power BI para la creación de dashboards y reportes avanzados.
Conocimiento sólido en SQL y modelado de datos, transformación de datos y gestión de datos maestros.
Habilidades en análisis de datos y generación de informes.
Experiencia en la gestión y configuración del servicio Power BI.
Fuerte capacidad para escribir fórmulas DAX avanzadas para cálculos personalizados.
Conocimiento con distintos orígenes de datos, Business Central, SQL, Excel, API, etc
Nivel avanzado de inglés
Proactivo, tener una sólida comprensión técnica y ser capaz de colaborar eficazmente con diferentes equipos para lograr objetivos
Se ofrece sueldo acorde con las exigencias del puesto




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Ambiente joven y dinámico.
Empresa joven en plena expansión.
Posibilidades de crecimiento profesional.

Show more

Title: RISK/DATA ANALYST ANÁLISIS SECTORIAL Y SEGUIMIENTO DE GRANDES RIESGOS
Description:
Descripción del puesto: ¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos?

 

El departamento de seguimiento de grandes riesgos tiene como principales proyectos y funciones:

 

Análisis de carteras específicas, tanto a nivel cuantitativo como cualitativo, y realizar presentaciones a alto nivel y a órganos supervisores.
es).
Análisis y seguimiento sectorial.
Elaboración información mensual para establecer el perímetro de seguimiento de los grupos/empresas de grandes riesgos, así como, asignar su prioridad.
Extracción de información de triggers para la gestión proactiva de los mismos y seguimiento de acreditados individualmente significativos (Single Nam
Proporcionar información para la previsión escenarios de NPLs para perímetro análisis individual.
Participación en procesos de inspecciones supervisoras. 
Gestión de auditorías externa e interna vinculadas al ámbito de análisis individualizado.
Evaluación y gestión proactiva de cambios regulatorios. Análisis de impacto en la cartera crediticia y colaboración en la implantación de procesos que contribuyan al cumplimiento normativo. 
Dar respuesta a peticiones del supervisor referente a información relacionada con el seguimiento de grandes acreditados.
Seguimiento proyectos con sistemas de información para el mantenimiento, mejoras y desarrollo de nuevos proyectos relacionados con el seguimiento de grandes acreditados, grupos económicos, portfolios y sectores.
Descripción del perfil:

 

Requisitos mínimos

 

Titulación superior en matemáticas, ingeniería informática o ciencias económicas/empresariales.  Se valorará MBA, FRM o similares.
Inglés hablado y escrito
Se valorará experiencia profesional en el ámbito de Riesgos.
Compromiso con la formación y el desarrollo profesional. 
Capacidad de análisis, rigor y síntesis. 
Espíritu crítico, visión global y estratégica del cliente. 
Entusiasmo, compromiso e implicación en el trabajo. 
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo con habilidades de relación interpersonal.

 

Competencias clave

 

Dominio Office: Excel y power point.
Se valorará muy positivamente el uso de herramienta extracción de datos (SAS Enterprise Guide) y conocimientos en Qlik sense.
Conocimientos del ámbito de riesgos y habilidades técnicas para poder entender y gestionar las necesidades asociadas al análisis de carteras de grandes riesgos, así cómo, buen manejo de los datos asociados para llevar a cabo dichos análisis y elaborar presentaciones a alto nivel y a órganos supervisores.
Ofrecemos:

  

Formar parte del Banco más innovador en Europa Occidental 2021 según los premios The Innovators de la revista estadounidense Global Finance.
Desarrollar una carrera profesional interna.
Programa de onboarding y seguimiento de desarrollo profesional, con evaluaciones individuales.
Programa de desarrollo formativo individualizado. Acceso a nuestra plataforma online de formación con un amplio catálogo autoformativo, para que tu aprendizaje sea continúo.
Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales: seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ayuda de estudios y condiciones financieras preferentes.
Retribución flexible aplicada a transporte, formación, idiomas, entre otros.
Medidas de flexibilidad

Title: Prácticas Análisis de Datos BI - Académico
Description:
Desde EAE Barcelona, parte de Grupo Planeta, estamos buscando incorporar un/a estudiante para realizar prácticas de Análisis de Datos BI Académico e incorporarse en el departamento académico.

¿Cuál será tu principal misión?

Contribuir al análisis y visualización de datos para apoyar la toma de decisiones estratégicas en el departamento académico, mejorando la eficiencia operativa y la calidad de los procesos académicos.

¿En qué consistirá tu día a día?


Recolección y limpieza de Datos: Asistir en la recopilación y preparación de datos relevantes de diversas fuentes internas y externas (Atenea, Blackboard, Survey Monkey, etc), asegurando su precisión y calidad.
Apoyo al análisis de datos: Realizar análisis de datos para identificar tendencias, patrones y oportunidades de mejora en procesos académicos.
Apoyo al desarrollo de Informes y Dashboards: alimentar los informes y dashboards interactivos para visualizar datos y métricas clave, facilitando la interpretación de los resultados por parte del equipo académico y administrativo.
Apoyo a la automatización de procesos: Colaborar en la automatización de la recolección y análisis de datos para optimizar la eficiencia y reducir la carga manual de tareas repetitivas.



Requisitos:

¿Qué nos gustaría ver en tu CV?

Formación Académica: Estudiante en último año o recién graduado de Ingeniería Informática, Estadística, Matemáticas, Economía, ADE o estudiante de masters afines con un enfoque en análisis de datos.

Habilidades Técnicas:


Conocimiento básico o intermedio de Power BI, SQL.
Habilidades de programación: Familiaridad con lenguajes de programación como Python o R, especialmente para el análisis de datos.
Excel avanzado: Análisis de datos, tablas dinámicas, fórmulas complejas y gráficos.



¿Cómo nos gustaría que fueras?


Capacidad para analizar e interpretar datos
Pensamiento crítico y resolución de problemas
Trabajo en equipo
Proactividad y actitud de aprendizaje: Disposición para aprender nuevas tecnologías y metodologías en el campo de BI.
Atención al detalle: Precisión y meticulosidad en el manejo y análisis de datos



Si quieres empezar tu carrera con una oportunidad en el sector académico, ¡Inscríbete!

Title: Data Analyst Apprentice
Description:
Barcelona, Spain

Hybrid

We are looking for an apprentice specialized in data analytics. Join a dynamic team in a complex Supply Chain and work for a leading perfumery company. We'll need you to leverage data in order to optimize supply chain, drive efficiency and enhance decision-making. We offer the chance to join a worldwide company promoting careers internally.

At dsm-firmenich people are at the heart of the company. We are committed to equal employment opportunities and value diversity in the workplace.

Your Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and organize data related to the supply chain, including data on suppliers, inventory, capacity, and Row materials.
Support regional IBP & operational processes, including inventory and supply chain management, Supply Planning, process management across AMET and EUR region.
Analyze data using statistical methods and software such as PBI, VBA, Python, or SQL to identify trends and patterns in the supply chain.
Create visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders, including senior management, developing dashboards to track progress over time.
Identify areas for improvement in the supply chain, such as reducing lead times, improving inventory management, and cost saving.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs). Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in supply chain management and data analysis.


We bring


A rich history and a promising future of bold scientific innovation and passionate creation with our customers;
A space to grow by encouraging and supporting curiosity and an open mindset;
A culture that prioritizes safety and well-being, both physically and mentally;
A flexible work environment that empowers people to take accountability for their work and own the outcome;
Barrier-free communities within our organization where every employee is equally valued and respected – regardless of their background, beliefs, or identity;
A firm belief that working together with our customers is the key to achieving great things;


You bring


Master's degree in Statistics, Engineering, data scientist, or equivalent.
Critical thinking and proactive work style.
Analytical skills.
Pro-active, positive attitude, and willing to learn.
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, and other data analysis tools, to create and operate reports.
Knowledge is some code language software (SQL/ Python/VBA/M)
English is must, French/Spanish is a plus

Title: Controller Financiero/a y Analista de Datos
Description:
El/La candidato/a se responsabilizará de la preparación de informes financieros, la gestión de presupuestos y la implementación de controles internos para asegurar la precisión y la integridad de la información financiera. El/la controller financiero trabaja estrechamente con la alta dirección para apoyar la toma de decisiones estratégicas y garantizar la estabilidad financiera de la organización.




Responsabilidades Principales:




Planificación Financiera y Presupuestaria:




Realizar análisis de variaciones presupuestarias y proponer acciones correctivas.




Informes Financieros:




Preparar estados financieros mensuales, trimestrales y anuales.
Análisis de les diferencies en los reportings financieros, explicación y plan de acción y seguimiento del mismo.




Análisis Financiero:




Realizar análisis financieros detallados para apoyar la toma de decisiones.
Evaluar la rentabilidad de proyectos y propuestas de inversión.
Identificar y analizar tendencias financieras, riesgos y oportunidades.




Control Interno y Cumplimiento:




Implementar y mantener sistemas de control interno efectivos.
Asegurar el cumplimiento de políticas financieras internas y regulaciones externas.
Participar en auditorías internas y externas, y gestionar la implementación de recomendaciones.




Requisitos del Puesto:




Formación:




Título universitario en Contabilidad, Finanzas, Economía o campos relacionados.
Deseable un máster en Finanzas, MBA o certificaciones profesionales.
Conocimientos en automatización de procesos financieros utilizando scripts de Python.
Excel avanzado, incluyendo el uso tablas dinámicas y modelado financiero complejo (uso de Power Query valorado).







Experiencia:




Mínimo de 5 a 7 años de experiencia en roles financieros, preferiblemente en control financiero o auditoría.
Experiencia en el manejo y análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos mediante el uso de bases de datos (Access, SQL, u otros sistemas relacionados).
Experiencia en la integración de sistemas ERP con herramientas de análisis de datos para mejorar la eficiencia y precisión de los reportes financieros.







Conocimientos y Habilidades Técnicas:




Experiencia en el manejo y análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos mediante el uso de bases de datos (Access, SQL, u otros sistemas relacionados).
Conocimientos en automatización de procesos financieros utilizando scripts de Python.
Excel avanzado, incluyendo el uso tablas dinámicas y modelado financiero complejo (uso de Power Query valorado).
Familiaridad con herramientas de visualización de datos como Power BI o similares.
Experiencia en la integración de sistemas ERP con herramientas de análisis de datos para mejorar la eficiencia y precisión de los reportes financieros.
Capacidad para desarrollar y optimizar procesos automatizados que reduzcan errores y mejoren la eficiencia en la elaboración de informes financieros.
Orientación a la innovación tecnológica y mejora continua en el ámbito financiero.
Conocimiento profundo de principios contables y normativas fiscales.
Dominio de software financiero y de contabilidad puesto que se trabaja con gran volumen de datos. (ERP, Excel, etc.).
Nivel de ingles medio-alto (ser capaz de hacer reportings en inglés de y de explicarlos)
Capacidad para trabajar bajo presión y cumplir con plazos estrictos.
Acostumbrado/a a trabajar con varios departamentos. el candidato/a estará en estrecha colaboración con el controllers industrial y con el director financiero.
Deseable conocimientos de controlling industrial e involucración en el departamento administrativo financiero.




Competencias:




Pensamiento analítico y estratégico.
Orientación a resultados y atención al detalle.
Habilidad para resolver problemas y tomar decisiones.
Integridad y ética profesional.
Trabajo en equipo

Show more

Title: Business & Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Would you like to be part of an innovative company with a significant social impact? Innovamat is looking for someone like you 😎

About Our Company 🚀

Mission: To craft accessible math learning experiences based in math education research that foster conceptual understanding and student thinking. We aim to develop problem-solving, reasoning, creativity, and communication skills in learners, preparing them for meaningful contribution.

Traction: Innovamat aims to be a global institution in math education. We strive to bring the best math practices everywhere and for everyone. Over 2,100 schools, 430,000 students, and 18,000 teachers already work with us. Since our foundation in 2017, we have opened operations in Spain, Mexico, Italy, Chile, Ecuador, Colombia, Brazil, Peru, and in the United States. Backed by €20M in funding from Reach Capital, Kibo, and Bonsai, we are well-positioned to continue expanding and innovating in the education sector.

Product: Innovamat has developed a research-based, fully-resourced curriculum program. With Innovamat, kids from 3 to 16 years old learn math through manipulative materials and highly dynamic lessons focused on problem-solving, communication skills, and critical thinking. We provide a shift in traditional instruction and learning.

About Customer Success At Innovamat 🫱🏽‍🫲🏽

As a subscription-based company, Customer Success (CS) is our primary revenue driver. The dedicated guidance and commercial support we provide to teachers and schools are intensive, which is why our Customer Success team is over 100 professionals strong—making up more than a third of our entire company.

In recent years, our Global Customer Success team has been at the forefront of driving strategic initiatives worldwide. Our mission is twofold: to maximize student learning outcomes in mathematics and to grow the revenue of our existing business.

To achieve this, we have a dynamic Global CS team of Strategic Project Managers at our headquarters, who collaborate closely with the operational Heads of Customer Success who are leading the CS teams in each of our markets (the US, Spain, Italy, Mexico, and South America).

Identifying needs, crafting optimal and creative solutions to significant challenges, and implementing them on a global scale are the day-to-day tasks of our team.

Your mission🎯

As the ultimate owner of customer success data, you'll play a crucial role in Innovamat's Global Customer Success team, both strategically and operationally, helping to maximize and scale our impact. We believe that data analysis and insightful information are key drivers of success. You'll be responsible for measuring what truly matters and ensuring that this information is effectively utilized to make a tangible impact.

You Are Ready To 🏁


Understand and assess how our Customer Success teams (Key Account Managers, Team Leads, Customer Success Managers) operate, and assist them in making the best decisions based on data.
Analyze the impact of our product's implementation in schools and identify strategic opportunities to enhance this impact. Some key questions to explore include:
What factors contribute to a school's success with Innovamat?
Which data should be provided to a Key Account Manager to help them prioritize tasks effectively?
What user actions lead to a more satisfying experience with our product?
What drives deeper and more durable learning outcomes for students?
Define key performance indicators (KPIs) for usage, and develop dashboards and reports to optimize business performance through metric analysis. Report all this data to our leadership team.
Conduct both quantitative and qualitative data analyses to improve our forecasting models, maximize student learning, and reduce account churn.
Integrate business data with usage data.
Maintain regular communication with leaders across all Innovamat Business Teams to understand their needs and challenges.
Collaborate closely with our data engineering team to gain a deep understanding of our database structure.
Report directly to the Global Head of Customer Success and collaborate closely with other strategic project managers to tackle the challenges that arise.


What are we looking for? 🔍


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or similar (math, physics…)
Proven ability to work and interact in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment.
Multidisciplinary mindset: we are not looking just for a data analyst, we are looking for someone with data analysis skills and a business-driven mindset.
Out-of-the-box thinker and high level of self-initiative (self-motivated team player).
Knowledge of spreadsheets, SQL, databases, Python / R, and notions of statistical analysis or willingness to learn.
Ability to multitask and engage internal and external stakeholders through great communication skills.
You will be successful in this role if you are naturally curious and can collaborate cross-functionally, navigate through ambiguity, and are data-driven, organized, and detail-oriented.
Passionate about our mission, learning proposal,
Quick learner, and an eager beaver willing to be in a challenging environment.


What can you expect from Innovamat? 🤗


A professional development and growth plan in the fastest-growing company in Europe in its category 🌍
Freedom to take on as much responsibility as you dare, which will allow you to develop your career quickly.
Being part of a young, enthusiastic and dynamic environment ♻️
A culture of freedom, responsibility and constructive feedback 🤝
Full time with flexible working hours ⏰
Vacations during Christmas week 🎄
Group English classes as part of our working day 🗣️
Possibility of private health insurance with DKV 💊
Flexible remuneration with Cobee (food/transport) 💸
Team building days (🧗⚽📖 and more) and the InnovaGala at least once a year 🥳
Fruit every week to be full of vitamins and to keep our body healthy 🍉🍎🍐
Pet friendly 🐶
Belonging to a company accredited as happy at work 💃🏽
And all the coffee, water, milk and tea, separately or blended, that you can drink 😉
and if that's not enough, you will have the opportunity to transform the education sector and see more and more children rediscover and become passionate about mathematics 🙌.


If you think you are that person we are looking for we would love to meet you!
Show more

  • Possibility of private health insurance with DKV 💊

  • Fruit every week to be full of vitamins and to keep our body healthy 🍉🍎🍐

  • Belonging to a company accredited as happy at work 💃🏽

Title: BI Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
This role is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining business intelligence solutions using Microsoft Power BI. The role involves analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to provide actionable insights that support business decision-making and enhance organizational performance. The role also includes developing automated processes and integrating analytics to drive efficiencies and innovation. Effective communication and collaboration with business stakeholders are essential to ensure alignment and successful presentation of developed solutions.

Responsibilities


Develops and maintains Power BI reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate data-driven insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Analyzes complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business decisions.
Designs and implements automated data processing and analytics workflows to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Partners with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into actionable BI solutions.
Ensures data quality and integrity by implementing robust data governance and validation processes.
Collaborates with data engineering teams to build and maintain data pipelines, ensuring seamless integration of data from various sources.
Leads and mentors a team of BI developers, providing guidance, training, and support to junior team members.
Communicates project progress, challenges, and solutions to stakeholders effectively, ensuring alignment and timely delivery.
Represents the BI team in cross-functional projects, driving the implementation of BI solutions and ensuring their alignment with business objectives.
Continuously evaluates and improves existing BI methodologies, staying updated with the latest trends and technologies in the field.


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year or Graduate Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience.
Typically has 4-7 years of work experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related field, or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience.


Requirements


Python
AI/ML Knowledge


Knowledge & Skills


Microsoft Power BI
SQL (Programming Language)
Data Analysis
Data Visualization
Data Warehousing
Business Intelligence
Data Governance
Statistical Analysis
Effective Communication
Project Management
Stakeholder Management
Results Orientation
Learning Agility
Customer Centricity


Impact & Scope


Impacts multiple teams and may act as a team or project leader, providing direction to team activities and facilitating information validation and team decision-making processes.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

EXTE is a leading AdTech platform, specializing in video, content, and performance, offering advertisers the right audience in a safe and brand privacy-respecting environment. Based on patented AI technology, creative formats, and full-service offerings, EXTE is already the largest advertising platform in the Spanish-speaking world and aims to become a leading global player in the digital ecosystem. At EXTE, we have over 350 employees and offices in 17 countries.

Are you interested in joining our project?

What will you do?


Collect, analyze, and interpret data from online advertising platforms.
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor the performance of advertising campaigns.
Identify trends, patterns, and optimization opportunities based on the data.
Collaborate with the marketing team to provide actionable insights and recommendations.
Conduct A/B testing and other analysis methodologies to evaluate the effectiveness of different strategies and tactics.
Generate detailed reports that support strategic decision-making.
Ensure the quality and accuracy of the data used in analyses.


Will be Valued


Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Marketing, Economics, or a related field.
Courses or certifications in data analysis, Business Intelligence (BI), or related areas are a plus.
Minimum of 2-3 years of previous experience in data analysis, preferably in online advertising.
Experience in creating and managing dashboards and analysis reports.
Advanced knowledge of data analysis and visualization tools such as Tableau, Google Analytics, Excel, and other BI tools.
Familiarity with SQL and programming languages like Python or R is a plus.
English, Spanish


Desired Competencies:


Critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Solid knowledge of statistics and mathematics.
Proactivity and the ability to work in a dynamic and changing environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Results-oriented with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.


What´s it like to work at EXTE?


A challenging and rewarding work environment in a leading company specializing in Digital Advertasing
Permanent contract
Competitive salary
Flexible Compensation plan
Flexible work hours
Hibrid workplace
Opportunities for professional development and growth
Fruits and Coffe in the Office

EXTE is a leading AdTech platform, specializing in video, content, and performance, offering advertisers the right audience in a safe and brand privacy-respecting environment. Based on patented AI technology, creative formats, and full-service offerings, EXTE is already the largest advertising platform in the Spanish-speaking world and aims to become a leading global player in the digital ecosystem. At EXTE, we have over 350 employees and offices in 17 countries.

Are you interested in joining our project?

What will you do?

  • Collect, analyze, and interpret data from online advertising platforms.
  • Create and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor the performance of advertising campaigns.
  • Identify trends, patterns, and optimization opportunities based on the data.
  • Collaborate with the marketing team to provide actionable insights and recommendations.
  • Conduct A/B testing and other analysis methodologies to evaluate the effectiveness of different strategies and tactics.
  • Generate detailed reports that support strategic decision-making.
  • Ensure the quality and accuracy of the data used in analyses.

Will be Valued

  • Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Marketing, Economics, or a related field.
  • Courses or certifications in data analysis, Business Intelligence (BI), or related areas are a plus.
  • Minimum of 2-3 years of previous experience in data analysis, preferably in online advertising.
  • Experience in creating and managing dashboards and analysis reports.
  • Advanced knowledge of data analysis and visualization tools such as Tableau, Google Analytics, Excel, and other BI tools.
  • Familiarity with SQL and programming languages like Python or R is a plus.
  • English, Spanish

Desired Competencies:

  • Critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
  • Solid knowledge of statistics and mathematics.
  • Proactivity and the ability to work in a dynamic and changing environment.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Results-oriented with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

What´s it like to work at EXTE?

  • A challenging and rewarding work environment in a leading company specializing in Digital Advertasing
  • Permanent contract
  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible Compensation plan
  • Flexible work hours
  • Hibrid workplace
  • Opportunities for professional development and growth
  • Fruits and Coffe in the Office

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Techsoulogy is our way of doing things and our corporate brand that unifies a broad portfolio of specialist advertising, media, and entertainment firms. It combines the latest technology with a human-first approach and a constant exploration of knowledge in order to shape the media landscape.

At Techsoulogy we aim to provide a technology and human service that guarantee all areas of the advertising industry throughout the world achieving their goals profitably, effectively and ethically.

Our values drive our culture, which is the most important asset of our company.


We're fair
We're dedicated
We're honest
We're courageous
We're Team lovers


TAPPX with Techsoulogy

Tappx is a fast-growth AdTech company inside the Techsoulogy family. It delivers digital advertising solutions for multiple platforms including mobile, OTT/CTV and desktop.

Tappx’ proprietary technology empowers publishers to maximize ad revenues across mobile and OTT channels. It offers a distinct point of difference, technology which has been specifically engineered for mobile and OTT markets, thereby offering brands and agencies increased trust and transparency.

Tappx has headlined across numerous high profile competitive growth rankings such as Red Herring in 2016, TECH5 in 2018 and in 2020 Tappx was featured as Europe’s 2nd fastest growing advertising company in The Financial Times FT1000.

In Tappx we keep growing and, therefore, we are looking for new talented people to join our Data team in our IT department.

As a Data Analyst you will:


Analyze complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI, Data Studio, and Looker Studio.
Create clear and compelling data visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Ensure visualizations are tailored to meet the specific needs of different audiences.
Extract, clean, and preprocess data from various sources to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Work closely with business units to understand their data needs and provide relevant insights.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications for data projects.
Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of initiatives.
Ensure reports are accurate, consistent, and delivered on time.
Stay updated with the latest tools and technologies in data analysis and visualization.
Perform statistical analyses to validate hypotheses and support business case development.
Use statistical methods to quantify the impact of various strategies and initiatives.


Your Dream Job Awaits at Techsoulogy! 🚀

Indefinite Contract with Competitive Conditions

Flexible Working Hours (Take Control of Your Schedule) with core time

Hybrid Model in Barcelona (1 day in the office and the rest teleworking) or 100% Remote Work Anywhere in Spain

Cool HQ Offices in Barcelona and Co-Working in Madrid

Elevate Your Work Experience with Techsoulogy! 🌟

Private Health Insurance

Mental Health Care with 20 Free Hours of Psychologist Support

1&1 English or Spanish Language Lessons

Continuous Training & Development Budget

Healthy Snacks, Coffee and (a lot of) Tea (HQ)

Fun-Filled Arcade Room (HQ)

Team Building Activities Twice a Year

Inspiring Internal Talks and Events

Interesting Employee Referral Program

Engage in Techsoulogy’s CSR Initiatives

Flexible Compensation for Transport, Meals, and Kindergartens

Ready to shape your future? Join us! 🚀

#Techsoulogy #CareerPerks #JoinUsNow #WorkPerks #CareerGrowth

Requirements:

We are looking for if you have:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering and Science programs, Economics, or a related field
3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst in programming languages such as Python, PySpark and experience with data manipulation tools like SQL.
3+ years of experience in data analysis and reporting.
Experience integrating data from a variety of sources.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Experience in HTML and CSS is a plus.


Desirable:


Good at understanding data and extracting insights from it.
Pattern detection.
Fast learner, absorbs new domains quickly.
Proactivity.
Analytical mind.
Problem-solving aptitude.
Knowledge of Python, SQL and GCP.
Curiosity driven.
Result oriented

Title: Analista Power BI
Description:
En BETWEEN apostamos por el mejor talento dentro del sector tecnológico. Nos involucramos en una gran variedad de proyectos punteros, trabajando con las últimas tecnologías. Actualmente en BETWEEN contamos con un equipo de más de 800 personas.

Trabajamos en ámbitos como BI, IoT, Big Data e I+D. En el área de Operaciones implantamos proyectos de Service Desk, Infraestructuras IT y proyectos Cloud, entre otros.

Actualmente seleccionamos un Analista PowerBI para incorporarse de forma indefinida en uno de los equipos de I+D que Between tiene implantados en uno de nuestros principales clientes.

La persona seleccionada trabajará con el equipo de Data para la gestión de datos y generación de informes.

¿Qué haré? Estas serán tus funciones principales:


Te encargarás de realizar informes
Realizarás gestión de datos.



Formarás parte de dos equipos. Colaborando directamente con negocio en el departamento de Sostenibilidad y con el equipo de Data en el departamento de IT.

Si eres BETWEENER obtendrás estos beneficios:


Seguro médico con Sanitas.
Dispondrás de oportunidades de formación y desarrollo profesional: Idiomas, cursos en Udemy, Certificaciones, Programa The Power Business School y Bootcamps especializados (Agile, DevOps, IA & Big Data, Ciberseguridad, etc.).
Contarás con un equipo de Talento que te acompañará durante toda tu experiencia con nosotros. ¡Haremos un café una vez al mes! Así, mantendremos el contacto.
Pondremos a tu disposición un amplio abanico de retos y proyectos acordes con tus objetivos personales y profesionales.
Posibilidad de elegir cómo obtener parte de tu salario gracias a las ventajas fiscales de nuestra Retribución Flexible (Ticket restaurant, Ticket transporte, Ticket guardería).
Descuentos para acceder a centros de Fitness con Gympass.
Acceso a nuestro Club de Descuentos: Inspiring Benefits.
En BETWEEN nos gusta mucho hacer networking, por lo que te invitaremos a participar en todos estos eventos ¡y más!: las BETWEEN Nights, torneos deportivos, Black Mamba Race, viernes de vermut, juegos de mesa, etc.
Podrás disfrutar de nuestras fantásticas oficinas del 22@ las cuales disponen de Rooftop, tirador de cerveza, mesa de ping-pong y futbolín.
Programa de recomendación remunerado de Talento.
En BETWEEN, la igualdad de oportunidades es uno de nuestros valores. Nuestro compromiso es contratar al mejor talento independientemente de su religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades y promover su desarrollo profesional y personal.



Requisitos:

Imprescindible:


Excel avanzado
Manejo de PowerBI
Power Point u herramientas equivalentes para la gestión de presentaciones
Gestión y análisis de datos



SE REQUIERE DE VEHÍCULO PROPIO
Show more

Title: Finance Data Analyst - (100% remote-friendly within Spain)
Description:
We are the largest digital healthcare platform in the world, present in 15 countries and currently connecting over 30 million patients to more than 2 million healthcare professionals. We seek to make the experience in health more human and we live and breath this mission.


We obsess over the challenge of minimizing patients' pain and helping healthcare professionals thrive managing their patients and expand their online presence. Through services that bring health to users, we provide a space for questions, opinions and a way to find the health professional that best fits your needs.


To deliver the best result, we have motivated people with an innovative spirit, giving everyone the opportunity to actively contribute and grow within the company. The DocPlanner team is our secret sauce and for the 2nd consecutive year we were recognized as a Great Place To Work. We love diversity because each unique individual's perspective makes us stronger. We encourage everyone to participate in our hiring process. We’d love for you to bring your unique skill set and join the team!




Job Description



The resource, working within the Financial Reporting team, will play a key role in supporting the evolution of financial reporting in a challenging and stimulating environment. You will help bridge the gap between finance and BI. Our primary objective is to assist the business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing reports as the primary and most reliable source of information.


A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.


You will be an integral part of the Financial Reporting team, working closely with the Data Analytics team to support business decisions based on data.

How would you be impacting our mission


Financial Reporting and Analysis:
Track key financial metrics and KPIs, ensuring they align with organizational goals;
Develop and maintain comprehensive financial dashboards using advanced BI tools;
Provide detailed insights into financial performance, trends, and variances;
Provide insights for long-term strategic decisions;
Data Management and Integration:
Ensure accurate and timely collection of financial data from systems like Oracle NetSuite;
Integrate data from multiple sources for a unified financial view;
Performance Measurement:
Analyze profitability and cost efficiency to identify improvement areas;
Regulatory and Compliance Reporting:
Support audits and for regulatory documentation;
Automation and Process Improvement:
Automate repetitive financial tasks to improve efficiency;
Implement process improvements to reduce manual efforts and errors;
Enhanced Reporting and Visualization:
Utilize BI tools like Tableau for dynamic, interactive reports and dashboards;
Enhance report quality and accessibility beyond traditional spreadsheets.


Qualifications



What will help you thrive?


Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Strong written and oral communication skills in English; proficiency in other languages such as German, Spanish, and Italian is a plus.
Ability to gather, organize, analyze, and report large volumes of financial data with speed and accuracy.
Strong attention to detail with the ability to provide high-quality work efficiently.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to adapt and work in a quickly changing environment, managing competing demands.

Which skills are ‘bonus points’?


Master's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see the instant effects of your work.
Knowledge of ERP finance applications (Oracle, Oracle - NetSuite, SAP).
Relevant experience in accounting and financial reporting.


Additional Information



What will you get in return?


Let’s talk money


Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
Share options plan after 6 months of working with us

True flexibility and work-life balance


Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
Flexible working hours;
Paid time off according to your location of work;
Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first


Health insurance according to your location of work:
Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?


A 30-minute meeting with Ro - Head of International Talent Acquisition
SHL test
A 45-minute meeting with Nicolò Truffa - Head of Financial reporting
A 60-minute meeting Wiktor Kulikowski - Business Intelligence Manager including the live SQL testing
Business Case - Prepare a Business Case
Present it within the with Nico and Wiktor for 90 minutes
Meet the Team for 15 minute meeting

Please submit your CV exclusively in English.


We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.


“We believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.” Mariusz Gralewski, CEO
