Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?




We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile games studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games are positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, and they are played and loved by millions of fans all over the world. We are proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, and we are on a mission to offer a great gaming experience and bring fun to everyone! We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Analyst into our Analytics team, where you will be part of the Two Dots analytics team, work to understand our gamers’ behavior, and work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion. Applying quantitative analysis, data science, statistics & programming, you’ll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint . To truly make an impact you’ll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with analytics & game teams.







What will you do in Socialpoint?




Work with the game development teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions, turning our vast amount of data into actionable insights and transferable learnings.
Visualize and communicate the results of your analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Design and analyze A/B tests and other causal impact analysis to assess the impact of new features and changes.
Continuously educate stakeholders on data literacy and analytics best practices, to ensure they are empowered and autonomous to run analytically correct analysis.
Occasionally participate in advanced analytics projects, teaming up with other game data scientists & analysts to develop data tools and products.







Requirements




2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value.
A bachelor degree in a quantitative field (e.g Stats, Maths, Physics, Engineering).
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis.
Experience with A/B testing.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics. Prior experience with bayesian statistics is a plus.
Experienced creating dashboards and visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
Experienced designing and analyzing randomized experiments.
A fast learner, highly meticulous and proactive individual.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.







What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?




Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we have employed a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.

We have a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office so you are able to come into the office once a week or when you have important meetings/events.

Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already here).
An impressive 25 days annual leave, plus a week in December (not including public holidays).
Monthly meal allowance at the office. Breakfast, Lunch and snacks included.
Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons (English, Catalan & Spanish ).
Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
Players develop…Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!







Benefits




Coming to work in the office? Don’t worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:

State of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).
Amazing catering for Breakfast and Lunch with our specialty coffee
Wellness room.
Gaming room .







Intrigued? We’d love to hear from you. Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.




Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You’re welcome on the team no matter where you’re from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Title: Business Intelligence
Description:
En Palatin conectamos profesionales con nuevas oportunidades.




Nuestro cliente, una empresa internacional, está buscando un especialista en BI y Analítica de Datos para unirse a su departamento de Producto y Tecnología en su sede de Badalona.




La persona seleccionada será clave para impulsar nuestros proyectos de datos y analítica de negocio, desarrollando nuevos paneles de Business Intelligence (BI) en proyectos a medida.




Ubicación: Badalona, España. Modelo presencial.
Modelo: Contrato indefinido.




Responsabilidades:

Desarrollar proyectos de datos e incorporar herramientas ETL para gestionar la información entre sistemas.
Implementar, dar soporte y gestionar bases de datos analíticas.
Promover el uso de herramientas BI en toda la organización.
Desarrollar paneles de BI multipropósito y personalizables.
Revisar, modernizar y optimizar los actuales paneles BI.
Formar a usuarios internos en el uso de los paneles BI desarrollados.




Requisitos:

A partir de 3 años en posiciones similares, y conocimiento de herramientas de Azure Data Factory o Azure Synapse. Microsoft Power BI y Azure SQL.
Experiencia con herramientas cloud y metodologías ágiles.
Conocimientos en manejo de datos con Python.
CFGS o Graduado en Ciencias informáticas, Estádistica, Economía, Matemáticas o similar, muy valora certificación oficial en Microsoft Power BI (PL-300) o Data Engineering.




Si estás buscando una nueva oportunidad para desarrollar tu carrera en un entorno innovador y dinámico, ¡esta es tu oportunidad!




Comparte tu CV con nosotros.

  • Desarrollar paneles de BI multipropósito y personalizables.
  • Revisar, modernizar y optimizar los actuales paneles BI.
  • Formar a usuarios internos en el uso de los paneles BI desarrollados.


Requisitos:

  • A partir de 3 años en posiciones similares, y conocimiento de herramientas de Azure Data Factory o Azure Synapse. Microsoft Power BI y Azure SQL.
  • Experiencia con herramientas cloud y metodologías ágiles.
  • Conocimientos en manejo de datos con Python.
  • CFGS o Graduado en Ciencias informáticas, Estádistica, Economía, Matemáticas o similar, muy valora certificación oficial en Microsoft Power BI (PL-300) o Data Engineering.


Si estás buscando una nueva oportunidad para desarrollar tu carrera en un entorno innovador y dinámico, ¡esta es tu oportunidad!


Comparte tu CV con nosotros.

Title: Data Analyst II RTO (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Are you passionate about utilizing data to drive operational excellence? Join our Real Time Operations team as a Data Analyst and play a pivotal role in uncovering insights that optimize our global operations. If you thrive in fast-paced environments and want to contribute to reshaping real-time operations on a global scale, we're excited to hear from you.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with product managers, business operations, and data engineering to guide product in problem discoveries, monitor and give visibility of product metrics and KPIs.
Translate product and business questions into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Own end-to-end everything analytics related to real-time operations products development cycle, from data requirement gathering and opportunity sizing, to experimentation and post-launch impact analyses.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (A/B test, multivariate test, clustering, supervised learning, etc) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


+2 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in product facing teams
Experience with the application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide product-shaping insights
Excellent SQL skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Jupyter/iPython notebooks
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
Excellent spoken and written English


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Global Insights – Internship
Description:
This job is with Criteo, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.

What You'll Do

Criteo is in search of a passionate, highly motivated Intern to join our Insights & Marketing Analytics (IMAX) team in Barcelona. The IMAX team is a specialized, global team of insights and analytics professionals located in Barcelona. This global team is responsible for the insights that fuel Criteo-created content; the creation, execution, and analysis of customer, shopper, and marketer surveys; the analysis of Criteo’s own paid media; and the evangelization of data-driven methods and data storytelling across all of Criteo. While the IMAX team directly supports the needs of the global Marketing team, we also interface with commercially-facing teams (such as Sales and Account Strategy), with Criteo clients, and with the marketplace itself via conferences, via the press, and via industry influencers.

You will be working closely with the global Marketing team to create the insights that fuel our message in the marketplace. You will contribute to the analysis behind some of our most important pieces of recurring and ad-hoc thought leadership. You will see your work directly cited in the press, at industry conferences, and by our commercial teams. Examples of such work are available on our website.


Our Travel Reports at https://www.criteo.com/blog/global-travel-industry-trends-2024/
Our ROAS Trap Report at https://go.criteo.com/en/the-roas-trap/
Our Interactive Commerce Dashboard at: https://www.criteo.com/blog/commerce-trends-dashboard/
And many exclusive deliverables for internal teams, clients, analysts and reporters.


You’ll work closely with the IMAX and Content teams to turn Criteo’s extraordinary commerce dataset into market-facing insights. You will also directly support Criteo’s in-house surveys of customers, shoppers, and marketers, on a global basis. You will create, launch, and maintain interactive tools using Tableau (or other technologies) that allow the broader set of global Criteos to access your work at scale.

The position combines traditional technical data analytics work, including the use of SQL, Python, Excel, Tableau, with the “softer” part of data science: storytelling with data.

This position involves dealing with a considerable amount of complex, real-world data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking of new and innovative ways to analyze data and solve problems. The ideal candidate will be enthusiastic about data storytelling and embrace the concept of the “full stack” data analytics professional as a career choice.

What you will be doing


Develop automations in Python to increase department efficiency and allow projects to scale
Develop a deep knowledge of how to analyze trends across client, product groups, and verticals in all of Criteo’s global markets
Understand how Criteo creates data across various data stores (Vertica / Hive / Presto). Become a point person regarding the meaning of data and best practices around data access.
Contribute to new ways of using Criteo’s vast storehouse of data, including developing higher quality approaches to existing offerings as well as innovating to create new market-worthy content “from scratch.”
Liaise with other teams as needed, including non-IMAX Analytics, Product Marketing, Sales, and Account Strategy
Work with IMAX and Marketing team members to develop our strategic approach to content. Align our initiatives with Criteo’s overall direction and ensure that IMAX projects contribute to business results.
This role will also provide the opportunity to create custom tables in databases, to support IMAX data for the global Criteo analytics community, to own and maintain reports/code in Tableau, Python or other relevant technologies.


Who You Are


Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Economics, etc.)
Strong interest in combining analytical/technical skills with softer/communication skills
Strong interest in AI solutions such as ChatGPT,Cursor, Perplexity.
Relevant work experience, with skills being more important than the specific industry
Strong communication skills in English
Strong intellectual curiosity and ability to structure and solve difficult problems with minimal supervision
Understanding of how to extract data from relational databases (i.e. SQL), including data which spans multiple tables
Interest in internet advertising and, more broadly, in Marketing as a discipline.
Knowledge of business intelligence tools: Excel / PivotTables / Tableau
Some experience with Python, in both the context of creating automation and using Python for data analysis and visualization


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst - Account Management Operations (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

In this role you will be part of the Account Management Team at Glovo Headquarters, that is focused on growing and retaining Glovo partners. You will be directly responsible for overseeing, challenging and rethinking the data, business plan & processes of the post-sales operational landscape, based on solid data driven conclusions, so that they can be implemented on a global scale.

THE JOURNEY


Stakeholder management: Partner closely with senior sales leaders and cross functional partners to align on strategy
Communication: find simple ways to convey insights and recommendations from sophisticated analysis results to business leaders.
Data Analysis: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to interpret complex datasets; Analyze and report weekly and monthly metrics to identify trends and stop opportunities for improvement.
Process Optimization: leverage data analysis to analyze Account Management processes and lead the implementation of optimization strategies to drive efficiency and effectiveness in sales operations.
Automation: Design and implement automation solutions to remove manual processes.
Planning: Partner with Account Management leadership to set performance targets for local teams, recommend actions for improvement and work together to integrate positive changes within the operational environment.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or Engineering preferred.
4 years of work experience, outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably with 2 years in Sales Operations.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with analytics/ds libraries such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown
In-depth knowledge of BI tools such as Looker, Tableau, and practical experience analyzing data, program metrics, and performance
Ability to summarize and represent data (e.g., descriptive statistics and graphs).
Ability to create robust, insightful, and story-telling visualizations using modern BI & Analytics tools and ability to identify data Issues.
Familiarity with a collaborative environment and/or version control (GitHub, Git).
Ability to build hypotheses and test them (sometimes by piloting projects entirely)
Project management / coordination skills. Determined to get things done
Understanding of A/B test principles, to design, conduct and analyze different experiments.
You are eager to learn, hungry for knowledge, and want to work towards growing in your career from day one.
You are independent in solving problems within your capabilities and proactive in asking for support when the task is beyond your expertise


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst Intern, Emerging, EMEA
Description:
This job is with Criteo, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.

What You'll Do

As a member of our Performance Media Analytics team, you won't just analyse data; you'll be the cornerstone that connects groundbreaking ideas with real-world business applications. Here, your expertise will not only shape solutions but also empower our clients and commercial teams to make impactful decisions:


Client insights: you will analyze complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions.
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership teams
Tech Playground: Immerse yourself in an environment where experimenting with advanced analytics tools isn't just encouraged, it's part of your daily work.
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company.


Your Work Environment


Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!


Who You Are


A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (100% remote in Poland or Spain)
Description:
Welcome to the good side of tech 👋


You might have heard about us, but with a different name: Doctoralia. It all started 10 years ago, when we asked ourselves: is anyone in healthcare thinking about patients? We jumped in and we empowered patients by giving them access to leave and read reviews about their visit. We then provided doctors with the technology to manage bookings easily and save time, so they could devote themselves to what they always wanted: treating patients. And today is the day in which we ask you: will you join us in the next step of making the healthcare experience more human?


Docplanner at scale


We are leaders in 13 countries so far, and more than 90 million patients trust us every month. Almost 300.000 specialists believe in us and our product, and so do leading venture capital funds such as Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Asset Management and One Peak Partners. And yet, employing over 2.700 people all over the globe, we managed to keep the startup-mindset we started with over 10 years ago.




Job Description



Our primary objective is to assist business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing global reports as the primary and most reliable source of information. A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.


How would you be impacting our mission?


Derive facts from data and translate them into actionable insights and recommendations.
Support the business with identifying opportunities and making intelligent, data-driven decisions. You will execute end-to-end BI projects and be the main point of contact for the internal stakeholders.
Use (and develop!) a global database.
Create, automate and visualize reports and analysis for both top management and local teams (such as Finance, Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, Customer Experience).
When you become independent in the role you will have a chance to develop prediction/classification models using Python/R.
Work with Redshift, Git, Tableau, Airflow daily.



Qualifications



What will help you thrive?


Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Very good level of business English.

Which skills are ‘bonus points’?


Have a degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Are able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Are open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see instant effects of your work.
Are careful, diligent and detail-oriented.



Additional Information



What will you get in return?


Let’s talk money


Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
Share options plan after 6 months of working with us.

True flexibility and work-life balance


Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
Flexible working hours;
Paid time off according to your location of work;
Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first


Health insurance according to your location of work;
Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?


A 30-minute meeting with Rosario Corti - Head of International Talent Acquisition
A 60-minute meeting with Wiktor Kulikowski - BI Manager
Business Case - Prepare a Business Case and present it within the final chat (60 minutes) with Wiktor

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.


“We believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.” Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
Technical Skills

•             SQL expert, complex querying and also experience in maintaining and deploying databases,

•             Solid Python knowledge.

•             Java is a plus but not essential

•             Power BI and Excel: Expert in Power BI, particularly in creating and managing datasets.

•             Experience in data modeling for analytics.

•             Familiarity with predictive models

•             Good understanding of Data Architecture.

•             Experience with Azure products.

•             Clear experience in data science and data analysis rather than just familiarity or buzzwords.

•             Experience with Databricks and other advanced data processing platforms.




The key elements resource should have:

SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.

 

Technical Skills:

SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.
Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.
Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.
Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines

 

Certifications Needed:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.

Years of experience needed – 5+ Years

This role requires a strong understanding of SQL Server technologies, data integration tools, and reporting/analytics platforms.

Title: BI Analyst Intern
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Global Reporting Team's mission is to identify, define, produce, and automate sales/business/finance performance reporting portfolio. As the scope of the GRT is so wide, this is a unique opportunity not only to develop your technical skills, but also to learn more about different areas of our business and make an impact, while working in a fast paced environment.

Criteo and our stakeholders are constantly finding new ways to innovate, and our reporting suite is critical for tracking progress. As an intern, alongside the rest of the team you will be responsible for :


Working with stakeholder to analyze and understand their business needs to translate them into technical requirements
Building, running and updating existing reports based on the company needs and transformations
Exploring, validating and fixing data issues to provide high quality service to Criteos
Maintaining and improving processes (specification, procedures, and user training material).



Our objective is that by the end of the internship, you have developed the skills and experience to work in data.

Who You Are:


Degree from a business or quantitative field
Must be eager to learn, proactive and analytical
Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written)
You are versatile, self-driven, detail-oriented, and hands-on
You value teamwork and building rapport with individuals
You have a demonstrated interest in Internet and technology
Bonus: experience in Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, etc.), PowerPoint, SQL, and BI restitution tools such Power BI (or equivalent)



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.


Show more
HTML:
What You'll Do:

The Global Reporting Team's mission is to identify, define, produce, and automate sales/business/finance performance reporting portfolio. As the scope of the GRT is so wide, this is a unique opportunity not only to develop your technical skills, but also to learn more about different areas of our business and make an impact, while working in a fast paced environment.

Criteo and our stakeholders are constantly finding new ways to innovate, and our reporting suite is critical for tracking progress. As an intern, alongside the rest of the team you will be responsible for :

  • Working with stakeholder to analyze and understand their business needs to translate them into technical requirements
  • Building, running and updating existing reports based on the company needs and transformations
  • Exploring, validating and fixing data issues to provide high quality service to Criteos
  • Maintaining and improving processes (specification, procedures, and user training material).


Our objective is that by the end of the internship, you have developed the skills and experience to work in data.

Who You Are:

  • Degree from a business or quantitative field
  • Must be eager to learn, proactive and analytical
  • Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written)
  • You are versatile, self-driven, detail-oriented, and hands-on
  • You value teamwork and building rapport with individuals
  • You have a demonstrated interest in Internet and technology
  • Bonus: experience in Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, etc.), PowerPoint, SQL, and BI restitution tools such Power BI (or equivalent)


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Title: Data Analytics
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
¿Te gustaría trabajar en una empresa multinacional, consolidada y referente en la fabricación y venta de sistemas de fijación para el sector de la Construcción y Bricolaje?

¡fischer Ibérica es tu compañía! 🚀

Buscamos un/a Analista de Datos/Business Analytics para nuestra oficina en SC.

🎯 El proyecto:

Tu misión será apoyar a la dirección, al equipo de ventas y a las operaciones a través del desarrollo y mantenimiento de informes y dashboards que faciliten la toma de decisiones estratégicas y operativas, así como identificar oportunidades basadas en el análisis de los Datos, además de participar en el desarrollo de proyectos transversales de digitalización y de mejora de distintas áreas.

¿Cómo nos ayudarás a conseguir nuestra misión?


Desarrollar y mantener informes regulares: Crear y automatizar reportes semanales y mensuales para el resto de áreas de la empresa, facilitando información clave para la toma de decisiones.
Crear dashboards interactivos: Utilizar herramientas como Power BI para desarrollar dashboards que proporcionen una visión clara y concisa del desempeño de ventas, marketing, finanzas y operaciones.
Soporte a la red de ventas: Proporcionar herramientas e informes personalizados que permitan a los equipos de ventas maximizar sus esfuerzos y mejorar sus resultados.
Automatización de procesos: Implementar mejoras en los sistemas de bases de datos internas, utilizando programación en R o Python, para aumentar la eficiencia en la generación de reportes y análisis.
Análisis de datos de negocio: Realizar un análisis detallado de los datos para identificar oportunidades de mejora, tendencias de mercado y posibles áreas de crecimiento.
Colaboración con IT: Trabajar estrechamente con el equipo de IT para desarrollar herramientas y sistemas de información optimizados y alineados con las necesidades del negocio.



Requisitos del Puesto:


Formación en Estadística, Matemáticas, ADE, Economía o Ingeniería, con máster en Big Data.
Experiencia práctica en el desarrollo de casos de negocio.
Dominio de herramientas de análisis de datos como Power BI, Excel, y conocimientos básicos de programación en R o Python.
Habilidades de comunicación, empatía, organización y capacidad para trabajar en un entorno dinámico y de equipo.
Nivel de inglés B2 o superior.
Actitud proactiva y enfoque "hands-on" para resolver problemas y mejorar procesos.



Condiciones del Puesto:


Modalidad de trabajo flexible con opción a teletrabajo tras los primeros tres meses.



🏆 Razones para trabajar en fischer:


Salario competitivo
Posibilidades reales de carrera y desarrollo interno.
Seguro de Salud ADESLAS mediante retribución flexible.
Plan de referidos de 800€.
Día libre en tu cumpleaños.
Cheque nacimiento bebé.
Descuento en nuestros productos, y no son pocos.
Plataforma self-learning, para que crezcas tú y nosotros.
¡Team buildings anuales!



🥇 Para formar parte de nuestro equipo…

Es fundamental compartir nuestros valores: Humildad, proactividad, trabajo en equipo, inquietudes por aprender y tener una buena autodisciplina.

Si eres un/a profesional apasionado/a por los datos y el análisis de negocio, y quieres desarrollar tu carrera en una gran empresa…

¡Inscríbete!

"En fischer, estamos comprometidos con la igualdad de oportunidades de empleo independientemente del grupo étnico, religión, sexo, origen nacional, orientación sexual, edad, estado civil, discapacidad, género, identidad o expresión de género."

Title: B2B Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

About Our Organization:

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world’s largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America’s largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron’s, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor’s Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About the Team: Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies. About the Role:

The B2B Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

This role will primarily support the B2B side of the business, which includes Risk and Compliance, Factiva, Newswires, B2B Sales, Marketing, Content Licensing and Finance; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as Advertising and our Energy lines of business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. This position will report to the Manager of B2B Analytics.

You Will

Develop Stakeholder Partnerships


Develop strong partnerships with Product Proposition, Product Management, Marketing, B2B Sales, Content Licensing, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2B Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
Executie data project roadmaps based on the B2B Business teams’ priorities.


Understand B2B Data


Build a thorough understanding of all the B2B data sources that we leverage in our Analysis projects
Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and consistently organize data.


Conduct Analysis, Create Dashboards, Improve Processes & Ensure Quality


Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau)
Continuously identify ways to improve and streamline processes around data and reporting
Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency


Clearly Communicate


Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences


You Have


Team oriented and collaborative with eagerness to help others, and aspiration to be challenged and learn
Self starter able to work independently, coordinate with multiple partners and complete projects start to finish
Detail oriented with focus on assuring quality, consistency and accuracy in data and processes
Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience, preferably in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
Experience working with large datasets in a fast-paced and fluid environment with the ability to understand and solve complex non-routine problems.
Experience with data visualizations tools and techniques, and using data to tell a story (e.g. Tableau, Looker)
Extensive experience with SQL, and familiarity with Excel/Sheets, Github, Python/R
Experience with ETL processes and cloud-based or traditional tools (AWS experience a plus)


Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Business Area: Dow Jones - Experience - Data & AI

Job Category: Data Analytics/Warehousing & Business Intelligence

Union Status

Non-Union role

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

If you are a current employee at Dow Jones, do not apply here. Please go to the Career section on your Workday homepage and view "Find Jobs - Dow Jones." Thank you.

Req ID: 42408

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About the Company

Stäubli is a global industrial and mechatronic solution provider with four dedicated Divisions: Electrical Connectors, Fluid Connectors, Robotics and Textile serving customers who aim to increase their productivity in many industrial sectors. We are an international Group that currently operates in 28 countries, with agents in 50 countries on four continents. Our global workforce of 5,700 shares a commitment to partnering with customers in nearly every industry to provide comprehensive solutions with long-term support. Originally founded in 1892 as a small workshop in Horgen/Zurich, Switzerland, today Stäubli is an international Group headquartered in Pfäffikon, Switzerland.




About the Role

Stäubli is looking for a qualified Business Intelligence Analyst in our Electrical Connectors Division based in our Office in Sant Quirze del Vallés(Barcelona)




Responsibilities

Responsible for the creating and maintaining Periodic Reports for Supply Chain Officers/Specialists.
Further development and optimization of BI-Tool Qlik for ECS specific needs (e.g. planning, controlling, reporting, front-end-dashboarding, end-user-training), coordination with ECS internal stakeholders, Corp. IT and Corp Controlling in order to gather needs, design and create Qlik front-end reports.




Goals of the position

Support the Supply Chain Management teams in specifying, developing, and maintaining their Report Structure in Qlik Sense.
Improve transparency and response time in all topics regarding Business Intelligence, with specific focus on Supply Chain Management.




Main tasks

Sales Tracking
Design (based on stakeholder mapping activities), create and optimize both standardized & custom reports.
Provide decision-making input to the management team, head of business, business development and product management.
Ensure data quality, data accuracy and timely and targeted reports within ECS perimeter and to interfaces to other proprietary systems and corporate functions e.g., Corporate Finance, Corp. HR, Corp. SCM, Corp. IT
Be an integral link between the headquarter and the local SCM organizations.
Sparring partner for the business units in the definition, development and implementation of front-end-reports in Qlik.
Support management with ad hoc business analysis and reporting
Design, build-up and maintain Fron-End-Reporting with Qlik
Responsible for the implementation of BI tools (Qlick Sense)
Continuous optimization of existing BI-tool based solutions
Assess future needs (stakeholder mapping), requirements specifications and data quality




Job requirements




Requirements / Education

Bachelor or University degree in business information technology, engineering or similar, preferably with a focus on Supply Chain Management
One to two years of experience with Business Intelligence software (QlikSense, Tableau, Power BI);
Customer orientation and creative problem-solving skills based on analytical thinking.
Proven ability to work independently and carefully. Is well trained to work in a project environment in a structured, goal-oriented and timely manner.
Passion for data analysis, data modeling and front-end-reporting (e.g. Qlik sense) and drive with a strong desire to make things happen




IT skills

Extensive experience in reporting systems and MS Office – especially Excel
Sound user knowledge in SAP (PP/MM)
Experience and knowledge in Business Analysis and Project Management.
Knowledge in Structured Query Languages (SQL);




Language(s)

Fluent in English & Spanish, spoken & written (German is a bonus)

Title: Digital Data Analyst
Description:
Somos DDB, somos creadores de ideas.

Ayudamos a nuestros clientes a ser líderes.

Trabajamos con ellos como socios estratégicos.

Nos sumergimos en el negocio de nuestros clientes y buscamos soluciones creativas.

Iniciamos y mantenemos vivo el diálogo de las marcas con el consumidor.

Creamos ideas con trascendencia social porque sólo así tendremos relevancia.

Perfil

En DDB buscamos un/a Data Analyst para que forme parte de nuestro equipo en la oficina de Barcelona.

Responsabilidades


Exploración de datos y creación de informes
Análisis web y entorno digital
Visualización de datos y dashboards en:
Adobe Analytics
Google Analytics y Data Studio
Otros
Estudios de consumidores, comportamiento digital, journey de usuarios, navegación y usabilidad
Segmentación y perfilado de usuarios/consumidores
Búsqueda de data para obtención de insights y generación de recomendaciones
Marketing digital para industria automoción

Requisitos


Performance de campañas Paid (especialmente SEM/Display/Programática)
Análisis de performance en social media.
Estrategia SEO
Set up/mantenimiento de Google Tag Manager
Modelos de atribución y fases de funnel
CRM
Definición de KPIs y métricas relevantes
Conocimiento entornos digitales, especialmente web
Orientación a obtención de insights estratégicos
Habilidades de presentación y comunicación


Todas las candidaturas serán consideradas para el empleo, independientemente de su raza, orientación sexual o edad.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Modelo de trabajo híbrido: días presenciales en la oficina combinados con días de teletrabajo.

Ambiente de trabajo creativo y dinámico donde podrás desarrollar todo tu talento y podrás crecer personal y profesionalmente.

Nuestro programa DDB Concilia, con beneficios exclusivos por pertenecer a DDB, además de programas de bienestar emocional con servicios personalizados.

Todo esto y mucho más. ¿Te vienes?

Tu información personal se utilizará de acuerdo con nuestro Aviso de Privacidad. Puedes leer nuestro Aviso de Privacidad aquí cuando presentes tu solicitud.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Intern - Regional Operations (They/He/She)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.


We have an ‘’office-first’’ culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do!
We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don’t shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift!
We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!).
We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work.


💪Our career development philosophy.


We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential.
We take ownership of our career development. We don’t believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams!
We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope.


🤝Our commitment to being a force for good.


Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact.
We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives.
We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.


We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Glovo is looking for an Data Operations intern to work in our team in Barcelona. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Do you want to evolve in one of the fastest growing Start-ups of Europe, building a product that will change people's day-to-day and disrupt the on-demand market.

THE JOURNEY


Analyze data generated by our core operations in order to improve our stakeholder experience (Couriers, Users and Partners);
Come up with data insights to help improve most important KPIs for the whole Country (e.g., Delivery time, Cancellations, efficiency, Cross departmental projects... );
Proactively spot inefficiencies, understand root causes and propose data driven actions;
Process standardization: Improve processes on behalf of Glovers through projects (when necessary)
KPIs tracking: Manage scheduling, attendance and general administration of Info-Sessions while supporting daily operations through operational supervision and analysis of KPIs ∙ Communicate effectively with the local Operations Manager on customer support processes and operations
Work close with the other departments to monitor any structural process optimization;
Give life to your craziest ideas and have an immediate impact thinking out of the box!


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor in Engineering, Maths or any technological domain
Passionate about analytics: you enjoy deep diving into problems to find the root cause
Problem-solving skills: no problem is too small or too big
Excel proficiency
Experience in SQL is a must
Professional English
An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more

Title: BI Analyst (Power BI) - Hybrid Work
Description:
At Oxigent Technologies we are looking for a BI Analyst to join a leading International Digital Hub in providing solutions for a world leader retail company, located in the centre of Barcelona.




As a BI Analyst Hybrid you will interact with big data engineers, software developers and business experts such as other BI Analysts to understand both: business needs and technical requirements. Your mission will be to provide a solution that helps business partners to achieve their goals and stay aligned with the international strategy.




Responsibilities:

Dashboard development and maintenance in an international project
Design and development of efficient models from a data warehouse
ETL development needed to feed models.
Script development to load data.
Build apps and or objects in Power BI (DAX).
Work on dashboard refreshes’ plan.
Document processes, data structure, content, and models from both technical and business point of view.




Essentials:

Necessary skills: Power BI (DAX), databases and advanced SQL
Experience working with big volumes of data.
Nice to have experience or knowledge in Snowflake, DBT, Azure Databricks, Spark, Python, Scala and agile methodologies (SCRUM)
Open minded attitude to changes and grow
Languages: English (C1 level)




Our Stack:

DBT
Airflow
Snowflake
Power BI
Databricks
Delta Lake
Microsoft Azure
Azure DevOps




We offer you:

Permanent contract.
Salary according to the experience provided (35.000 – 38.000 euros gross per year approx.)
International and multicultural environment.
Hybrid work model (8 days in office per month but very flexible).
Training vouchers.
Private medical insurance.
Special discounts on fitness and sport facilities.
Tax reduction: you will be able to dedicate part of your gross salary to different options such as transport, ticket restaurant, education, kindergarten, and health insurance.
And many more benefits!

Title: Data Analyst II RTO (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Are you passionate about utilizing data to drive operational excellence? Join our Real Time Operations team as a Data Analyst and play a pivotal role in uncovering insights that optimize our global operations. If you thrive in fast-paced environments and want to contribute to reshaping real-time operations on a global scale, we're excited to hear from you.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with product managers, business operations, and data engineering to guide product in problem discoveries, monitor and give visibility of product metrics and KPIs.
Translate product and business questions into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Own end-to-end everything analytics related to real-time operations products development cycle, from data requirement gathering and opportunity sizing, to experimentation and post-launch impact analyses.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (A/B test, multivariate test, clustering, supervised learning, etc) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


+2 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in product facing teams
Experience with the application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide product-shaping insights
Excellent SQL skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Jupyter/iPython notebooks
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
Excellent spoken and written English


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
