Title: Full Stack Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

We are looking for a talented data analyst with data science skills, expertise in ETL and DataViz solutions. You will lead dashboard projects from End-to-End in cyber security risk management, collect, analyze, and interpret data sets to create visual representations that provide information and support data-based decision making.

Also, the candidate will work closely with the other departments and entities within Cyber to identify business needs, design effective data models, develop and maintain dashboards using PowerBI, Tableau, Dataiku and PostgreSQL for data processing and analysis.


Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject. 
+3 years of experience as data Analyst, developing Dashboard and DataViz.
Knowledge of algorithms is a plus and will enable the candidate to be a force for proposing useful content related to cyber security risk management.
Expertise with PowerBI, Tableau, Dataiku, PostgreSQL and ETL tools (e.g., Tableau Certified Data Analyst, Dataiku Advanced Designer Certificate).
Experience with other data visualization tools such as PowerBI.
Basic Python skills.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Fleet Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Job Description

Join Us to Shape the Future of Mobility!

Ready to make a difference? Join our ambitious Lisbon team and enhance our fleet’s cost efficiency. We’re looking for a hands-on expert to drive analytics in our “Fleet Steering & Systems” team. Your role: ensure quality data, collaborate with business leaders for insights, implement smart reporting, and support automated decisions across our operations.

DO WHAT YOU LOVE:


Lead a key focus area in our fleet analytics team, managing data for over 100,000 vehicles across Europe.
Impact business decisions with short decision paths, working directly with VPs and cross-functional leaders.
Recommend optimal technical solutions to enhance analytics and ensure a data-driven advantage.
Benefit from 360° development, gaining a holistic view of fleet management and learning from our Lisbon data science community.
Collaborate with innovative colleagues in Lisbon and Munich.


Qualifications

COME AS YOU ARE:


Driven and ready to take full ownership in a dynamic environment where trust and responsibility go hand in hand.
Experienced in analytics, with strong skills in SQL and AWS Quicksight.
Passionate about the mobility industry with relevant experience.


Additional Information

YOUR BENEFITS:

Working at SIXT not only means creating the future of mobility, but also offers personal benefits. This means especially for you: 28days of vacation, no dress code, a hybrid working model andflexible working hours.In our modern office,with new equipment, you can stock up on coffee at any time and spend your lunch break with colleagues in the on-site restaurantthat provides healthy and delicious food for everyone.

Moreover, we offer you a super international working environment, numerous trainingsfor your individual development, participation in external conferences and we even organize internal dev & tech talks. It is very important to us that you can develop personally and grow within our company.

Furthermore, you can benefit from our Coverflexadvantage system. With this system you can selectthe benefits you want- This way you can decide for yourself what you want to use your benefits for!

In addition, your colleagues are pretty awesome. Which is important when you spend so much time together, and besides, no wonder when you get a bonus for referring friends as new employees. Otherwise, we live "work hard, play hard" - our parties are legendary! We also demand and promote DiverSIXTy, a corporate culture of acceptance, appreciation, and respect, in which everyone can develop their personality and ideas.

About us:

We are a leading global mobility service provider with sales of €3.07 billion and around 9,000 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (cab, driver and chauffeur services), SIXT+ (car subscription) and gives our customers access to our fleet of 222,000 vehicles, the services of 1,500 cooperation partners and around 1.5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,098 rental stations. At SIXT, a first-class customer experience and outstanding customer service are our top priorities. We focus on true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Want to take off with us and revolutionize the world of mobility? Apply now!

We are a leading global mobility service provider with sales of €3.07 billion and around 9,000 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (cab, driver and chauffeur services), SIXT+ (car subscription) and gives our customers access to our fleet of 222,000 vehicles, the services of 1,500 cooperation partners and around 1.5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,098 rental stations. At SIXT, a first-class customer experience and outstanding customer service are our top priorities. We focus on true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Want to take off with us and revolutionize the world of mobility? Apply now!

Title: Data Driven | Data Scientist/Data analyst
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

We are creating a new role of Data scientist /Data analyst as Artificial intelligence (AI) and data science are a lever for improving the group's processes. The major challenge for the Data scientist/ Analyst daily is to ensure business development, the improvement of the customer experience and operational efficiency including controls. To do this, it must support the transformation in terms of processes or pathways by industrializing models.  

Extracts and analyses data to provide information that allows the company to better manage its activities and anticipate its future needs.
Monitor and coordinate the implementation of recommendations and local initiatives.
Build relevant data-driven insights and analyses to prepare and support business and operation decisions.
Communicate and present the conclusions of your analysis to other departments of the company through different forms (reports, dashboards, presentations).
Define relevant KPls to monitor performance and build dashboards.
Keep up to date with internal projects on artificial intelligence and analytics, to promote their work to PCMO on both the business and technological aspects.                                                              
Identify use cases that bring value to the regions' operational platforms.
Manage an AI project from start to the end. From identification of the needs to industrialization. This means framing the project, setting objectives and deliverables, monitoring IT & AI developments and governance, and ensuring that milestones are met.
Make the link between all the stakeholders in the ecosystem of a project (IT, Business, Data Scientists, etc.


Qualifications


IT language of his entity or project (Python and Other languages).
ETL (Alteryx, Dataiku).                                               
Data visualization: Power BI.                                               
MS Office Pack.     
English: Fluent.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
About Capgemini Engineering

Hi there

We are Capgemini Engineering. A brand part of the Capgemini Group.

We have the mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, diversity, inclusion, a purpose of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world.

You can help us to achieve our mission!

Now, we have more than 270,000 team members in nearly 50 countries, in sectors such as aeronautics, automotive, communications, energy, life sciences, software & internet, space & defense and consumer products.

Your Mission

You will be part of a central data enterprise team within the data technology pillar that aims at building the best data technology solutions for the client. You will work with other engineers and product teams to create the best-in-class data platform with leading capabilities to support the business solve the most critical challenges through data solutions.

Your Role


Design, develop, and maintain scalable and efficient data-centric applications and systems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement new features and enhancements in cloud environments like AWS, GCP, or Azure.
Design, build, and optimize data pipelines ensuring reliability, scalability, and compliance with industry standards.
Conduct thorough data analysis, modeling, and interpretation to drive insights and support decision-making processes.
Create and maintain ELT/ETL processes, focusing on data quality, reliability, and efficiency.
Evaluate, recommend, and implement improvements in data infrastructure and methodologies to reduce costs and enhance performance.
Support ongoing AI & Analytics operations and systems, interpret trends
Communicate findings, proposals, and technical solutions effectively to diverse stakeholders.
Team work in a data-driven, solution oriented and critical mind-set is greatly encouraged and valued.
Profiency in English is greatly valued


Your Profile


At least 2 years of experience in data engineering roles with expertise in building and maintaining data pipelines, systems, and applications.
Proficient in data warehouse design, implementation, and optimization, leveraging ETL/ELT processes, schema modeling, and ensuring efficient data retrieval for analytical purposes.
Proficient in at least programming/querying languages used for data engineering such as Python and SQL, NoSQLs, or similar languages.
Knowledge and Hands-on experience either with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure), or in Linux OS
Strong understanding of data modeling, both SQL and NoSQL, with expertise in distributed systems design.
Experience with big data technologies such as Spark or other distributed processing technologies
Familiarity with tools for workflow orchestration such as Airflow
Knowledge of data governance, metadata management, and best practices in ensuring data quality and compliance.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively in cross-functional teams.
Analytical mindset, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills to address complex data challenges.
Familiarity with Standard AI/ML processes & operations is greatly valued.
Degree in computer science, software engineering, or other engineering domains.
Proficiency in English is mandatory. Additional languages are an advantage.
Show more

Title: Personal Data Protection Analyst
Description:
Job Description



Hybrid model in Lisbon


Job description:


The Personal Data Protection Analyst is expected to lead daily GDPR business-as-usual duties within 1st Line of Defense (1LoD), supporting CIB clients in achieving their objectives in terms of compliance with Privacy by Design principles and other data protection requirements, in close interaction with the CIB Central Data Office, the SPOC network (1LoD) and the DPC/ DPO network (2LoD).





Main Tasks:


Ensure CIB project validation processes comply with Privacy by Design principles, and
supporting Project Managers on their data protection activities"
Manage incoming external and internal requests in the outlook inbox CIB GDPR DESK,
including Data Subject Rights Requests"
Publish the CIB GDPR DESK periodic report and manage a dedicated SharePoint space
Contribute to disseminate a culture of personal data protection within CIB
Develop and share best practices with the data protection network






Qualifications



Technical Skills:


Full proficiency of MSOffice suite
Proficiency of project management tools and methodologies




Language Skills


Fluent English (C1-C2)




Soft Skills:


Excellent writing, communication and interpersonal skills
Attention to detail and high sense of rigor and organization
Ability to synthesize and simplify complex concepts to a senior audience
Proactiveness and ability to leverage on transversal networks
Ability to work in a changing environment / Adaptability

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d) Ancillaries
Description:
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d) for our Ancillaries Product Portfolio. Join our dynamic team in a fast-paced environment where every day brings new challenges and opportunities! In this critical role, you will work on a wide range of interesting tasks to actively support the business team in the revenue optimization process. The role is focused on driving our Ancillary Products to the next level by identifying new opportunities, managing the optimization of existing products as well as analyzing current performance and deriving actions. If you are passionate about working in a collaborative atmosphere and are ready to tackle intricate challenges head-on, we would love to hear from you! This position is available in Lisbon.

Your job - paint the world green


You create data analyses and models as a basis for decisions on the further development and optimization of our product offering.
You support in the development of the dynamic Ancillary Pricing concept and develop business rules as well as alert systems for price control.
You enjoy your creative freedom in developing solution concepts for problems and proactively work with product experts, BI and the agile development teams to identify suitable data sources, collection methods and data connections and ensure high data quality.
You define A/B tests including set-up and analyze results and derive actions.
You actively drive automation processes forward.
You communicate and present analytical approaches and results in a way that is appropriate for the target group.
You interact regularly with different types of stakeholders from our and other departments.


Your profile - ready to hop on board


Degree in business administration, mathematics, statistics, social sciences, business informatics, economics or similar
You have at least 5 years professional experience as Business Analyst, Data Analyst or data scientist, and are ideally familiar with the analysis of digital products
You are an expert context-switcher who thrives in an environment working on numerous different types of projects and tasks each day
You are experienced with A/B Test definition, set-up and especially analysis, used to work with CVR data, MDE etc.
You are an expert in SQL, Snowflake and python are a plus
You are familiar with common methods and tools for cleaning and merging different data sources as well as data preparation and visualization
You have solid experience in Excel and Power Point
You have excellent analytical skills and make decisions based on data.
You have a deep-dive mentality and enjoy developing creative solutions to solve problem statements
You are strongly driven, self-organized and highly reliable
You enjoy working with internal and external stakeholders, managing multiple projects and workstreams .
You like working in an international team and contributing to team development.
You speak fluent English, any other language is a plus.


Our Perks – More than just a job


You have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are creating the easiest way to travel. We want your ideas and give you autonomy to make them reality.
Flix is flexible. Organize your own schedule with trust-based hours and up to 60 days of working from (m)anywhere. We are an office-first company, and we encourage all employees to come regularly to their local office.
Travelling is our passion. Discover the world with your free Flix rides and bring along your friends and family for half price.
Teamwork makes the dream work. Our FlixTeam has people from over 80 different nations. We work in a multicultural environment where we can challenge and support each other.
We're not only green in color. We’re building for the long term, and that means protecting our planet. We constantly test new green technologies and compensate for the CO2 after all our business travel since 2018.
Your well-being is important to us. To treat your mind and body we will give you a competitive paid time off package, mental health support including 1:1 consultations with a psychologist, and a neat discount on UrbanSportsClub memberships.


Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you! We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply.

About Flix

We are a global mobility provider with headquarters in Europe and the United States. Since 2013, we have changed the way millions of people have traveled, offering new alternatives for convenient, affordable and eco-friendly travel. Thanks to a unique business model and innovative technology, we have quickly established one of the largest long-distance mobility networks in the world – and our journey has just begun.

Flix is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.

Title: Data & Risk Analyst
Description:
Autonomy|Strong Career Path


About Our Client

Our client is a multi-line MGA focused on specialty lines of business including Treaty, PI, D&O and Surety insurance and reinsurance cover. Founded in London in 2012, it has grown to handle $120m in gross written premium, with a team of 18. Post-Brexit, our client has set up an office in Lisbon to write EU business.

Job Description


Utilize a variety of software tools and data sources to analyze premium, claims and exposure trends
Create, design and produce regular and ad hoc MI packs
Produce key management information (internal and external)
Working closely with the underwriting team to gather MI
Assisting in the business planning process
Assisting in the reinsurance buying process
Undertake reconciliation exercises with capacity providers
Cross departmental data infrastructure optimization, i.e. driving the data integrity and quality across all aspects of the business that impact the treaty division


The Successful Applicant


A minimum of 3 years Insurance exposure (mandatory)
Database skills (e.g. MS Access, SQL) and/or experience with/willingness to learn reporting software (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, MS Reporting Services or similar)
Scripting skills (e.g. VBA, R) - interesting to have
Strong planning and organizational skills


What's on Offer

Contact: Goncalo Castelbranco

Quote job ref: JN-082024-6517205


Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m / f / d)
Description:
Location

hybrid in Lisbon (3 home office days per week)

SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in data privacy and privacy-led marketing solutions. We believe there is no need for a trade-off between growth and privacy compliance. Our vision is to unlock the potential of data privacy to empower a thriving digital ecosystem. We work with companies to create a healthy balance between data-driven business and privacy-led marketing for every size of enterprise. Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We are looking for a self driven, curious, and analytical individual to join as a Senior Data Analyst. You will work with cross functional teams to help solve complex business problems and draw relevant insights by leveraging data, building scalable processes, and compelling visualization. Your interventions are backed by compelling storytelling capabilities that are built on the back of a deep understanding of our commercial insights.

Your Tasks


Partner with our business stakeholders, product and tech teams to define complex and ambiguous problems and solve them with data
Develop innovative analytical methodologies to answer strategic business questions across the organization that helps us become more data-driven
Relentlessly challenge the status quo and uncover business patterns in our processes to drive efficiency, speed, quality, and cost savings
Demonstrated success working with executives at the most senior levels, developing an analytics roadmap, and providing recommendations that direct business strategy and achieve high impact results


You Bring


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience ideally in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Quantitative, Physics, Engineering, etc.) preferred
Background in strategy consulting and/or tech scale ups, SaaS
5+ years in SaaS B2B preferred
5+ years of work experience in SQL/Python and data visualization & business intelligence tools (ideally PowerBI) to communicate business insights using data
Intellectually curious, high energy, and strong work ethic; passionate about working with, normalizing, and synthesizing large amounts of data into actionable insights
Process-oriented with strong organizational and communication skills
Ability to identify and succinctly summarize roadblocks and constraints, propose potential solutions, and drive towards resolution
Fluency in English with strong verbal and written communication skills


Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Usercentrics we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Why join Usercentrics?


Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we’re happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being


About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths — so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.
Show more

Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We are looking for a self driven, curious, and analytical individual to join as a Senior Data Analyst. You will work with cross functional teams to help solve complex business problems and draw relevant insights by leveraging data, building scalable processes, and compelling visualization. Your interventions are backed by compelling storytelling capabilities that are built on the back of a deep understanding of our commercial insights.

Your Tasks

  • Partner with our business stakeholders, product and tech teams to define complex and ambiguous problems and solve them with data
  • Develop innovative analytical methodologies to answer strategic business questions across the organization that helps us become more data-driven
  • Relentlessly challenge the status quo and uncover business patterns in our processes to drive efficiency, speed, quality, and cost savings
  • Demonstrated success working with executives at the most senior levels, developing an analytics roadmap, and providing recommendations that direct business strategy and achieve high impact results

You Bring

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience ideally in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Quantitative, Physics, Engineering, etc.) preferred
  • Background in strategy consulting and/or tech scale ups, SaaS
  • 5+ years in SaaS B2B preferred
  • 5+ years of work experience in SQL/Python and data visualization & business intelligence tools (ideally PowerBI) to communicate business insights using data
  • Intellectually curious, high energy, and strong work ethic; passionate about working with, normalizing, and synthesizing large amounts of data into actionable insights
  • Process-oriented with strong organizational and communication skills
  • Ability to identify and succinctly summarize roadblocks and constraints, propose potential solutions, and drive towards resolution
  • Fluency in English with strong verbal and written communication skills

Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Usercentrics we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Why join Usercentrics?

  • Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
  • Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
  • Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
  • Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
  • We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
  • You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we’re happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being

About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths — so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We're building the future of advertising and are looking for innovative minds to help us do it.

Darkroom is a vertically integrated digital agency pioneering the next generation of consumer-facing brands. A category leader in results-driven growth marketing, Darkroom’s success is attributed to our unique partnership model, purposefully built to launch brands to market and accelerate growth across direct-to-consumer. We work with game-changing brands such as Crate & Barrel, Popchips, FEED, Olipop, & CALPAK.

Position Overview:

We're seeking a Data Engineer with a strong background in ETL processes, BigQuery, and Python to support a wide array of data engineering projects for our agency and enterprise clients. This role will focus on maintaining and optimizing our data infrastructure, ensuring the seamless flow of data, and providing the backbone for our data-driven decision-making.

This role supports teams working in US Eastern Standard/Daylight Time and should be flexible to support and work in these times.

What You’ll Do:


Design, build, and maintain scalable ETL processes to support data flow from various sources.
Maintain and optimize our BigQuery database, ensuring high performance and data integrity.
Write, troubleshoot, and optimize SQL queries to support various data needs.
Use Python to automate data processes, integrate data sources, and enhance data workflows.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Operations, Product, Marketing & Sales, Finance, and Engineering, to solve complex data problems.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports in Looker Studio to provide actionable insights to clients and internal teams.
Ensure continuous improvement of data processes through iterative testing and learning strategies.


You Should Apply If This Sounds Like You:


1 - 3 years of industry experience in data engineering, with a focus on maintaining and optimizing large-scale data systems.
Expertise in BigQuery, SQL, and Python for data processing, automation, and analysis.
Proven experience with ETL processes and tools.
Familiarity with data visualization tools, especially Looker Studio.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to manipulate, analyze, and interpret large datasets.
Experience in e-commerce marketing, with a strong understanding of platforms like Shopify, Meta (formerly Facebook) Ads, and Google Ads, is a plus.
Self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit who thrives in a fast-paced environment.


What It’s Like to Work at Darkroom:

We're building the future of advertising and are looking for the minds to help us do it. We only seek out the best—from our clients to our people. Our team is our most sacred asset, and we offer highly competitive salaries and the following perks:


Unlimited Vacation Policy and Holidays: Rebooting is one of the most important parts of growth. At Darkroom, you have access to a flexible vacation policy, and 10 holidays throughout the year to keep you recharged and sharp.
Remote-First Culture: With hubs in LA, The Bay Area, New York, Philly, Lisbon, São Paulo, and Pakistan, we offer a strong community base and endless opportunities for growth.
Endless Opportunities for Growth: Our agency is founded on an interdisciplinary approach, giving Darkroomers insights into services far beyond your job description. Grow your skills and interests beyond your niche and stay at the forefront of the industry through total immersion in cross-functional collaboration.


Equal Opportunity Statement:

Darkroom is an equal opportunity workplace—we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Insurance Sector)
Description:
Job position: Data Analyst for Insurance Sector

Location: Remote Work from Portugal (priority to candidates that can be in Lisbon client's office 3dpw)

PTC Group is recruiting for a digital consultancy and technology services provider that offers edge-to-core solutions to help organizations achieve the full potential of AI-driven digital transformation. Utilizing a technology-unified operating model for cloud, data, and IoT, this company delivers end-to-end value creation for clients through innovation in digital engineering, implementation services, products, and solutions.

Responsibilities and Tasks of the Job

The Data Analyst is a hands-on position with a focus on defining the data needs for the enterprise data warehouse. The position will work within IT to help Sompo International create an industry-leading data warehouse architecture. Furthermore, this data warehouse architecture will measure performance in all aspects of the organizations operations.


Work with business stakeholders and IT teams to analyze and resolve data issues for the enterprise data warehouse.
Create source (OLTP applications) to target (DWH) mapping documents to capture additional application data elements.
Load the source-to-target mapping documents from source systems into the enterprise data warehouse.
Collaborate with the ETL team to ensure the source-to-target mapping documents are in correct ETL code.
Ensure the ETL code align with STM requirements.
Perform data validation, to insure correct data movement into the enterprise data warehouse architecture.
Consult with reporting teams to develop a general understanding for the data warehouse model / optimal ways to use it.




Mandatory Skills


Proven 5+ years experience of data analysis extraction of OLTP data within an enterprise data warehouse.
Possess 5+ years of Policy & Claims Insurance subject-matter expertise.
Candidate has advanced level SQL knowledge.
Possess optimal knowledge for concepts and frameworks for Data Warehousing, ETL, and BI Architectures.
Candidate is capable of creating and tuning Semantic layer Reporting Views.
Able to facilitate data discovery sessions, which will include an audience of business subject-matter experts.
Proven knowledge of RDBMS platforms (e.g., SQL Server, DB2), with experience in generating DDL.
Possess knowledge of Guidewire Policy Center, Guidewire Claims Center, SAP FS-RI & SAP FS-CD applications with their data is considered a plus.
Fluency in English is mandatory.


Complementary Skills


Candidate has strong interpersonal skills, including both written and verbal communication skills.
Possess the ability to work as part of a team.
Candidate has strong organizational skills and analysis skills.


Education Requirements


B.S. Degree in Computer Information Science, Information Management, or Statistics.

Title: Data Engineer Analyst | Banking Sector | Lisbon
Description:
Data Engineer Analyst

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

YOUR ROLE

We are looking for motivated developers with experience in Data Engineer o join our teams in Lisbon.

In This Role You Will Be Responsible For


Developing and optimising ETL/ELT pipelines for data ingestion and transformation.
Implement data storage solutions such as data lakes and data warehouses.
Ensure data quality, governance and security through good development practices.
Collaborate with data science, engineering and BI teams to deliver structured and unstructured data efficiently.
Monitoring and improving the performance of data infrastructures.
Automate processes for handling large volumes of data.


YOUR PROFILE


Ability to express ideas clearly and assertively, both orally and in writing
Ability to think incrementally and iteratively
Mastery of SQL (Crud, data models, transactionality, tuning)
Mastery of multidimensional modelling concepts
Advanced troubleshooting skills
Strong data analysis skills
TDD\BDD knowledge
Continuous Delivery knowledge
Experience working with scrum methodology
Data modelling
SQL Server (T-SQL) (MS SQL 2019)
Reporting Services (SSR)


WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE?


At Capgemini Portugal we have a flexible and dynamic work environment. Flexibility enables a better work-life balance and gives more flexibility to the employee to manage the working hours, as well if he works at the office or remotely, according with the company’s hybrid work policy;
We have local programs that promote people growth, reskill and new skills development (Career Acceleration Programs);
We promote an empowering environment with autonomy and peers' relationships among the top scores of our Monthly Employees' feedback; Next to this, we also offer an attractive compensation package and benefits such as Health and Life insurance, as well as Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations and other fringe benefits according with our partnerships in force.
Capgemini Portugal is an equal opportunity employer. We promote equality and dignity in all aspects of recruitment and employment, as well as employment offers and promotions made according with competence and ability or performance, respectively.


About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get the future you want | www.capgemini.com

Apply now!

Title: SQL Developer
Description:
Seeking a SQL Developer: Rhino, are you there?

At WE ARE META, we focus on finding the perfect match between our Rhinos and our clients.

Why join us?


Expand your network: As a consultant at We Are META, you’ll have access to a network of national and international partners across diverse sectors of the tech industry.
Enjoy our perks: When you join the crash you’ll have an array of benefits, to help you achieve the best work-life balance.
Get your perfect match: Our recruiters do their best to get the best position for you, whether in terms of working policy (remote, hybrid, on-site) or the company’s culture.
Personalized support: With our career coach, we assure that all your needs are being met and you’re being provided everything you need to excel in your professional life because the well-being of our Rhinos is our number one priority.


Perks Of Becoming a Rhino


You’ll get a welcome kit 📚
Opportunities for career progression 📈
Live on the edge with our health insurance 🏥
Watch your favorite shows and music with HBO and Spotify accounts 📺 🎵
Coverflex meal card 🍲 💳
Other protocols and special discounts ✨


For this position, the perfect Rhino should have the following skills:


+4 years of professional experience in SQL and PL/SQL - ability to write, optimize, and understand complex queries.
Knowledge in procedural or object-oriented programming language.
Experience with Core Banking systems (banking software and its architecture) is a plus.
Database modeling expertise (plus)
Fluent in English (B2 Level).
Available to work in a hybrid setup in Lisbon, Portugal.


Become a part of the crash. In a world of unicorns, be a Rhino!

Title: Personal Data Protection Analyst
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. It is also part of our culture to care about the environment and to carry out actions of social and environmental corporate responsibility.

This could be your opportunity to join a project of international scope, with a client that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

💻 THE JOB

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Personal Data Protection Analyst for an national project in the banks sector.

🙂 YOUR DAY TO DAY


Ensure CIB project validation processes comply with Privacy by Design principles, and supporting Project Managers on their data protection activities"
Manage incoming external and internal requests in the outlook inbox CIB GDPR DESK, including Data Subject Rights Requests"
Publish the CIB GDPR DESK periodic report and manage a dedicated SharePoint space
Contribute to disseminate a culture of personal data protection within CIB
Develop and share best practices with the data protection network


💡 What We Are Looking For


Full proficiency of MSOffice suite
Proficiency of project management tools and methodologies
English - mandatory


⭐ What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360° evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Reconciliation of professional and family life

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians customers, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with subject PDPA.RM.DB

Learn more about Axians
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Chegou o momento de te desafiares a sair da tua zona de conforto fazendo parte de um grande projeto? Vem trabalhar connosco e potenciar ainda mais o teu desenvolvimento!

Integra uma equipa onde trabalharás com os melhores especialistas em Data. Enquanto Engineer, terás a oportunidade de levar os nossos projetos de transformação ao próximo nível, à escala global, criando e entregando soluções inovadoras de Portugal para o mundo. Procuramos perfis que combinem skills de abstração e alguns conhecimentos técnicos da plataforma, com o mindset orientado para a excelência do nosso serviço ao cliente.

Na Deloitte nunca trabalharás sozinho e, por isso, oferecemos um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira com formação ajustada ao teu perfil e aos teus objetivos profissionais. Terás uma experiência profissional que te irá inspirar, ao lado de outros talentos como tu, a transformar o mundo como o conhecemos: a torná-lo mais humano, eficiente e tecnológico. Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos à procura dos melhores especialistas em tecnologia para se juntarem aos nossos centros de excelência e à nossa comunidade, para desenvolverem soluções únicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transformação.

Estão reunidos todos os ingredientes para poderes embarcar nesta viagem enriquecedora e desafiante que é o mundo Deloitte?

O teu dia a dia e responsabilidades vão ser compostos por:

  • Analise de dados em várias tecnologias, SQL e No-SQL;
  • Desenho, implementação, e monitorização de pipelines ETL;
  • Criação de processos para tratamento de dados (data profiling, cleansing, masking);
  • Desenho e implementação de soluções real-time analytics;
  • Desenho e implementação de soluções Big Data;
  • Desenho e Implementação de soluções data-driven distribuídas com recurso a tecnologias Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP);
  • Colaborar com vários stakeholders na definição, tratamento de dados e implementação de modelos avançados de Machine Learning.
  • Garantir a coordenação entre equipas técnicas e funcionais no âmbito de projetos de dados;


És tu quem procuramos:

  • Formação superior nas áreas de Engenharia ou similares;
  • Conhecimento da língua Inglesa (oral e escrita) e disponibilidade para viajar; Entre 2 a 6 Anos de experiência profissional em projetos de Data;
  • Conhecimento de processos de desenvolvimento de software;
  • Experiência com metodologias Agile;
  • Conhecimentos de linguagens SQL / No SQL;
  • Conhecimentos em Python;
  • Experiência profissional em soluções ETL (exemplos, Azure Data Fabric, AWS Glue, Snowflake, SSIS, IBM DataStage) (preferencial);
  • Experiência em soluções da Data Visualization (exemplos, Power BI, Tableau);
  • Experiência profissional com Data Warehouses / Data Lakes;
  • Conhecimento das soluções Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) orientadas a arquiteturas de dados distribuídos;
  • Experiência profissional em soluções/tecnologias Big Data (exemplos, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, ELK, MongoDB) (preferencial);
  • Orientação para o cliente e para resultados;
  • Comunicação, trabalho em equipa, resolução de problemas e capacidade analítica.


Desenvolve uma carreira à tua medida

  • Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem contínuos
  • Através de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades técnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, às tuas necessidades e objetivos
  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão e impacto relevante nesta área de especialização
  • Acesso ilimitado às maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy
  • Oportunidade de formações e certificações nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud


Vive uma cultura de união

  • Uma cultura de inovação e excelência que nos torna líderes e precursores de tendências
  • Um ambiente amigável, de respeito, confiança, transparência e informalidade
  • Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de líderes e especialistas
  • Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.


Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte, nunca trabalharás sozinho. Vais integrar os mais variados e desafiantes projetos e fazer parte do nosso Global Solutions Center, onde poderás colaborar de forma integrada com outras equipas da rede global Deloitte. Terás sempre alguém ao teu lado para te inspirar, ajudar e desafiar a expandir os teus horizontes, enquanto exploras soluções tecnológicas diferenciadoras. Aqui, ao encontrares um ambiente dinâmico, colaborativo e humano, terás a oportunidade de desenvolver a tua melhor versão.

Além disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal têm projeção internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte liderança global em diversas expertises tecnológicas.

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas competências e fazer parte de equipas que desenvolvem soluções nas tecnologias líderes de mercado, então estás no lugar certo!

Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em áreas tecnológicas, a partir de escritórios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnológicos em Braga, Setúbal e Leiria.

Keywords: Sobre a Deloitte; Consulting; Technology

Title: Data Scientist - Interim Role
Description:
Our client is a multinational Pharmaceutical Company.|Join the team in a dynamic international environment.



About Our Client

Our client is a leading Pharmaceutical company.

Job Description

As a Data Scientis your main responsibilities will be:

Collaborate closely with cross-functional global and local teams to understand business needs and translate them into actionable insights.

Develop and implement analytical tools, dashboards, and data solutions to address business needs.

Utilize data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities, and provide strategic recommendations to stakeholders.

Integrate artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques to enhance data-driven decision-making processes.

Work with large datasets to create predictive models, data visualizations, and automated solutions that drive business outcomes.

Continuously monitor and optimize data solutions to ensure accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.

Support prioritization efforts, understand feasibility and business impact, take smart risks to make informed decisions in a fast-paced, evolving environment to deliver patient benefits faster.

Ensuring the effectiveness of data models through rigorous testing and analysis

Communicate complex data insights in a clear and concise manner to non-technical stakeholders.

The Successful Applicant

The ideal candidate will have:

Bachelor Degree (Masters is a plus) in mathematics, computer science, statistics, engineering, or information science;

At least 3 years of hands-on experience as a Data Scientist;

Professional work experience in at least one of the following languages: Python, SQL, JavaScript;

Experience In The Pharmaceutical/biotech Industry Is Preferred.

Fluency in written and spoken English.

Proven experience with data analysis, modeling, and visualization.

Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets and generate actionable insights.

Experience with artificial intelligence and machine learning tools, frameworks, and techniques.

Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate and convey technical information to non-technical audiences.

Strong team player with interpersonal skills and strong collaborative and solution-focused mindset.

What's On Offer

We offer the opportunity to join an international team, working from Portugal with different stakeholders. This role will be done remotely at a first stage and in an hybrid work model afterwards.

Contact: Ana Dias

Quote job ref: JN-082024-6499933

Title: IT Business Analyst (m/f)
HTML:
We are looking for an IT Business Analyst to join the team of our client – a reference company in the Banking sector.

What will be your main tasks and responsibilities?


  • Participate in the implementation and control of projects in the annual plan of your area of expertise, mainly focused on connecting the activities between the business and IT teams;
  • Execute the evolutionary and corrective maintenance in your area of expertise within the defined SLAs;
  • Identify new features or improvement points in the existing systems.


What is required from you?


  • Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or other similar area;
  • At least 2 years of experience in a similar role;
  • Knowledge in programming;
  • Experience in dashboard and reports elaboration is a plus;
  • Knowledge in PowerBI and SQL is a plus;
  • Good communication skills, interpersonal relationships;
  • Fluent in English (both written and spoken).


Sounds like you? Send us your CV and let’s talk!

About QiBit:

QiBit is a recruitment company specialized in Information and Communications Technologies, who belongs to the multinational Gi Group. Our team works daily to connect companies and candidates, developing a close relationship with both.

Os candidatos interessados, em cumprimento do definido no Regulamento (UE) 2016/679 (RGPD), são convidados a ler a política de privacidade em https://pt.gigroup.com. Parte da Gi Group Holding, a Gi Group reconhece e respeita a diversidade das pessoas e acredita que proporcionar igualdade de oportunidades, através de processos justos com base na meritocracia e competência profissional, valorizar a diversidade de semelhanças e diferenças que criam a singularidade de cada pessoa e promover uma cultura de inclusão eliminando fatores que desencorajam ou dificultam o acesso, a permanência e o crescimento no mundo do trabalho é fundamental para o seu sucesso. Conheça as nossas Políticas Globais de Alto Nível em https://www.gigroupholding.com/portugal/compromisso-social/.

Title: Finance Systems Data Analyst
Description:
Company Overview 

We are a leading European online business services provider, dedicated to offering cutting-edge solutions to our diverse client base. With a strong focus on innovation and customer satisfaction, we are committed to expanding our product offerings and enhancing our market presence. The company is experiencing extremely high levels of organic and growth via the acquisition of new businesses.

  Position Overview 

We are building a new Finance Excellence Center in Lisbon (Portugal) to provide a complete finance service to our business. The company is currently implementing a new ERP tool across the group (NetSuite) and processes to improve and automate our Finance operations.

We are seeking a Finance System Data Analyst to join our team to support the implementation of the new ERP System and integrate data from all of the companies billing, payroll and customer billing systems. The ideal candidate will have strong data analysis and data integration experience, ideally in an environment where the ERP System integrates with backend systems in an International Finance Organisation, Excellence Center or Shared Service Center setup. The ideal candidate has the experience to be able to work hands-on, contribute to the setup of new Center as well is highly motivated to contribute to Continues Process Improvements.

Key Responsibilities: 


Key contributor in the implementation of the new ERP System including the transition of existing businesses and the on-boarding of future acquisitions as required.
Data analysis and management of the finance system, with responsibilities including:
Maintenance of existing feeds from integration systems to the Finance ERP, including, billing and payroll systems
Data analysis, investigation and changes to existing data feeds / transformations to debug issues and/or implement enhancements
Data analysis and investigation of data feeds for new acquisitions, in order to understand the effort and timelines required to integrate these new systems
Data mapping, cleansing and transformation of data feeds for new acquisitions
One off data migration and setup of financial data for new acquisitions (incl. migration of opening balances, supplier data and other core financial information)
Administration and ownership of the data integration layer (using our chosen iPaaS software -Workato), including configuration, enhancement and ongoing maintenance
Capturing and managing a central backlog of ongoing data requirements and enhancements
Co-ordination with external technical development teams responsible for integrating systems, to agree data feed requirements, interfacing contracts, interfacing method (API …etc) and testing and release of new features and bug fixes
Plan and execute testing of ongoing enhancements to data integration feeds and the data integration layer
Advise the business on practical ways to use of the solution to meet business needs

Provide first line support to the Core Finance members that are using our newly rolled out ERP System and connection with several Billing Platform and Data Warehouses, including trouble shooting user issues, resolving system errors, escalating complex issues to stakeholders and work with internal and external experts on this.
Collaborate with cross-functional team to gather requirements, resolves issue and improve the functionality of the systems., including the creation and updating of the overall Finance Systems Roadmap.
Develop and maintain system documentation.
Assist with special projects and process improvement projects as


Qualifications: 

Must haves:


Bachelor's degree in IT/Computer Science or Data Science
Min. 5-year hands on experience in implementing and maintaining data integration solutions in IT/Finance environment, ideally using a leading data integration iPaaS solution (Workato, Mulesoft, Boomi, Jiterbit)
Relevant experience and track record in an international Finance environment / Share Service Center setup.
Excellent communication skills for both Business and Technical subjects
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, with a proactive and entrepreneurial mindset.



Desired:


Fluent in at least one other European Language



Key requirements: 

What questions can we ask as pre-selection:


Shared Service Center or International Finance Experience
Hands-on experience and experience managing and implementing data integration solutions for a new Finance ERP system



"Come as you are"

Everyone is welcome here. Diversity & Inclusion are at our core. Far above any technical competence, we value respect, openness, and trusted collaboration. We do not tolerate intolerance.

“At team.blue, our commitment to caring for the environment and each other is at the heart of everything we do. Our latest impact report showcases our ongoing ESG efforts and ambitious sustainability goals. Interested in learning more about our dedication to making a positive impact? Check it out here.”

The most trusted digital enabler

team.blue is a leading digital enabler for companies and entrepreneurs. It serves over 3.3 million customers in Europe and has more than 2000 experts to support them. Its goal is to shape technology and to empower businesses with innovative digital services.

Click here to read more about team.blue
