Title: Data Driven | SQL Data Engineer
HTML:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

You will join a team responsible for providing data, insights, and analysis to Global Markets front office. This team is responsible for multiple steps regarding data processing: Data Feeds industrialization, ETL, Data Warehousing and Data Visualization. 


Qualifications

Technical skills:
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL systems with experience developing in Oracle environment;
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL;
  • Professional experience with Python;
  • Knowledge of Airflow;
  • Practice Experience with GIT (preferably bitbucket);
  • Fluency in English.


Soft Skills:
  • Good communication skills;
  • Strong analytical abilities, able to have the right synthesis and all possible details at same time;
  • Team spirit;
  • Adaptability skills Client Focus.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: VIE eBusiness Data Analyst – Lisbon, H/F
Description:
Concrètement votre quotidien ?

L'équipe Smart Derivatives Support se situe au coeur de l'offre digitale en matière de trading électronique de BNP Paribas. Sa fonction première est de fournir un point de contact unique pour les demandes clients relatives aux produits et services électroniques. ECS fournit un support aux clients, plateformes de trading et aux contreparties externes. Le département est responsable de l’enregistrement des clients sur nos outils digitaux, du support clients et de la relation avec les fournisseurs pour l’ensemble des plateformes eCommerce. Smart Derivatives team est un élément essentiel du département Electronic Business & Markets. Il vise à fournir le meilleur niveau de service possible à nos clients internes ou externes afin de positionner BNP Paribas en tant que leader du business des marchés électroniques.

L'équipe Est Responsable De


la gestion et de l’implémentation des requêtes d’enregistrement client ou utilisateur interne sur les plateformes de trading électronique de BNP Paribas, SmartDertivatives et BRIO,
assurer que les connexions des clients sont opérationnelles - possibilité de pricer et traiter en permanence.
fournir un support aux clients et former les différentes équipes afin d’assurer un usage optimal de la plateforme.
Proposer et rédiger de nouvelle brochure marketing pour la promotion de nos plateformes et de ses nouveaux services.
S’assurer que tous les guides relatifs aux fonctionnalités des plateformes disponibles en ligne sont exhaustifs et à jour.
Former et présenter aux utilisateurs internes les nouveautés des plateformes lors de leur mise à disposition.


L'équipe est aussi impliquée dans plusieurs projets d'optimisation eBusiness, et dirige ceux directement lié à la BAU et au développement de la plateforme.

L'environnement de travail, c'est important !

Au sein des équipes CIB de BNP Paribas, Global Markets offre une gamme très large de produits et services sur les marchés des taux d'intérêts, du crédit, des devises, des matières premières et des marchés actions. GM aide ses clients à trouver des solutions efficaces et adaptées pour lever et investir des capitaux ainsi que pour gérer les expositions aux différents risques de marchés. Notre base de clientèle est très large et comprend des centaines d’entreprises, d’investisseurs institutionnels, de banques, de gouvernements ou d’organisations supranationales. GM a la possibilité d’entretenir des relations professionnelles partout dans le monde et d’émettre des produits dans la quasi-totalité des devises. Notre réseau regroupe plus de 3000 professionnels repartis sur toute la planète.

Basée à Lisbonne, votre équipe est une équipe globale appartenant au COO Group avec des équipes basées à Londres, Lisbonne, New York et Singapour, sur les activités ECS, et Digital Sales.

ECS assiste les clients de BNP Paribas sur les plateformes mono ou multi émetteurs/contreparties (Single dealer and Multi dealer platforms) en partenariat avec la vente et le trading.

Le rôle principal de l’équipe Digital Sales est de promouvoir l’offre digitale BNPP auprès de nouveaux clients ainsi que des clients européens existants. Ce rôle est clé afin de poursuivre la croissance de notre franchise et d’aider le business à atteindre les objectifs stratégiques digitaux.

Et après ?

Vous aurez l’opportunité de développer vos connaissances sur une large étendue de produits financiers (principalement structurés et dérivés actions) mais aussi sur l’offre digitale de BNPP. Vous développerez un sens du contact client et êtes amené à interagir avec de nombreux intervenants externes et internes dans un environnement stimulant sous pression. Vous serez responsable d’un certain nombre de projets dans lesquels vous serez confronté à différents outils d’automatisation. Enfin, vous interviendrez au sein de la salle des marchés et serez au contact avec l’ensemble des équipes Front Office ( Sales, Traders, Structuration, Developpeurs) ce qui vous permettra d’acquérir une vue d’ensemble sur le fonctionnement de l’activité au sens large.

Pourquoi rejoindre BNP Paribas ?

Notre monde change : notre manière de nous informer, de consommer… et de travailler aussi ! Aujourd’hui, ce qui compte dans un job, c’est de vivre de véritables expériences, d’apprendre, de partager objectifs et résultats avec ses collègues. Bref, de tracer son propre chemin, différent, responsable et durable. Chez BNP Paribas, nous recrutons nos collaborateurs avec l’idée qu’ils nous aideront à concevoir le monde et la banque de demain.

Vous voulez connaître toutes les raisons de nous rejoindre ? Rendez-vous sur https://group.bnpparibas

Et la rémunération ?

Elle est fixée par Business France et consultable directement sur leur site.

Etes-vous notre prochain VIE eBusiness Data Analyst ?

A vous de nous convaincre !

Vous êtes titulaire d’un Master avec une spécialisation en Mathématiques, en Finance, en Economie ou en Ingénierie, et vous justifiez d’une expérience de 12 mois minimum (stage et alternance inclus) sur un poste similaire.

Vous parlez couramment anglais. Vous maîtrisez le Pack Office (Excel) avez des compétences en langage informatique tel que Python. Vous avez des connaissances en banque d’investissement, en analyse de données, en marchés des actions et en marchés financiers transversaux.

De plus, votre adaptabilité et votre rigueur seront des atouts essentiels. Ajoutez à cela votre esprit d’équipe, votre esprit critique, ainsi que votre capacité à communiquer pour finir de nous convaincre.

Dans un monde qui change, la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion sont des valeurs clés pour le bien-être et la performance des équipes. Chez BNP Paribas, nous souhaitons accueillir et retenir tous les talents sans distinction : c’est ainsi que nous construirons, ensemble, la finance de demain, innovante, responsable et durable.

Enfin, nous attachons une importance particulière à ce que nos futurs collaborateurs agissent au quotidien avec responsabilité éthique et professionnelle.

A tout moment pendant le processus de recrutement, les informations figurant sur votre CV, vos données d’identification et vos antécédents pourront être vérifiées.

Durée et disponibilité

Ce poste est à pourvoir à partir du 1er novembre pour une durée de 24 mois.

Avant de postuler, veillez à vérifier les conditions d’éligibilité pour cette destination : Faire son V.I.E au Portugal (businessfrance.fr) et ajouter à votre espace candidat un CV en anglais.
Show more
HTML:
Concrètement votre quotidien ?

L'équipe Smart Derivatives Support se situe au coeur de l'offre digitale en matière de trading électronique de BNP Paribas. Sa fonction première est de fournir un point de contact unique pour les demandes clients relatives aux produits et services électroniques. ECS fournit un support aux clients, plateformes de trading et aux contreparties externes. Le département est responsable de l’enregistrement des clients sur nos outils digitaux, du support clients et de la relation avec les fournisseurs pour l’ensemble des plateformes eCommerce. Smart Derivatives team est un élément essentiel du département Electronic Business & Markets. Il vise à fournir le meilleur niveau de service possible à nos clients internes ou externes afin de positionner BNP Paribas en tant que leader du business des marchés électroniques.

L'équipe Est Responsable De

  • la gestion et de l’implémentation des requêtes d’enregistrement client ou utilisateur interne sur les plateformes de trading électronique de BNP Paribas, SmartDertivatives et BRIO,
  • assurer que les connexions des clients sont opérationnelles - possibilité de pricer et traiter en permanence.
  • fournir un support aux clients et former les différentes équipes afin d’assurer un usage optimal de la plateforme.
  • Proposer et rédiger de nouvelle brochure marketing pour la promotion de nos plateformes et de ses nouveaux services.
  • S’assurer que tous les guides relatifs aux fonctionnalités des plateformes disponibles en ligne sont exhaustifs et à jour.
  • Former et présenter aux utilisateurs internes les nouveautés des plateformes lors de leur mise à disposition.

L'équipe est aussi impliquée dans plusieurs projets d'optimisation eBusiness, et dirige ceux directement lié à la BAU et au développement de la plateforme.

L'environnement de travail, c'est important !

Au sein des équipes CIB de BNP Paribas, Global Markets offre une gamme très large de produits et services sur les marchés des taux d'intérêts, du crédit, des devises, des matières premières et des marchés actions. GM aide ses clients à trouver des solutions efficaces et adaptées pour lever et investir des capitaux ainsi que pour gérer les expositions aux différents risques de marchés. Notre base de clientèle est très large et comprend des centaines d’entreprises, d’investisseurs institutionnels, de banques, de gouvernements ou d’organisations supranationales. GM a la possibilité d’entretenir des relations professionnelles partout dans le monde et d’émettre des produits dans la quasi-totalité des devises. Notre réseau regroupe plus de 3000 professionnels repartis sur toute la planète.

Basée à Lisbonne, votre équipe est une équipe globale appartenant au COO Group avec des équipes basées à Londres, Lisbonne, New York et Singapour, sur les activités ECS, et Digital Sales.

ECS assiste les clients de BNP Paribas sur les plateformes mono ou multi émetteurs/contreparties (Single dealer and Multi dealer platforms) en partenariat avec la vente et le trading.

Le rôle principal de l’équipe Digital Sales est de promouvoir l’offre digitale BNPP auprès de nouveaux clients ainsi que des clients européens existants. Ce rôle est clé afin de poursuivre la croissance de notre franchise et d’aider le business à atteindre les objectifs stratégiques digitaux.

Et après ?

Vous aurez l’opportunité de développer vos connaissances sur une large étendue de produits financiers (principalement structurés et dérivés actions) mais aussi sur l’offre digitale de BNPP. Vous développerez un sens du contact client et êtes amené à interagir avec de nombreux intervenants externes et internes dans un environnement stimulant sous pression. Vous serez responsable d’un certain nombre de projets dans lesquels vous serez confronté à différents outils d’automatisation. Enfin, vous interviendrez au sein de la salle des marchés et serez au contact avec l’ensemble des équipes Front Office ( Sales, Traders, Structuration, Developpeurs) ce qui vous permettra d’acquérir une vue d’ensemble sur le fonctionnement de l’activité au sens large.

Pourquoi rejoindre BNP Paribas ?

Notre monde change : notre manière de nous informer, de consommer… et de travailler aussi ! Aujourd’hui, ce qui compte dans un job, c’est de vivre de véritables expériences, d’apprendre, de partager objectifs et résultats avec ses collègues. Bref, de tracer son propre chemin, différent, responsable et durable. Chez BNP Paribas, nous recrutons nos collaborateurs avec l’idée qu’ils nous aideront à concevoir le monde et la banque de demain.

Vous voulez connaître toutes les raisons de nous rejoindre ? Rendez-vous sur https://group.bnpparibas

Et la rémunération ?

Elle est fixée par Business France et consultable directement sur leur site.

Etes-vous notre prochain VIE eBusiness Data Analyst ?

A vous de nous convaincre !

Vous êtes titulaire d’un Master avec une spécialisation en Mathématiques, en Finance, en Economie ou en Ingénierie, et vous justifiez d’une expérience de 12 mois minimum (stage et alternance inclus) sur un poste similaire.

Vous parlez couramment anglais. Vous maîtrisez le Pack Office (Excel) avez des compétences en langage informatique tel que Python. Vous avez des connaissances en banque d’investissement, en analyse de données, en marchés des actions et en marchés financiers transversaux.

De plus, votre adaptabilité et votre rigueur seront des atouts essentiels. Ajoutez à cela votre esprit d’équipe, votre esprit critique, ainsi que votre capacité à communiquer pour finir de nous convaincre.

Dans un monde qui change, la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion sont des valeurs clés pour le bien-être et la performance des équipes. Chez BNP Paribas, nous souhaitons accueillir et retenir tous les talents sans distinction : c’est ainsi que nous construirons, ensemble, la finance de demain, innovante, responsable et durable.

Enfin, nous attachons une importance particulière à ce que nos futurs collaborateurs agissent au quotidien avec responsabilité éthique et professionnelle.

A tout moment pendant le processus de recrutement, les informations figurant sur votre CV, vos données d’identification et vos antécédents pourront être vérifiées.

Durée et disponibilité

Ce poste est à pourvoir à partir du 1er novembre pour une durée de 24 mois.

Avant de postuler, veillez à vérifier les conditions d’éligibilité pour cette destination : Faire son V.I.E au Portugal (businessfrance.fr) et ajouter à votre espace candidat un CV en anglais.

Title: Cloud Data Engineer (Remote, Contract)
Description:
OUR HIRING PROCESS:


We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals—every person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.


As a Cloud Data Engineer at INFUSE, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining robust ETL processes on AWS to support our data-driven decision-making. You will work closely with our servers, integrate various web platforms, and perform other data manipulations to ensure data is available, accurate, and actionable. This role requires a blend of technical prowess, problem-solving skills, and a deep understanding of cloud technologies.

Key Responsibilities


ETL Process Development: Design, develop, and maintain ETL processes on AWS to extract, transform, and load data across various platforms.
Server Management: Collaborate with the infrastructure team to manage and optimize servers used for ETL processes.
Process Improvement: Continuously update and improve existing ETL processes for better performance, scalability, and reliability.
Integration: Integrate data from different web platforms and ensure seamless data flow between different sources and systems.
Data Manipulation: Perform data manipulations, and transformations, and ensure data quality for reporting and analytics.
Collaboration: Work closely with BI engineers, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide relevant data solutions.
Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of ETL processes, data flow diagrams, and integration procedures.


Qualifications


Experience:
3+ years of experience in data engineering with a focus on cloud technologies.
Proven experience with AWS services like S3, Redshift, Glue, Lambda, etc.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases.
Hands-on experience with ETL tools and frameworks (e.g., Apache Airflow, Talend).
Strong scripting skills in Python, SQL, and/or other relevant programming languages.
Experience with integration of various web platforms and APIs.
Soft Skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision.

Preferred Qualifications


Experience with other cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, Google Cloud).
Knowledge of big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).
Experience with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).

Title: Power BI Developer
Description:
Alter Solutions Portugal is an IT Consultancy Company, promoter of Digital Transformation, part of the Alter Solutions Group, created in 2006, in Paris.


In 2022, Alter Solutions joined the act digital group, constituting a global community of talent in Technology, with presence in twelve countries: Germany, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, United States of America, Morocco, Spain, France, Luxembourg, Poland, Portugal and Serbia. Also in 2022, we were certified as a Great Place to Work©.


In Portugal, we partner with over 120 clients and a team of over 500 people, working in projects for industries as diverse as banking, insurance, transportation, aviation, energy, and telecom.


Headquarters of the Nearshore IT center, Alter Solutions Portugal has a dedicated team of around 30 specialized professionals, integrated into projects with several internationally renowned clients.




Job Description



Analyzing, developing, implementation and customization of Power BI based solutions.


Competences:


Definition of Functional and Nonfunctional Requirements.
Continuously research and learning latest configuration and best practices of Power BI and then bring these configurations to live.
Assist in developing design specifications as well as providing demos (live, documentation and presentations) of the solution to the business.
Works directly with/in agile teams to implement the solution.


Qualifications


> 3 year of experience in Power BI and data modeling
Developing visual reports, KPI scorecards, and dashboards using Power BI desktop
Connecting data sources, importing data, and transforming data for Business intelligence
Analytical thinking for translating data into informative reports and visuals
DAX experience
T-SQL experience
Azure DevOps mindset
Basic experience in agile IT, e.g. SAFE or SCRUM methodology
Siemens gives preference to consultants that also demonstrate competences in:
Experience in Power BI Premium workspaces (mandatory)
Experience in using XMLA end points
Experience in RLS and partitioning
Experience in Azure on data related components
Experience communicating with clients
Ability to teach other developers how to develop processes for distributed environments

You should have analytical skills, willingness to learn and adopt new technologies.


Is mandatory to be business-fluent in English language (speaking and writing).

Title: Principal Finance Data Quality Assurance Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Principal Data Quality Assurance Analyst

Location: Lisbon




Introduction to role:

Join our Global Business Services team as a Principal Finance Data Quality Assurance Analyst, where you'll be responsible for identifying, investigating, and resolving data issues affecting financial planning, reporting, and operations for assigned areas. This is your chance to contribute to global healthcare and sustainability challenges in a place built on innovation and creativity!




Accountabilities:

As a Principal Finance Data Quality Assurance Analyst, you will act as a lead and subject matter expert for all data quality processes and activities related to your assigned area. You will own and manage DQA value and project involvement monthly internal and external reporting. You will lead the investigation of master data, transaction, and mapping issues affecting reporting and planning systems. You will define manual adjustments as needed to temporarily correct time-critical issues. You will work with process analysts to identify root causes of data quality issues and propose process and system improvements. You will use data quality reporting tools, system reconciliations, and direct data analysis to proactively identify potential data issues for resolution. You will contribute to improvements in tools, methods, processes, documentation, and controls within the team. Lastly, you will perform data quality profiling and produce ad hoc data quality reports.




Essential Skills/Experience:

Accounting background
Experience of working with financial data and systems, preferably using SAP
Background in data analysis and issue investigation in a complex data and system environment
Experience in the maintenance and use of common financial data (e.g., costs centres, profit centres, chart of accounts, transactional postings)
Experience supporting Finance month-end processes, reporting, and planning
Good understanding of data quality and data management principles
Proactive, analytical and investigative mindset
Proficient in Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Excellent attention to detail
Good written and verbal communication skills




Desirable Skills/Experience:

Experience of working in a complex global organisation
Pharmaceutical business awareness/business domain knowledge
Experience using data quality profiling and monitoring tools
Experience in querying data using SQL
Experience creating reports




When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we unleash bold thinking with the power to inspire life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. That’s why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office. But that doesn't mean we’re not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.




Why AstraZeneca?

AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company. We focus on discovering, developing, and commercialising prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we are more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. At AstraZeneca, we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science, challenge convention and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. To embrace differences and take bold actions to drive the change needed to meet global healthcare and sustainability challenges.




Ready to make a difference? Apply now and join us in our mission to push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines!

Description:
The Wise Seeker é a empresa de tecnologia de RH líder na avaliação imparcial de talentos.

Com mais de 15 anos no sector a analisar as necessidades e exigências do mercado de trabalho, somos capazes de identificar os melhores talentos para cada empresa graças à nossa equipa de profissionais e à nossa plataforma Saas integrada com Inteligência Artificial.

Title: Senior Finance Data Quality Assurance Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Senior Data Quality Assurance Analyst

Location: Lisbon




Introduction to role:

Join our Global Business Services (GBS) Data Assurance team at AstraZeneca, a place built on innovation and creativity. We are looking for a Senior Finance Data Quality Assurance Analyst who will play a crucial role in ensuring that our master, reference, and transactional data is fit for purpose. This role is pivotal in identifying, investigating, and resolving data issues affecting planning, reporting, and other Finance processes.




Accountabilities:

As a Senior Finance Data Quality Assurance Analyst, you will be responsible for investigating data quality issues, defining manual adjustments to temporarily correct time-critical issues, and working with users, data stewards, and operations teams to ensure fixes are applied correctly. You will also contribute to improvements in tools, methods, processes, documentation, and controls within the team. Your proactive, analytical, and investigative mindset will be key in using data quality reporting tools, system reconciliations, and direct data analysis to proactively identify potential data issues for resolution.




Essential Skills/Experience:

Experience of working with financial data and systems, preferably SAP FICO
Background in data analysis and issue investigation in a complex data and system environment
Experience in the maintenance and use of common financial data (e.g. costs centres, profit centres, chart of accounts, transactional postings)
Good understanding of financial processes
Good understanding of data quality and data management principles
Proactive, analytical and investigative mindset
Proficient in Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Excellent attention to detail
Good written and verbal communication skills




Desirable Skills/Experience:

Accounting background
Experience of working in a complex global organisation
Pharmaceutical business awareness/business domain knowledge
Experience using data quality profiling and monitoring tools
Experience in querying data using SQL
Experience creating reports
Experience supporting Finance month end processes, reporting and planning




When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we unleash bold thinking with the power to inspire life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. That’s why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office. But that doesn't mean we’re not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.




At AstraZeneca, we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and challenge convention. To embrace differences and take bold actions to drive the change needed to meet global healthcare and sustainability challenges. There is no better place to make a difference in medicine, patients, and society. An inclusive culture where you will connect different thinking to generate new and valuable opportunities. Where you will find a commitment to lifelong learning, growth and development for all.




Ready to make an impact? Apply now and join us in our mission to push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines!

  • Experience supporting Finance month end processes, reporting and planning


When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we unleash bold thinking with the power to inspire life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. That’s why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office. But that doesn't mean we’re not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.


At AstraZeneca, we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and challenge convention. To embrace differences and take bold actions to drive the change needed to meet global healthcare and sustainability challenges. There is no better place to make a difference in medicine, patients, and society. An inclusive culture where you will connect different thinking to generate new and valuable opportunities. Where you will find a commitment to lifelong learning, growth and development for all.


Ready to make an impact? Apply now and join us in our mission to push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines!

Title: Analista Programador de Engenharia de dados - 1055
HTML:
Descrição da Função

Estamos com uma oportunidade para um dos nossos parceiros, uma empresa com projetos nacionais e internacionais e que está em um crescimento impressionante no mercado português e Europeu. Venha fazer parte dessa equipa de sucesso! Requisitos:

  • Capacidade de expressar ideias de forma clara e assertiva, de forma oral e escrita;
  • Capacidade de pensar de forma incremental e iterativa;
  • Domínio de SQL (Crud, modelos de dados, transacionalidade, tunning);
  • Domínio de conceitos de modelação multidimensional;
  • Capacidade de troubleshooting avançado;
  • Forte capacidade de análise de dados;
  • Conhecimentos TDD\BDD;
  • Conhecimentos Continuous Delivery;
  • Experiência de trabalho em metodologia scrum; Extra-Perfil:
  • Consultor deverá ser dinâmico e proactivo;
  • Deverá saber lidar/gerir espectativas juntos da equipa e dos clientes;
  • Deverá ter experiencia em equipas de manutenção evolutiva;
  • Duração: Contrato 12 Meses (possibilidade de prorrogação).
  • Localização: Lisboa, híbrido. Localização
  • Lisboa e Região, Portugal

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Commercial Intelligence Team within the Revenue Management & Commercial Excellence department (RMCE) is looking for a motivated and driven Data Engineer (m/f/d) who will help us shape our team, drive the company to the next level, and have the most direct influence on our success.

Who We Are

The Revenue Management & Commercial Excellence (RMCE) department combines commercial responsibilities with strategic pricing and the monitoring, analysis and interpretation of KPIs to optimize revenue. As an open and interconnected hub within the commercial organization, RMCE fosters transparency, collaboration, and synergy across all functions.

The Commercial Intelligence team owns the RMCE's department’s analytical products: from data pipelines, reports, and ad-hoc analyses to tools and applications. We support the department and the whole company in taking data-driven business decisions by translating big data into actionable insights and building automated solutions. Our long-term goal is to enhance our Revenue Management System with integrated solutions (reports, tools, UIs) that would replace our current product portfolio. To this end, our team is looking for someone with both data modeling and engineering knowledge to drive our offer to the next level.

Your Tasks – Paint the world green

As a Data Engineer you will work on a wide range of interesting tasks to actively support the business teams in optimizing revenue, ensuring profitability, and fostering sustainable growth.

This is a highly visible role that requires rigor, self-organization, autonomy, hands-on mentality and entrepreneurial spirit, and will give you the opportunity to develop many transversal skills (engineering, data modeling, analytical, commercial, project and stakeholder management, amongst others).

You Will


Build automated data pipelines with the use of SQL, Python and workflow orchestration tools
Together with the team, you design, implement and optimize your teams services & products
Embrace modern DevOps and Backend Software engineering practices
Transform, test and document data
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, understand business requirements, and present findings to non-technical stakeholders


Our Tech Stack


Python
Snowflake
DBT
Jenkins and GitLab CI/CD
AWS, Docker, Kubernetes
Kafka
Power BI


Your Profile – Ready to hop on board


At least 3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or Software Engineer
Fluency in Python
Good SQL knowledge (in connection to Snowflake)
Experience working with workflow orchestration tools (Airflow)
Experience with DevOps and Infrastructure (Kubernetes, Docker, GitLab - CI/CD pipelines, Terraform)
Some experience with cloud providers, particularly AWS
You are familiar with Kafka
Preference for working along Agile frameworks
Experience collaborating with Data Teams
You possess understanding of analytics engineering tools such as DBT or similar
Knowledge of monitoring (DataDog) and data modeling (Power BI) tools is a plus
Fluent in English (spoken and written)


Our Perks – More than just a job


You have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are creating the easiest way to travel. We want your ideas and give you autonomy to make them reality.
Flix is flexible. Organize your own schedule, and balance work between the office and home as it’s best for you. We give you trust-based hours and a flexible smart working policy.
Travelling is our passion. Discover the world with your free Flix rides and bring along your friends and family for half price.
Teamwork makes the dream work. Our FlixTeam has people from over 80 different nations. We work in a multicultural environment where we can challenge and support each other.
We're not only green in color. We’re building for the long term, and that means protecting our planet. We constantly test new green technologies and compensate for the CO2 after all our business travel since 2018.
Your well-being is important to us. To treat your mind and body we will give you a competitive paid time off package, mental health support including 1:1 consultations with a psychologist, and a neat discount on UrbanSportsClub memberships.


Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you!

About Flix

We are a global mobility provider with headquarters in Europe and the United States. Since 2013, we have changed the way millions of people have traveled, offering new alternatives for convenient, affordable and eco-friendly travel. Thanks to a unique business model and innovative technology, we have quickly established one of the largest long-distance mobility networks in the world – and our journey has just begun.

Flix is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Consultant - Join our Talent Community!
Description:
Company Description

We are looking for Senior Business Intelligence Consultants to join our Talent Community.

Please apply to this ad if you would like to be considered for our Business Intelligence Talent Community, and to be kept in the loop on future job openings in our team.

You will be helping our clients to get new insights from data, analyse and visualise their business to enable smarter decisions and better products & services delivery. Your primary focus will be in understanding business goals/KPIs, data ingestion, analysis and visualisation in cloud-based reporting tools.

Are you ready to grow your expertise? Education and development are not just empty words for us, and we will guide you through your learning journey.

We are part of Merkle, leading global agency in digital transformation, focused on improving customer experience and creating world-class solutions to our clients. Your team is a diverse group of people from more than 15 nationalities and different backgrounds. We have a supportive atmosphere, and our work is based on the principles of equality and inclusion.

We have a hybrid workplace with offices in Lisbon, Vila Real, Guarda and Leiria. Our BI Consultants report to BI Team Lead.

Job Description

What do our Senior BI Consultants do?


Participation in workshops with client's stakeholders to validate goals, expected inputs & deliverables
Doing requirements gathering, logical models, functional & technical designs
Performing data analysis of business requirements, understanding source data and map them to the target/common data model
Defining and implementing reports to visualize insights/KPIs on dashboards, using BI tools like PowerBI or Tableau
Working with data engineers to productionize data pipelines and automate reports generation & distribution


Qualifications

What person and previous experience are we looking for?


Previous experience in a similar BI functional role (5+ years) preferably in telco, financial or digital marketing services industry
Past experience in using BI tools like PowerBI, Tableau, Qlick Sense, Keboola
Solid proficiency in data warehousing concepts (ETL, Stage/Core layer, Dimensional Modelling, Data Marts etc.) and SQL programming
Experience with SQL databases, such as Oracle or MS SQL Server
Strong analytical and communication skills, data-oriented personality


Preferred Skills


Hands-on experience in MS Azure, AWS or other cloud-based environments is a big plus
Business expertise in areas of Digital Marketing (AdTech), Marketing Automation, CRM or e-commerce is a significant advantage
Understanding data workflow management and ETL tools like Informatica, Pentaho, Azure Data Factory, Airflow, NiFi, StreamSets, Glue, etc.
Understanding of big data processing using technologies like Hadoop, Spark, etc.
Proficiency in scripting languages like Python/JavaScript


Additional Information

Why you should work with us?!


We are cooperating with an all types and sizes of clients from all around the world which allows us to provide a very diverse portfolio of projects and technologies to choose from to our people.
You will be part of a startup-minded branch of a company with a very strong and stable background of the Swiss/German headquarters.
Your contributions will have a distinct impact on our clients


We offer even more


Cutting Edge Technology & Latest IT tools;
Software-house environment;
Agile and Flexible working hours;
Hybrid work system (remote friendly);
Digital nomad policy;
Focus on career development;
Health insurance (also included for the household);
Mental health support;
Volunteering experiences and sustainable mindset;
25 vacation days + 3 wellness days per year;
Beers (after 6pm), football, and ping-pong! #workhardplayhard
Free breakfast every second Monday of the month;
Employee discounts;
Team & Company events 🎉


Merkle do not discriminate against job applicants on the basis of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Experience stipulated in this job description serves as a guide only and all applications will be considered on their merits, irrespective of experience.

About Merkle

Merkle, a dentsu company, powers the experience economy. For more than 35 years, the company has put people at the heart of its approach to digital business transformation. As the only integrated experience consultancy in the world with a heritage in data science and business performance, Merkle delivers holistic, end-to-end experiences that drive growth, engagement, and loyalty. Merkle's expertise has earned recognition as a "Leader" by top industry analyst firms, in categories such as digital transformation and commerce, experience design, engineering and technology integration, digital marketing, data science, CRM and loyalty, and customer data management. With more than 16,000 employees, Merkle operates in 30+ countries throughout the Americas, EMEA, and APAC. For more information, visit www.merkle.com.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Empowered by our motto, "Making Data Matter", Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation. With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to elevate the impact of data.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, Keyrus is dedicated to helping businesses taking advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating, and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Job Summary

Keyrus is looking for a motivated and creative Data Engineer to help centralize and consolidate our data lake, ensuring data quality. The ideal candidate has expertise in data ingestion and ETL processes, coupled with a fervent commitment to making every piece of data matter. We value individuals who are detail-oriented, independent contributors with exceptional communication and problem-solving skills, ensuring that together, we continue to transform possibilities into reality. You will be part of an Agile squad, working with technical experts to ensure the correct implementation of the solution architecture.

Note: All applications/CV’s must be submitted in English.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and support data pipelines, warehouses, and reporting systems to solve business needs.
Analyze business requirements to propose relevant technical solutions.
Design data models and define optimized tables/views in BigQuery and SQL queries to improve performance or reduce costs.
Actively contribute to solution architecture by proposing:
New design patterns
Technologies
Improvements to existing applications or developing new ones.
Explore integration of generative AI features to improve user experience.
Ensure data security in all layers of the applications.
Collaborate with squad members to define and evolve development best practices, including:
Source code control
Re-usability
Coding standards.
Take ownership of full implementation, ensuring:
Quality of code
Unit tests
Integration tests
Reliability engineering (monitoring & alerting)
Performance of solutions.

Requirements For The Role


Advanced degree in engineering or a technical/scientific field of study.
Strong competency in data manipulation: SQL and Python are a must!
Talend is a plus, and Node.js is nice to have.
Proven expertise with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), specifically BigQuery and Cloud Functions.
Experience or willingness to learn Azure.
Experience with unit testing/TDD.
Experience using CI/CD pipelines as part of development.
Adaptability and curiosity.
Results-oriented mindset and empowerment.
Team spirit, able to build relationships and contribute to collective accountability.
String communication skills, including the ability to explain technology solutions in business terms.
Fluent in English
Must be a Portuguese or European citizen or have a work permit for Portugal


What We Offer At Keyrus Portugal


Competitive salary based on your skills & experience and according to the Data market practice
Meal allowance of €8.32 per day
Flexible benefits option
Private Medical Insurance
22 days of annual leave (increasing every 3 years up to a maximum of 25 days)
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration – Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

At Keyrus Portugal, we're more than just a company - we're a constellation of bright minds and innovative souls.

If you're seeking a place where your passion meets purpose, where every project is a canvas and every challenge an opportunity, then look no further.

Join us, and be a part of a community that's shaping the digital frontier. At Keyrus Portugal, your journey to greatness begins.

Title: Data Analyst - Tableau
Description:
This is a remote position.

Key Responsibilities:


Report Building: Develop, design, and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards using Tableau to support business needs.
Report Migration: Migrate existing reports from other platforms to Tableau, ensuring data integrity and consistency.
Consultative Role: Act as a consultant to various departments, understanding their data needs and providing insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can drive business decisions.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver data solutions that meet business objectives.
Training: Provide training and support to team members on Tableau best practices and data visualization techniques.


Requirements


Proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a strong focus on Tableau.
Proficiency in SQL and data manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Experience with data migration projects is a plus.

This is a remote position.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Report Building: Develop, design, and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards using Tableau to support business needs.
  • Report Migration: Migrate existing reports from other platforms to Tableau, ensuring data integrity and consistency.
  • Consultative Role: Act as a consultant to various departments, understanding their data needs and providing insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
  • Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can drive business decisions.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver data solutions that meet business objectives.
  • Training: Provide training and support to team members on Tableau best practices and data visualization techniques.

Requirements

  • Proficiency in SQL and data manipulation.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Experience with data migration projects is a plus.

Salary based on your skills and experience and according to the Software Development market practices.

Title: Data Analyst & BI - Remote Lisbon
Description:
The Wise Seeker is the leading HR technology company in unbiased talent evaluation.With over 15 years in the industry analyzing the needs and demands of the job market, we are capable of identifying the best talent for each company thanks to our team of professionals and our SaaS platform integrated with Artificial Intelligence.We are efficient, evaluate talent objectively without bias, and close hiring times in record time, delivering optimal results.

As a Data Analyst & BI Specialist, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and developing BI solutions to support strategic decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and deliver data-driven insights.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns.
Develop and maintain BI dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data models and visualizations.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support business initiatives and decision-making.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide insights to improve business processes.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reports and dashboards.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and BI.


Benefits


Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative and innovative work culture.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
About The Job


The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (“RISK MFI”) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (“GM”) and of BP2S with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring
Currently, RISK MFI Platform works on an Agile@Scale step-up as part of the Market, Counterparty and Liquidity Cluster (“MCL Cluster”). The RISK MFI Digital chapter (team) is composed by a group of data analysts that support the monitoring of the risks above mentioned and are part of the MCL Cluster tribes
The Digital chapter develops tools and industrialise many processes of the RISK MFI department. Projects have a strong focus on the use of new technologies to build tools that improve the risk management of the bank, with a strong focus on improving the user experience and making better use of the vast amount of available data. Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs
The Digital chapter works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best practices are followed and to target a smooth path to production of the tools developed by the team. This also means that for some projects, the Digital chapter codes directly in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues
The foremost element of the role is to drive development projects, related to risk management, to completion
The role requires a dynamic problem-solving approach to achieve real added value by improving the efficiency and robustness of existing processes and improving the risk monitoring. This is achieved in close collaboration with the risk management subject matter experts. As such, the role requires close coordination and collaboration with other RISK MFI teams and squads. As the main target of the team is to focus on building robust tools, a close collaboration with the RISK IT department is key

Your Main Activities Are


Analyse, re-engineer processes and implement in Python to harmonise such processes, improve efficiency, and reduce operational risk related to existing practices
Improve risk insight by making better use of data and improved visualisations
Focus on the path to production of the tools delivered by the team, making sure best practices are followed when developing tools, to simplify migration to a full industrial setup at a later stage
In addition to developing coding skills, the role enables the individual to gain knowledge across all elements of RISK MFI, covering market and/or counterparty risk. This includes all asset classes as well as all workflows and processes. Understanding the risk processes is key to delivering the best outcome of a project
Stakeholder and relationship building skills are necessary to ensure the individual can leverage the best outcomes for each project. In addition, project management skills are required to drive the various projects to completion

Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Engineering / Finance / Mathematics / Sciences / Economics / Econometrics / Computer Science or related
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in Programming language with a focos on Data Analytics (dictionaries / list / packages – NumPy, Pandas)
Attention to detail / rigor
Active listening
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Analytical ability
Communication skills, both written and oral
Client focused

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The COOL Company

At the COOL company, we believe in creating a win-win environment where everyone benefits. We are committed to ensuring users, publishers, franchisees, and advertisers all have a better experience and achieve more than they ever thought possible through our innovation, advanced AI, groundbreaking advertising technology, and teams of inspired experts. Our every move, expansion, acquisition, and upgrade is done to provide that better experience for an ever-growing list of satisfied clients and users all over the world.

Brands under the COOL company include ADventori, a data-driven, creative ad server capable of personalizing, automating, measuring, and optimizing digital ads and placements for advertisers; Balihoo, a complete advertising management platform for franchise and network businesses; COOL Media, a managed service solution for agencies and brands to reach and measure audiences; Insticator, a premier SSP and engagement platform for publishers; and OKO Digital, delivering website and app publishers everything they need to maximize their ad revenue.

Collectively, the COOL company reaches over 350 million consumers monthly across their network of premium publishers and advertisers, including Disney, Hyundai, Air France, Kohler, Suzuki, Acer, Pearle Vision, Trek, Brita, Viking Cruises, MLB, Playmaker, Blitz, Evolve Media, and more. Under the former umbrella of Insticator, the COOL company is a proud 7x recipient of the Inc 5000 list of America's fastest-growing private companies, a 2x recipient of Deloitte's Fast 500, recognized on Crain's New York Fast 50 list, recognized by Digiday's Digiday Media Awards as a company working to modernize digital media, and awarded as one of AdWeek's Top 10 Fastest Growing Solution Providers globally.

Our Core Values

At the COOL company, we believe in being C.O.O.L.:

Creative Optimistic Open-Minded Leaders

We creatively integrate new elements in innovative combinations, fueled by our optimism to drive success. Our open-mindedness allows us to embrace new ideas and approaches, empowering us to lead our industry through bold initiatives. That’s the attitude we bring to work with us every day, and it’s what we expect from everyone who works here.

That’s just part of the values that drive us to greatness. We also believe in this trio of truths that inform every decision we make and everything we do:


Sleeves Up: At the COOL company, we provide you with the autonomy and creativity needed to own your role. We encourage iteration where necessary so that you can drive massive impact.
100% Viewability: the COOL company is passionate about open feedback at all levels of the company. This allows us to fail fast, create in real-time, and build an open company culture.
Be Defiantly Great: We're defiant, and that's in our blood. Challenging the status quo is a central part of who we are. We're capable of much more than what others deem impossible.


About The Role

This is an opportunity to join the ad operations team and help the company gain more insights from data while supporting stakeholders with their analytical needs. Your day-to-day routine would involve activity tracking, optimization, suggesting improvements to the existing processes based on research. This is a great role for an organized, result driven, enthusiastic analytical person.

We operate with 2000 sites and are focused on increasing their revenue and

engagement. With hundreds of millions of rows of data per day, it is the job of the

analytics team to make sense of the data and visualize it for stakeholders use.

The data analyst will work with fellow teammates on the engineering, ad operations

and account management teams to ensure we:


Develop novel and effective analytic approaches
Optimize SSP performance
Manage UPRs pricing in Google Ad Manager
Increase process efficiency and maintain accuracy
Maximize the value our clients can derive from our data


Responsibilities and Duties


Analyze large sets of data daily using Looker, Tableau
ETLs, data preparation using different frameworks and SQL
Generate suggestions on how to run the processes/ad monetization more efficiently
Optimize auction floors (Google Ad Manager, SSP/RTB)
Work with stakeholders to prepare reports that will help them on daily basis
Maintain set of reports with data being accurate and timely
Visualize data and make it meaningful
Collaborate with engineering team to automate daily routine for better efficiency


Qualifications

Professional Competencies


2+ years of experience in an analytical position of Advertising-related company
Experience with Google Ad Manager and pricing rules optimization
Experience with data analysis methods
Advanced skills in Spreadsheet Software, such as Excel or Google Sheets required, including SQL (ability to write complex queries and ETLs)
Experience with Business Information Software, such as Tableau or Looker (with skills of data visualization)
Strong presentation skills, attention to detail, and communication abilities
Experience working in a fast-changing environment, adaptability to the changes and shifting priorities
Strong analytical, organizational, and task management skills.


Cultural Competencies


Must be able to work primarily between the hours of 9:30 AM - 6:30 PM ET
Must have a player/coach mentality, willing to both execute and lead
Ability to juggle multiple projects concurrently and set and meet deadlines
Skilled at receiving and providing direct feedback
Collaborative mindset and great teamwork skills
Entrepreneurial & adaptable; great learning skills
Curious, research-minded, data-informed
Able to search for possible solutions and apply them
Creative confidence
Proactive communicator
A sense of humor and a love of online culture
Thrives in a start-up culture


Benefits


Annual Performance Bonus
Paid Time Off
National Holidays

Title: Tableau Júnior (Data Analyst) - Lisboa/Híbrido
Description:
Descrição da Empresa

Founded in 1995, we are an international tech consulting company certified by Great Place to Work and in second place in The Best Workplaces 23. We offer innovative solutions to support our clients in their digital transformation. We have over a thousand talents specialized in different technologies, with offices in Portugal, Spain, the Netherlands, Brazil, Ireland, and the USA. Over the years, we have grown and expanded, always staying true to our core values of excellence, innovation, and customer satisfaction. Today, we are a leading player in our industry, with a reputation for delivering cutting-edge solutions that exceed our client's expectations.

Descrição da Função

A Noesis procura um perfil Junior de Tableau com as seguintes competências: * Formação superior em informática ou similar; * 1/2 anos de experiência comprovada em Tableau e análise de dados; * Experiência na criação de soluções eficazes de BI e dashboards em Tableau; * Experiência com SQL e Tableau Prep; * Experiência na construção e publicação de relatórios e dashboards interativos personalizados do Tableau; * Experiência com Tableau Desktop e Tableau Server; * Conhecimentos de tecnologias complementares, nomeadamente: Salesforce, Cloud (AWS, Azure), SQL, entre outras (ex: SAP Hana, Oracle, SQL Server e Snowflake). * Conhecimento das melhores práticas do Tableau; * Boas capacidades comunicacionais e interpessoais; * Fluência em inglês (escrito e falado). Se reúnes estas condições e gostarias de integrar uma organização inovadora, que aposta continuamente na formação dos seus talentos, envia-nos a tua candidatura. Join us. Let’s innovate together! Localização


Lisboa, Portugal

A Noesis procura um perfil Junior de Tableau com as seguintes competências: * Formação superior em informática ou similar; * 1/2 anos de experiência comprovada em Tableau e análise de dados; * Experiência na criação de soluções eficazes de BI e dashboards em Tableau; * Experiência com SQL e Tableau Prep; * Experiência na construção e publicação de relatórios e dashboards interativos personalizados do Tableau; * Experiência com Tableau Desktop e Tableau Server; * Conhecimentos de tecnologias complementares, nomeadamente: Salesforce, Cloud (AWS, Azure), SQL, entre outras (ex: SAP Hana, Oracle, SQL Server e Snowflake). * Conhecimento das melhores práticas do Tableau; * Boas capacidades comunicacionais e interpessoais; * Fluência em inglês (escrito e falado). Se reúnes estas condições e gostarias de integrar uma organização inovadora, que aposta continuamente na formação dos seus talentos, envia-nos a tua candidatura. Join us. Let’s innovate together! Pessoal responsável: 0

Localização

  • Lisboa, Portugal

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Job Purpose

Analyze media coverage from company monitoring platforms to derive actionable intelligence for clients. Take ownership of the final report quality, ensuring that high standards are met. Continuously enhance the reporting process and overall efficiency to support company objectives and client requirements.




Roles and Responsibilities

Analysis and Reporting:

Report Ownership: Take full ownership of the final quality of reports, ensuring they meet client standards and expectations.
Media Content Analysis: Analyze media content to extract meaningful insights that support clients' business goals.
High-Quality Reporting: Produce high-quality client reports, both qualitative and quantitative, within tight deadlines. Include tables, charts, summaries, and narratives to clearly present findings.
Ongoing Report Enhancement: seeking feedback from senior insight managers and operational insight managers to improve the reports and team members to continuously improve the reporting process.
Ongoing Process Enhancement: Continuously work on enhancing the reporting process to improve efficiency and profitability.

Additional Duties:

Time Logging: Regularly log time allocated for each assignment/report in TICK to ensure accurate tracking of work hours.
Policy Adherence: Comply with CARMA policies and procedures, supporting the company's mission and vision.
Additional Duties: Perform other job-related tasks as assigned by the direct manager.




Competencies

Core Competencies

Dedication

Courage

Intellectual Curiosity

Passion

Compassion

Behavioral Skills

Attention to Details

Analytical Thinking

Accountability and Ownership

Relationship Building

Stress Management

Organizational Commitment

Technical Competencies/Skills

Knowledge in MS Office, mainly PowerPoint and Excel

Excellent command of English and Portuguese

Excellent report writing skills

Data visualization




Job Requirements

Education

BA in Journalism, Business Analytics, Communication, Advertising, Marketing, Public Relations or any related field.

Experience

1 year of experience in an analytical role (including data analysis, market research) within marketing research, media intelligence and data technology, or consulting firm is preferred.

1 year of Market research, data analytics or exposure to traditional and social media is preferred.

Familiar with data visualization and dashboard tools, Microsoft Excel, pivot tables, etc.

Experience in both qualitative and quantitative reporting is preferred.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
With just over 7 years of experience in the Portuguese market, we share our DNA with more than 200 workers and position our offer according to 3 lines of service:

  • Strategy (Outsourcing, NeXel, Team as a Service, Tech Academies);
  • R&D (Bootcamps, POC, Tech Lab);
  • Nearshore.


In ADENTIS, we focus on PEOPLE. This is our emotional salary:

  • Great Work-Life balance;
  • Very flexible organizational routine;
  • Health benefits (for you and your family);
  • Team Building activities;
  • Over 300 protocols to offer you great discounts in different areas;
  • Continuous professional development sponsored by our Training and Certification Department;
  • Regular feedback on your performance through a personalized plan;
  • Comprehensive career plan and progression involving assertive performance reviews.


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems or a related field;
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in a data analysis;
  • Proficient in using PowerBI and Tableau for data visualization and reporting;
  • Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts, ETL processes and SQL;
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail;
  • Ability to gather and interpret business and functional requirements and translate them into technical specifications;
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders;
  • Experience working in a hybrid environment and capable of working independently as well as part of a team;
  • Fluent in English.


If you want to be part of a real People First organization, apply now!

We walk with you!

REF: LX.ADN.LX.ADN.BDA

At Adentis we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All candidates with skills for the position are welcome!

Title: Data Analyst - Sintra
Description:
Descrição da Empresa

A HRB SOLUTIONS é uma Empresa de Consultadoria, especializada em Desenvolver e Implementar Soluções Integradas em Gestão de Recursos Humanos. Assessoramos as Empresas e participamos activamente no seu crescimento e consolidação. Apostamos numa postura de total disponibilidade perante o Cliente – Empresa ou Particular, revelando-se este, o nosso principal foco de atenção e de prioridade. Promovemos a participação do Cliente no Desenvolvimento de todos os Projectos, na medida em que só desta forma será possível estabelecer Parcerias de Sucesso. Pautamo-nos por um perfil de actuaçõo Low Profile, Flexível, Fiável e Célere na Conclusão e na Implementação dos Projectos desenvolvidos. A experiência e a ética da Equipa HRB SOLUTIONS garantem Integridade e Fiabilidade em todos os processos, tanto com Clientes como com Candidatos. Somos uma equipa Experiente, Dinâmica, Versátil, Entusiasta e Proactiva. O Rigor e a Qualidade dos Serviços que prestamos são o nosso melhor cartão-de-visita.

Descrição da Função

A HRB Solutions encontra-se em Processo de Recrutamento para empresa multinacional, líder global em tratamento de água. No seguimento da sua estratégia de consolidação e crescimento, no qual tem desenvolvido uma gama abrangente de soluções – ex: sistemas simples de filtração ou soluções comerciais de água potável – o nosso Cliente pretende recrutar um Analista de Dados. FUNÇÕES Enquanto Analista de Dados, o candidato selecionado terá à sua responsabilidade a tradução das necessidades e requisitos de clientes internos em soluções práticas e viáveis. Deverá também identificar oportunidades de melhoria nos processos de negócio, ajudando assim a definir especificações para projetos e iniciativas. Nesse sentido, entre as funções a realizar, destacam-se: - Analisar a informação em sistema e respetivos processos de trabalho; - Identificar pontos-chave de correção e melhoria nos processos; - Fazer ponte entre o processo, colaboradores e sistema; - Assegurar o tratamento de informação para reorganização da mesma em sistemas e respetivos processos; - Implementar as alterações definidas, supervisionando as mesmas. PERFIL - Formação superior em Engenharia Informática, Estatística Aplicada, Matemática ou área relevante para a função; - Fluência em inglês, oral e escrita; - Experiência profissional mínima de 2 anos na área de Análise de Dados; - Domínio das ferramentas Microsoft Office, nomeadamente Excel avançado; - Experiência com sistemas ERP, como SAP, ERP Cloud e Dynamics 365; - Conhecimento das metodologias Agile/Scrum; - Capacidades de negociação suscetíveis de alcançar objetivos viáveis para todas as partes envolvidas; - Atenção ao detalhe, rigor e à priorização de tarefas; - Excelentes capacidades de comunicação, organização e responsabilidade; - Fortes competências a nível de análise, resolução de problemas e de relacionamento interpessoal. CONDIÇÕES - Contrato de trabalho a tempo integral; - Regime de trabalho presencial, com possibilidade de evolução para regime híbrido/remoto; - Renumeração compatível com a função e a experiência comprovada; - Formação contínua e perspetivas de evolução; - Integração numa empresa em rápida ascensão e com um projeto dinâmico e aliciante.

Localização


Lisboa, Portugal

Title: Fullstack Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for an Fullstack Data Analyst!




Responsibilities:

Understand the company’s requirements and identify KPIs for the development of dashboards related to cyber security risk management.
Collect, clean, and transform data sets using ETL tools to create effective data models.
Develop and maintain dashboards and ensure the accuracy and availability of data related to managing cyber security risks.
Use Dataiku and PostgreSQL for data processing and analysis, including statistical techniques.
Leverage on machine learning algorithms to identify additional insights and define non explicit correlations between indicators.
Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, making recommendations for action when appropriate to improve Dashboard production.
Continuously improve the accuracy and usability of data by monitoring data quality and developing new data models.
Demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying problems and provide solutions.
Work effectively with other team members (in various locations), to ensure effective and efficient execution of projects.
Manage several projects and priorities, demonstrating a satisfactory level of autonomy and time management skills.




Requirements:

A bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject.
3+ years of experience as data Analyst, developing Dashboard and DataViz
Knowledge of algorithms is a plus and will enable the candidate to be a force for proposing useful content related to cyber security risk management.
Expertise with POWERBI, TABLEAU, DATAIKU, PostgreSQL and ETL tools (e.g., TABLEAU Certified Data Analyst, DATAIKU Advanced Designer Certificate)
Experience with other data visualization tools such as POWERBI
Basic Python skills.
Good level of english.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com, with the reference “FullstackData”.




Thank you! :)




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.
