Title: Data Support Analyst
Description:
Who is Clever?

Clever Advertising is a multinational digital brand serving the iGaming industry for the last 15 years with innovative advertising and technology solutions.

We are dedicated to your professional and personal growth in an environment that values knowledge-sharing and mentorship.




Why joining Clever?

Working with us means joining a diverse team where each member contributes to collective success, supporting one another through shared goals and passions. We not only focus on achieving excellent results but also enjoy the journey, making every day both fulfilling and fun.




Where will I work from?

Porto, Portugal.




What is my department like?

Our Technology Department is the driving force behind the innovations that propel our company forward. Committed to creating scalable and high-quality solutions, we work in a collaborative environment where every idea matters. Our teams of experts in development, infrastructure, security, and data intelligence are driven by a passion for solving complex challenges and delivering impactful results. We value diversity of thought and believe that the best solutions arise from collaboration between diverse and creative minds




What is my role like?

We are looking for a dedicated and detail-oriented Data Support Analyst to join our Data Management team. The ideal candidate will have effective communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with various departments, ensuring that data operations are executed with accuracy and efficiency.




What will my daily tasks involve?

Assist the Data Management team in interacting with other departments, facilitating communication and collaboration to ensure that data projects meet the needs of all stakeholders.
Manage and resolve first-level support tickets related to data, including issues with dashboards, RPA bots, and data loading processes.
Monitor and ensure that dashboard loads are executed correctly, identifying and resolving any performance or loading issues.
Validate bots developed by the RPA team, ensuring they function as expected and comply with established requirements.
Create and maintain detailed documentation for data processes, RPA bots, and support procedures, ensuring that information is always up-to-date and accessible.




What is expected from me?

Minimum of 1 year of experience in data support, data analysis, or similar roles.
Familiarity with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Basic knowledge of SQL and ETL practices.
Ability to maintain technical documentation.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to solve problems quickly and effectively.
Attention to detail and accuracy when working with data are differentiating factors.




What can I expect from Clever?

A competitive remuneration package
Superior health benefits
Employee cafeteria featuring meals approved by our nutritionist
Wellbeing support through our Happiness Department, including 24/7 medical app access,complimentary nutritional consultations, psychological support, and wellness webinars.
A commitment to professional growth with tailored development plans and opportunities for internal career moves.
An education-rich workplace with access to the Clever Academy and language learning opportunities.
A balanced approach to work-life dynamics.




At Clever, we believe in diversity and inclusion as drivers of innovation. We foster a work environment free from discrimination, where everyone has equal opportunities to succeed.




Ready to make a Clever choice?

Title: Data Analyst(Tableau Expert)
HTML:
Procuramos qualidade e força de vontade !

Gostas de partilhar, celebrar o sucesso em conjunto?

Escutas, pensas e propões?

Utilizas o inesperado para ter sucesso?

Gostas de inspirar os outros com a tua atitude?


Be the NEX T Data Analyst(Tableau Expert)!!!


Main Responsibilities:


  • Design and maintain dashboards in Tableau;
  • Design data ingestion pipelines to gather data from various sources such as databases, APIs, and files;
  • Design data processing pipelines to clean, filter, and pre-process data for analysis;
  • Optimize data pipelines, framework code, cluster utilization, and configuration to ensure the best performance from pipelines;
  • Design, maintain, and enforce data governance and data catalog;
  • Maintain a coherent documentation of the framework, cluster, and projects;
  • Collaborate with data scientists, data analysts, and stakeholders to elicit data requirements and deliver effective solutions;


Technical skills:


  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field;
  • 3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst;
  • Strong proficiency in Python;
  • Knowledge of Apache Spark, Apache Hadoop, Airflow, and Presto;
  • Proficiency in SQL queries and a good understanding of database architecture;
  • Experience creating data sources and dashboards on Data Visualization software like Tableau and PowerBI;
  • Familiarity with in-house big data platforms;
  • Good knowledge of data modeling, data structures, data management, and best practices;
  • Familiarity with containerization and orchestration technologies.



A NEX T é uma consultora tecnológica que actua a nível nacional e internacional, com principal foco na área de IT, Marketing Digital, Data Mining, Data Science e Automação de Processos.

Oferecemos:

  • Remuneração compatível com a experiência profissional;
  • Evolução de carreira;
  • Acompanhamento personalizado;
  • Plano de Formação;
  • Oportunidade para fazer parte de uma equipa em grande crescimento.


Your NEX T step is right here!

Partilha o teu cv para fernando.garcia@nextengineering.pt com a REFª FGA

Title: Data Analyst - MCC
HTML:
A Capwatt promove, detém e opera soluções integradas de otimização energética, contribuindo para um paradigma sustentável de energia. A cultura da empresa baseia-se nas pessoas, o nosso principal ativo. Continuamos a crescer, a aumentar a nossa equipa do Metering & Control Center e estamos à procura de uma pessoa que partilhe o nosso propósito, trazendo valor como Data Analyst.


Principais responsabilidades:

  • Garantir a recolha automatizada, limpeza e organização dos dados das diversas fontes internas e externas;
  • Realizar análise exploratória de dados para identificar padrões e tendências, recorrendo a modelos estatísticos e algoritmos de machine learning;
  • Interpretar os resultados das análises dos dados e comunicar insights de forma clara;
  • Construir e validar modelos preditivos para suportar tomadas de decisão, monitorizando o seu desempenho;
  • Criar dashboards e relatórios interactivos para visualizar os dados uteis a cada negócio, colaborando com as equipas de design e marketing para melhorar as apresentações;
  • Trabalhar em colaboração com outras areas, para conhecer as estratégias e necessidades e assim aumentar o impacto das análises dos dados nas decisões dos negócios.


Requisitos:

  • Formação académica superior em Ciência de Dados, Estatística, Matemática ou Informática;
  • Experiência profissional mínima de 3 a 5 anos em funções similares;
  • Conhecimentos de Programação em Python e R;
  • Conhecimento de ferramentas de machine learning e AI;
  • Conhecimento em PBI e ferramentas de visualização de dados;
  • Experiência na criação, gestão e operações em bases de dados;
  • Conhecimentos de Inglês e Espanhol;
  • Capacidade de comunicação, facilidade no relacionamento interpessoal e trabalho em equipa;
  • Capacidade analítica e de resolução de problemas complexos;
  • Capacidade de organização e planeamento.


O que oferecemos?

  • Ambiente de trabalho flexível;
  • Programa de benefícios exclusivo;
  • Oportunidades de formação e desenvolvimento;
  • Oportunidades de mobilidade interna;
  • Reconhecimento pessoal e profissional, com base na meritocracia.


Promovemos a igualdade de oportunidades

Somos um empregador que oferece igualdade de oportunidades e valorizamos a diversidade em nossa empresa. Procuramos assegurar que todos os candidatos sejam tratados de forma justa e equitativa ao longo do nosso processo de recrutamento. Estamos decididos a tomar medidas para que nenhum candidato seja discriminado por motivos de sexo, raça, etnia, religião ou crença, deficiência, idade, identidade de género, orientação sexual, estado civil, gravidez e maternidade ou qualquer outro motivo proibido pelas leis aplicáveis. Acreditamos firmemente que uma cultura conscientemente inclusiva traz o melhor de todos e assim nos torna uma melhor equipa num ambiente seguro.

Title: DATA ANALYST – ENERGY & UTILITIES
HTML:
ABOUT WIIMER

Wiimer is an AI and data analytics consulting firm on a mission to unlock the potential of data-intensive industries providing an innovative approach to business processes and decision making. We develop and deliver expert-trained decision-aid models and digital solutions based on a unique combination of business acumen, advanced analytics and information technologies. We are proud to have filled in #themissingdot for tier one companies located in more than nine different countries.

Wiimer recruits globally, resorting to cutting edge teamwork technology. Wiimers are currently based in Portugal, Spain, UK, and Latin America.

 

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Wiimers are bright, curious, enthusiasts, hard-working individuals together on a mission: delivering expert-trained decision-aid models and digital solutions to data-intensive industries, by combining business acumen, advanced analytics and information technologies.

This time we are looking for a Data Analyst eager to work in the Energy and Utilities Sector to join us in Porto (Hybrid).

 

AT WIIMER YOU WILL

  • Participate in AI & data analytics end-to-end client projects, tackling complex business problems with strategic thinking and creativity, and developing solutions that bring significant business value to our clients;
  • Be involved in highly dynamic teams, multi-disciplinary and cross-industry projects (although a strong focus in the Energy and Utilities sector is expected)
  • Be in direct contact with the client and be involved in meetings to present results and insights to the client;
  • Be responsible for core project activities, including, notably, extraction, transformation and loading of datasets, as well as developing learning algorithms and BI dashboards.

 

WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO SUCCEED

  • Degree/master’s in engineering, computer science, information technologies or related field;
  • Working and/or academic background in the Energy and Utilities Sector (not mandatory, although appreciated);
  • 1 to 2 years of relevant technical experience in analytics /business intelligence delivering end-to-end projects;
  • Understanding of machine learning and optimization techniques and algorithms;
  • Experience in data engineering and ML programming languages (Python and/or R);
  • Experience in working MLOps tools (e.g. MLflow) (not mandatory, although appreciated);
  • Experience with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (e.g. Azure, Databricks, PowerBI, Looker) (not mandatory, although appreciated);
  • Experience in SQL programming with data bases, such as SQL Server, MySQL, SQLite, PostgreSQL;
  • Experience with generative AI tools (e.g. Azure OpenAI and ChatGPT builder) (not mandatory, although appreciated);
  • Excellent English language skills;
  • Knowledge in Agile methodology, using tools like Planner, Trello or Jira;
  • Written and verbal communication skills.

 

WHAT YOU WILL FIND AT WIIMER

At Wiimer, we offer more than just a workplace. You’ll discover a dynamic and collaborative environment, where every day brings new and exciting challenges, working with major clients across various geographies. We prioritize work-life balance, offering a hybrid work model and flexible benefits designed around your needs. And when your birthday comes, it’s time to celebrate – with the day off!

We are committed to your ongoing development, providing access to specialized learning platforms and continuous training opportunities. At Wiimer, we foster an environment where your professional journey and personal development thrive together, all within a supportive, human-centered, and inclusive culture.

More on our culture and values at www.wiimer.com

 

Wiimer is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We foster a diverse culture where individual differences are recognized and appreciated.

Apply also at www.wiimer.com

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we’re able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

  • Knowledge of Apache Spark, Apache Hadoop, Airflow and Prest;
  • Fluent English.

Title: Fullstack Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for an Fullstack Data Analyst!




Responsibilities:

Understand the company’s requirements and identify KPIs for the development of dashboards related to cyber security risk management.
Collect, clean, and transform data sets using ETL tools to create effective data models.
Develop and maintain dashboards and ensure the accuracy and availability of data related to managing cyber security risks.
Use Dataiku and PostgreSQL for data processing and analysis, including statistical techniques.
Leverage on machine learning algorithms to identify additional insights and define non explicit correlations between indicators.
Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, making recommendations for action when appropriate to improve Dashboard production.
Continuously improve the accuracy and usability of data by monitoring data quality and developing new data models.
Demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying problems and provide solutions.
Work effectively with other team members (in various locations), to ensure effective and efficient execution of projects.
Manage several projects and priorities, demonstrating a satisfactory level of autonomy and time management skills.




Requirements:

A bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject.
3+ years of experience as data Analyst, developing Dashboard and DataViz
Knowledge of algorithms is a plus and will enable the candidate to be a force for proposing useful content related to cyber security risk management.
Expertise with POWERBI, TABLEAU, DATAIKU, PostgreSQL and ETL tools (e.g., TABLEAU Certified Data Analyst, DATAIKU Advanced Designer Certificate)
Experience with other data visualization tools such as POWERBI
Basic Python skills.
Good level of english.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com, with the reference “FullstackData”.




Thank you! :)




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Show more
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


  • DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
  • DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
  • DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for an Fullstack Data Analyst!


Responsibilities:

  • Understand the company’s requirements and identify KPIs for the development of dashboards related to cyber security risk management.
  • Collect, clean, and transform data sets using ETL tools to create effective data models.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and ensure the accuracy and availability of data related to managing cyber security risks.
  • Use Dataiku and PostgreSQL for data processing and analysis, including statistical techniques.
  • Leverage on machine learning algorithms to identify additional insights and define non explicit correlations between indicators.
  • Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, making recommendations for action when appropriate to improve Dashboard production.
  • Continuously improve the accuracy and usability of data by monitoring data quality and developing new data models.
  • Demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying problems and provide solutions.
  • Work effectively with other team members (in various locations), to ensure effective and efficient execution of projects.
  • Manage several projects and priorities, demonstrating a satisfactory level of autonomy and time management skills.


Requirements:

  • A bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject.
  • 3+ years of experience as data Analyst, developing Dashboard and DataViz
  • Knowledge of algorithms is a plus and will enable the candidate to be a force for proposing useful content related to cyber security risk management.
  • Expertise with POWERBI, TABLEAU, DATAIKU, PostgreSQL and ETL tools (e.g., TABLEAU Certified Data Analyst, DATAIKU Advanced Designer Certificate)
  • Experience with other data visualization tools such as POWERBI
  • Basic Python skills.
  • Good level of english.


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com, with the reference “FullstackData”.


Thank you! :)


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
BARKYN’S VISION

Barkyn delivers health and happiness to pet families around the world.

Our mission is to impact an important part of dog families' lives by giving them more years, more joy, and a deeper bond. We're changing the pet market and how e-commerce should feel: human, personalized, and beautiful. We were considered one of Europe’s Top 100 Startups by Wired, Top 50 Technology Fast by Deloitte, and a success case by Web Summit.

THE ROLE

We're creating a loved brand in Europe, and this is where your story begins!

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will help our brand's evolution across Europe with the right data insights.

Specifically, we expect you to:


Execute Data initiatives, mainly reporting dashboards and in-depth data analysis
Define and improve the architecture of our Data structure and Dashboards to be aligned with our business goals
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams and team managers to ensure seamless execution and efficient prioritization



Mandatory requirements:


Minimum 7 years of experience at multiple companies and at least in one B2C business
Hands-on experience on reporting, analytics, dashboards and BI
Experience with BigQuery or similar and Google Cloud
Experience with Python



Brownie points:


Experience with AI models
Experience at a medium-sized startup, ideally at a scale-up stage
Dog owner.

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx) (m/f) – Hybrid (Porto)
Description:
Descrição da Empresa

Somos uma Consultora com competências multidisciplinares dotada de um portfólio que abrange diversas áreas, como Financeira, Telecomunicações, Automóvel. Desenvolvemos Produtos e Projectos. Estamos presentes em empresas de referência Nacionais e Internacionais. A nossa combinação única de soluções tecnológicas, metodologias e os nossos recursos humanos qualificam a entrega aos nossos clientes.

Descrição da Função

Match Profiler is an Information Systems consultant who has been working in the national and international market since 1999. We have multidisciplinary skills and IT know-how that allow us to contribute, optimize and progress with our clients. We are currently recruiting, for integration in our internal team/client, professionals with the following profile: Data Analyst (Alteryx) (m/f) – Hybrid (Porto) What do you need to have: Hard Skills:


BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation
Proven experience in Alteryx and VBA
Alteryx experience: + 2 years
Good Knowledge of SQL;
Good level of English - minimum B2 (mandatory)
Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required.
Power BI. (Plus)
Previous experience on financial area. (Plus)
Knowledge in agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban) (Plus)
French (Plus) Soft skills
Good communication
Team spirit
Proactivity
Time management What we can offer:
Personalized support from your team
Your manager will take into consideration your motivations and suggestions
Victories will be celebrated together
Your HR and Support Teams will always be available to help
Constant feedback on your work
A network of hundreds of partnerships with companies from numerous sectors that offer you exclusive discounts (health, well-being, travel, gastronomy, culture, leisure, training, etc)
And, of course, many gatherings and social events Localização
Porto, Portugal

Title: Data Analyst (Focus on Alteryx or Dataiku) – M/F - Porto – Open Ended Contract – Hybrid
Description:
WHO ARE WE ?

BNP PARIBAS CARDIF, the Insurer for a Changing World.

We are the world leader in the creditor insurance market with strong positions in savings and protection insurance in more than 30 countries all around the world.

European Service Center - Cardif Services, European Platform of Services with a diversity of processes aiming to bring excellence to our Internal Clients, being part of BNP Paribas Cardif, is an organization dedicated to providing other BNP Paribas Cardif entities with a diversity of processes and services connected to insurance activity. We aim to bring excellence to our internal clients, ensuring highest levels of efficiency and reliability. With over 480 employees and 6 working languages, we are a multicultural and a diverse team, operating in Porto and Lisbon, Portugal.

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst (M/F) based in Oporto

BE PART OF OUR DYNAMIC RSBI TEAM

As a Technical expert / administrator of Data Visualization et Data Preparation solution, you will have to ensure the functioning of existing Dashboards (based on DataViz solutions) et Data preparation tools, and develop new ones for Finance and Actuarial needs

YOUR FUTURE MISSION IN RSBI TEAM


Create and maintain DataPrep wokflow / tools (Alteryx / Dataiku)
Modeling and development of dashboards within PowerBi and Tableau technologies
Write functional and/or technical documentation and create POCs (Proof Of Concept)
Ensure diagnostics and resolution of malfunctions
Participate to the implementation process improvements
Manipulate data to facilitate decisions by Finance teams


As Our New Accounting Analyst, You Must Have


Information systems background
Professional background about 2/3 years in a similar position
Knowledge of Application design and Data Visualization modeling
Data Preparation workflow modeling skillls are mandatory (Dataiku and/or Alteryx)
Databases / SQL language and Data Modeling (DMC)
Data Visualization / Restitution tools (mainly Tableau and Power BI)
Be fluent in English (B2/C1 level) and French is a plus


What Do We Offer

Besides our attractive salary, you will benefit :


Meals allowance
Transportation allowance
Child allowance
Private Health Insurance including spouse and descendants, Life Insurance, Travel Insurance
Hybrid working mode – a balance between office days to reinforce commitment, creativity and human links, and homeworking days for flexibility of the employees
Continuous development and career growth opportunities on a local and global level
And much more…


The work environment is important!


Benefit from our modern amenities, including zen and creative rooms amongst others, many discounts from our group platform, free language courses, doctor on-site & remote and diverse company events,
Work in a multicultural environment with multiple nationalities,
Be part of a people care company with a strong & continuous growth investing in its employees through training and career opportunities.


Our commitments to you


Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas Cardif is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas Cardif we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas Cardif, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment.

If your profile and motivations matches our needs and you feel motivated to join our company, do not hesitate in sending us you application.

We will be delighted to consider you for this position.

Please note that only applications submitted with CV, Cover letter & Certificate of Studies will be considered and move forward in the application process.

Title: Internship Global Program - Finance Data Analyst - Jumia (Full Time)
Description:
About Jumia:

Jumia believes that technology has the potential to transform everyday life in Africa for the better. Jumia was built to help consumers access millions of goods and services conveniently and at the best prices while opening up a new way for sellers to reach consumers and grow their businesses.

Listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in 2019, Jumia is the leading e-commerce company in Africa, operating in 11 countries. The Jumia platform consists of a marketplace, which connects sellers with consumers, a logistics service, which enables the shipment and delivery of packages from sellers to consumers, and a payment service, JumiaPay, which offers a safe and easy solution to facilitate online payment transactions. The company offers goods across a broad range of categories, such as phones and electronics, home appliances, fast-moving consumer goods, fashion and beauty.

What you will be doing


Enabling faster and better decision-making by our leaders as well as automation of processes
Execution of diverse analytical projects using statistical as well as machine learning techniques to help optimize our business processes
Developing new dashboards; maintaining and optimizing existing reports
Data exploration to understand current data availability; data mining in order to propose new analysis and evaluate the feasibility of fulfilling new information requests from management
Ensuring that the data contained within our business reporting is accurate, clean and in line with the definitions as per the business function owner
Contribute to preparing data requests for systems teams in order to facilitate the automation of the reporting domain
Planning and tracking own work against business and project deadlines.


What we are looking for


Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering or IT-related field
Proficiency in SQL languages and in Microsoft applications (PowerBI, Excel) is highly desirable
Knowledge of statistical programming languages like R and/or Python is a "plus"
Strong communicator, a strategic mindset with good analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in English


We Offer:


A unique experience in an entrepreneurial, yet structured environment
A unique opportunity of having strong impact in building the African e-commerce sector
The opportunity to become part of a highly professional and dynamic team
An unparalleled personal and professional growth as our longer term objective is to train the next generation of leaders


Please ensure to only apply for jobs with Jumia through our official website.

Jumia will never charge you a fee to apply for a job: be wary of websites that claim to help you apply for a Jumia job or that charge a fee to get you a job.

Title: Data Engineer Junior
Description:
Referência centenária no setor automóvel e da mobilidade, o Grupo JAP representa 15 marcas automóveis, em mais de 60 pontos de venda e reparação CARBY, detém a MATRIZAUTO (maior megastore de viaturas seminovas e usadas do país) e o master franchise da rent a car SIXT em Portugal.




Nacionalmente é, também, uma referência no mercado das máquinas agrícolas e industriais e de movimentação de cargas, com o Entreposto Máquinas, representante oficial de mais de 10 marcas do setor.




Em África, o Grupo está presente em Angola, Quénia, Uganda e Tanzânia, onde é uma força em crescimento no mercado dos veículos pesados (MAN) e das máquinas agrícolas e industriais. Já em Moçambique, com a marca Entreposto, é uma referência de soluções de mobilidade, com viaturas ligeiras e pesadas, máquinas agrícolas e industriais e outros serviços adjacentes.




Fazer parte do universo JAP é um compromisso com a evolução e a diversidade de mercados, clientes, geografias, pessoas e equipas.




Se procura um desafio profissional aliciante, este projeto é para si!




Responsabilidades:

- Desenvolver, testar e manter pipelines de dados eficientes e escaláveis.

- Colaborar com as equipas de análise e desenvolvimento para entender e responder às -necessidades de dados.

- Assegurar a integridade e qualidade dos dados através da implementação de processos de monitorização e validação.

- Participar na modelação de dados para suportar as necessidades analíticas da empresa.

- Otimizar processos ETL (Extração, Transformação e Carregamento) para maximizar o desempenho.

- Documentar procedimentos e fluxos de trabalho relacionados com dados.




Perfil:

- Licenciatura em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia de Dados, ou área relacionada.

- Capacidade para desenhar e implementar uma arquitetura de dados.

- Noções básicas de processos ETL.

- Conhecimentos básicos de Python.

- Conhecimento em SQL e SQL Server Integration Services.

- Forte capacidade analítica e vontade de aprender novas tecnologias.




Oferecemos:

- Integração num Grupo sólido e credível, tendo em curso a implementação de vários projetos de crescimento;

- Formação e possibilidade de desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal;

- Oportunidade real de progressão de carreira, de acordo com o desempenho e as competências demonstradas;

- Boas condições de trabalho e regalias sociais em vigor na empresa (Seguro de Saúde e Seguro de Vida).

Show more

- Colaborar com as equipas de análise e desenvolvimento para entender e responder às -necessidades de dados.

- Assegurar a integridade e qualidade dos dados através da implementação de processos de monitorização e validação.

- Participar na modelação de dados para suportar as necessidades analíticas da empresa.

- Otimizar processos ETL (Extração, Transformação e Carregamento) para maximizar o desempenho.

- Documentar procedimentos e fluxos de trabalho relacionados com dados.


Perfil:

- Licenciatura em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia de Dados, ou área relacionada.

- Capacidade para desenhar e implementar uma arquitetura de dados.

- Noções básicas de processos ETL.

- Conhecimentos básicos de Python.

- Conhecimento em SQL e SQL Server Integration Services.

- Forte capacidade analítica e vontade de aprender novas tecnologias.


Oferecemos:

- Integração num Grupo sólido e credível, tendo em curso a implementação de vários projetos de crescimento;

- Formação e possibilidade de desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal;

- Oportunidade real de progressão de carreira, de acordo com o desempenho e as competências demonstradas;

- Boas condições de trabalho e regalias sociais em vigor na empresa (Seguro de Saúde e Seguro de Vida).

Title: Data Analyst (Focus on Alteryx or Dataiku) – M/F - Porto – Open Ended Contract – Hybrid
Description:
WHO ARE WE ?

BNP PARIBAS CARDIF, the Insurer for a Changing World.

We are the world leader in the creditor insurance market with strong positions in savings and protection insurance in more than 30 countries all around the world.

European Service Center - Cardif Services, European Platform of Services with a diversity of processes aiming to bring excellence to our Internal Clients, being part of BNP Paribas Cardif, is an organization dedicated to providing other BNP Paribas Cardif entities with a diversity of processes and services connected to insurance activity. We aim to bring excellence to our internal clients, ensuring highest levels of efficiency and reliability. With over 480 employees and 6 working languages, we are a multicultural and a diverse team, operating in Porto and Lisbon, Portugal.

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst (M/F) based in Oporto

BE PART OF OUR DYNAMIC RSBI TEAM

As a Technical expert / administrator of Data Visualization et Data Preparation solution, you will have to ensure the functioning of existing Dashboards (based on DataViz solutions) et Data preparation tools, and develop new ones for Finance and Actuarial needs

YOUR FUTURE MISSION IN RSBI TEAM


Create and maintain DataPrep wokflow / tools (Alteryx / Dataiku)
Modeling and development of dashboards within PowerBi and Tableau technologies
Write functional and/or technical documentation and create POCs (Proof Of Concept)
Ensure diagnostics and resolution of malfunctions
Participate to the implementation process improvements
Manipulate data to facilitate decisions by Finance teams


As Our New Accounting Analyst, You Must Have


Information systems background
Professional background about 2/3 years in a similar position
Knowledge of Application design and Data Visualization modeling
Data Preparation workflow modeling skillls are mandatory (Dataiku and/or Alteryx)
Databases / SQL language and Data Modeling (DMC)
Data Visualization / Restitution tools (mainly Tableau and Power BI)
Be fluent in English (B2/C1 level) and French is a plus


What Do We Offer

Besides our attractive salary, you will benefit :


Meals allowance
Transportation allowance
Child allowance
Private Health Insurance including spouse and descendants, Life Insurance, Travel Insurance
Hybrid working mode – a balance between office days to reinforce commitment, creativity and human links, and homeworking days for flexibility of the employees
Continuous development and career growth opportunities on a local and global level
And much more…


The work environment is important!


Benefit from our modern amenities, including zen and creative rooms amongst others, many discounts from our group platform, free language courses, doctor on-site & remote and diverse company events,
Work in a multicultural environment with multiple nationalities,
Be part of a people care company with a strong & continuous growth investing in its employees through training and career opportunities.


Our commitments to you


Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas Cardif is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas Cardif we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas Cardif, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment.

If your profile and motivations matches our needs and you feel motivated to join our company, do not hesitate in sending us you application.

We will be delighted to consider you for this position.

Please note that only applications submitted with CV, Cover letter & Certificate of Studies will be considered and move forward in the application process.

Title: Data Loss Prevention Analyst
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!

A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil e Tunísia. Contamos com mais de 11 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.

Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.

Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.

O que procuramos

  • Experiência profissional de 1 ano em funções similares;
  • Experiência em Data Loss Prevention;
  • Experiência em análise e gestão de incidentes relacionados com Cibersegurança;
  • Inglês - B2
  • Francês - B2


Ser Affinity

  • #Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
  • #Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;
  • #Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;
  • #Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.

A tua #LifetimeExperience

  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.

Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.

Join the Experience!

Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:

https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
M/F







DESAFIO:




Esta posição, integrada na equipa de Data Intelligence, constitui uma oportunidade única para se focar na centralização, coerência, fiabilidade e velocidade dos dados para várias áreas de negócio. É uma função essencial para otimizar o desempenho das análises e do conhecimento obtido pela organização.

Este profissional terá um papel fundamental no desenvolvimento de métodos e processos que garantam a organização correta e segura dos dados, que envolve a criação de modelos de dados consistentes e normalizados, além de assegurar a qualidade dos dados armazenados, preparados e disponibilizados através de pipelines para uso analítico e operacional.










PRINCIPAIS RESPONSABILIDADES:




• Desenvolver e Automatizar Pipelines: criar, automatizar e manter pipelines de dados usando processos CI/CD para transformar dados em informações úteis e acionáveis.

• Colaboração: colaborar com analistas de negócio e dados para melhorar os modelos de dados que alimentam as ferramentas de BI, aumentando a acessibilidade dos dados e promovendo decisões orientadas por dados em toda a organização.

• Governança de Dados: assegurar que as políticas de segurança de dados estejam alinhadas com os regulamentos de proteção de dados.

• Monitorização da Qualidade dos Dados: desenvolver, testar e manter sistemas para monitorizar a qualidade dos dados, garantindo que os dados de produção estejam sempre atualizados e disponíveis para os principais intervenientes e processos empresariais.

• Desenvolvimento de Estratégia: colaborar com todas as unidades de negócio e equipas técnicas para desenvolver a estratégia de uma arquitetura de dados a longo prazo.

• Apoio à Equipa: partilhar conhecimentos técnicos e de dados com outros membros da equipa, ajudando na coordenação de projetos e prioridades.










PERFIL:




• Formação Académica: Licenciatura Informática, Engenharia, Ciências de Dados (áreas similares)

• Experiência: +3 anos de experiência prática em engenharia de dados

• Conhecimentos Técnicos: experiência com plataformas cloud, modelação de dados, batch e streaming workloads, e bases de dados

• Tecnologias: familiaridade com tecnologias como Snowflake, Airflow, Python, Kafka, Azure Data Factory, entre outras

• Microsoft BI: conhecimento em tecnologias Microsoft BI (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI)

• Habilidades Analíticas: capacidade analítica forte e atenção aos detalhes

• Relacionamento Interpessoal: excelente relacionamento interpessoal e habilidade para trabalhar em equipa

• Proatividade: dinamismo, proatividade e autonomia.







O QUE OFERECEMOS:




• Ambiente Inovador: trabalho com as tecnologias mais recentes num ambiente dinâmico

• Crescimento Profissional: oportunidades de desenvolvimento profissional contínuo

• Colaboração: um ambiente de trabalho colaborativo e de apoio mútuo.

• Impacto Real: participação em projetos que têm um impacto direto e significativo nos negócios.







Se és apaixonado por dados e ambicionas fazer parte de uma equipa que valoriza inovação e colaboração, gostaríamos de ter a oportunidade de te conhecer!

Se és apaixonado por dados e ambicionas fazer parte de uma equipa que valoriza inovação e colaboração, gostaríamos de ter a oportunidade de te conhecer!

Title: Data Engineer (m/f)
HTML:
A Dellent é uma empresa de consultoria especializada em Sistemas de Informação e Telecomunicações. O nosso objetivo é conseguirmos ajudar os nossos consultores e candidatos a integrarem projetos que vão ao encontro dos seus interesses, motivações e expectativas.

Se és um profissional apaixonado pelo universo automóvel e pela inovação na mobilidade, e queres enfrentar novos desafios, estás no sitio certo. Procuramos pessoas que queiram fazer parte de um projeto líder no setor, contribuindo para a transformação e excelência num ambiente dinâmico e desafiante.

Procuramos um(a) Data Engineer para um projeto híbrido ou remoto no Porto.

Como é Ser Data Engineer?

  • A integrar na equipa de Analytics, procuramos Data Engineer com capacidade de reunir grandes e complexos conjuntos de dados que atendam aos requisitos de negócios funcionais/não funcionais;
  • Desenho e Implementação de projetos de Analytics;
  • Identificar, definir e implementar melhorias de processos internos: automatizar processos manuais, otimizar a entrega de dados, redesenhar a infraestrutura para maior escalabilidade, etc.

O Que Valorizamos

  • Licenciado(a) em Engenharia Informática, Sistemas Informação ou similar;
  • Experiência na área de Analytics;
  • Experiência em DataWarehouse | SQL Server;
  • Preferencialmente experiência em Power BI;
  • Elevado sentido de responsabilidade, espírito de equipa, autonomia, proatividade e capacidade de adaptação;
  • Bons conhecimentos de Inglês e, preferencialmente, espanhol e francês;
  • Facilidade de comunicação e de relacionamento interpessoal;
  • Gosto pelo trabalho em equipa;
  • Capacidade de autonomia e organização;
  • Capacidade de análise;
  • Pro-atividade e dinamismo.

O que oferecemos?

  • Seguro de Saúde;
  • Plano de formação ajustado e personalizado, com um orçamento para gastares nas formações e livros técnicos que considerares necessários;
  • Feedback constante e acompanhamento para que possas crescer profissionalmente;
  • Processo de onboarding remoto;
  • Eventos de equipa todos os semestres para que possas viver novas aventuras;
  • Descontos e ofertas exclusivas nos nossos parceiros;
  • Cultura de proximidade e transparência. As tuas ideias e necessidades são ouvidas e valorizadas por nós!

Candidaturas

Submete a tua candidatura aqui. Para além disso, se também quiseres estar a par das novidades do mercado de trabalho sabe mais aqui.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We're building the future of advertising and are looking for innovative minds to help us do it.

Darkroom is a vertically integrated digital agency pioneering the next generation of consumer-facing brands. A category leader in results-driven growth marketing, Darkroom’s success is attributed to our unique partnership model, purposefully built to launch brands to market and accelerate growth across direct-to-consumer. We work with game-changing brands such as Crate & Barrel, Popchips, FEED, Olipop, & CALPAK.

Position Overview:

We're seeking a Data Engineer with a strong background in ETL processes, BigQuery, and Python to support a wide array of data engineering projects for our agency and enterprise clients. This role will focus on maintaining and optimizing our data infrastructure, ensuring the seamless flow of data, and providing the backbone for our data-driven decision-making.

This role supports teams working in US Eastern Standard/Daylight Time and should be flexible to support and work in these times.

What You’ll Do:


Design, build, and maintain scalable ETL processes to support data flow from various sources.
Maintain and optimize our BigQuery database, ensuring high performance and data integrity.
Write, troubleshoot, and optimize SQL queries to support various data needs.
Use Python to automate data processes, integrate data sources, and enhance data workflows.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Operations, Product, Marketing & Sales, Finance, and Engineering, to solve complex data problems.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports in Looker Studio to provide actionable insights to clients and internal teams.
Ensure continuous improvement of data processes through iterative testing and learning strategies.


You Should Apply If This Sounds Like You:


1 - 3 years of industry experience in data engineering, with a focus on maintaining and optimizing large-scale data systems.
Expertise in BigQuery, SQL, and Python for data processing, automation, and analysis.
Proven experience with ETL processes and tools.
Familiarity with data visualization tools, especially Looker Studio.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to manipulate, analyze, and interpret large datasets.
Experience in e-commerce marketing, with a strong understanding of platforms like Shopify, Meta (formerly Facebook) Ads, and Google Ads, is a plus.
Self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit who thrives in a fast-paced environment.


What It’s Like to Work at Darkroom:

We're building the future of advertising and are looking for the minds to help us do it. We only seek out the best—from our clients to our people. Our team is our most sacred asset, and we offer highly competitive salaries and the following perks:


Unlimited Vacation Policy and Holidays: Rebooting is one of the most important parts of growth. At Darkroom, you have access to a flexible vacation policy, and 10 holidays throughout the year to keep you recharged and sharp.
Remote-First Culture: With hubs in LA, The Bay Area, New York, Philly, Lisbon, São Paulo, and Pakistan, we offer a strong community base and endless opportunities for growth.
Endless Opportunities for Growth: Our agency is founded on an interdisciplinary approach, giving Darkroomers insights into services far beyond your job description. Grow your skills and interests beyond your niche and stay at the forefront of the industry through total immersion in cross-functional collaboration.


Equal Opportunity Statement:

Darkroom is an equal opportunity workplace—we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Title: Data Engineer / Data Visualization Specialist
Description:
📢 A nossa missão:

A Ivy Partners é uma empresa suíça de consulting que contribui para a evolução das empresas nos seus desafios estratégicos, tecnológicos e organizacionais.

A nossa missão é oferecer aos nossos colaboradores uma carreira que contribua positivamente para a sua realização e bem-estar, criando um ambiente de apoio onde todos são valorizados e capacitados com formação e perspectivas de crescimento.

👩‍💻🧑‍💻 Como Data Engineer / Data Visualization Specialist irás:

- Projetar e manter pipelines de dados eficientes e escaláveis com Snowflake e Databricks.

- Desenvolver e otimizar modelos de dados para suportar relatórios e dashboards no Power BI.

- Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com as equipas de negócios para compreender as suas necessidades de dados e criar soluções apropriadas.

- Implementar processos ETL (Extração, Transformação, Carga) robustos e eficientes.

- Manter a integridade e qualidade dos dados, monitorizando e resolvendo questões de desempenho.

- Criar e atualizar documentação técnica e guias de utilização.




🏅 Sobre ti!

Esta posição será perfeita para ti se:

- Educação: Licenciatura em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia de Dados, ou área relacionada.

- Experiência: Mínimo de 5 anos como Engenheiro de Dados, com foco em visualização de dados.

- Competências Técnicas:

- Proficiência em Snowflake e Databricks (Avançado)

- Experiência com Power BI (Confirmado)

- Conhecimentos sólidos em SQL e Python ou outras linguagens de programação relevantes (Avançado)

- Competências avançadas em processos ETL

- Competências Interpessoais:

- Capacidade de comunicar eficazmente com stakeholders técnicos e não técnicos

- Proficiência em inglês é uma vantagem

E se humanamente falando:

És analítico, rigoroso e tens um bom espírito de equipa
Tens fortes capacidades de comunicação e uma mentalidade fantástica

🤝 A Ivy, também é sobre:

Zelo | Oferecemos um ambiente de apoio onde todos são valorizados e capacitados com formação e perspetiva de crescimento.

Confiança | Trabalhar connosco é estabelecer uma parceria baseada na confiança, profissionalismo e transparência em todos os momentos.

Inovação | Potenciamos a transformação digital efectiva através de uma combinação única de tecnologia inovadora e pensamento criativo.

Responsabilidade | A comunidade está no centro de tudo o que fazemos, e levamos essa responsabilidade a sério, trabalhando arduamente para criar um impacto positivo.

🚀 Juntares-te à Ivy significa fazer parte de uma aventura desafiante a cada passo!

Obrigado por considerares juntar-te a nós, estamos ansiosos para ouvir mais sobre ti!

Title: Data Engineer (Hybrid @Porto)
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: 6+

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week at Porto Office)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field;
6+ years of experience as a Data Engineer;
Expertise on end-to-end Data Pipeline Development, ETL processes and Alteryx;
Knowledge in Data Mesh concepts (Starburst, Trino);
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala;
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases;
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Databricks, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Kafka;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal);
Fluency in English is mandatory.




To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you´ll have (plus):

French AND/OR Portuguese fluency.







Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!




Who are we?




Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Description:
Do you want to be part of building Vestas new Design Centre?

Vestas Technology & Operations > Research & Development (R&D) > Plant Data

Vestas Technology & Operations, a cornerstone of Vestas, is committed to innovation, product development, and continuous improvement. We aim to develop high products and technologies that build down the cost of energy, delivering maximum value to both our customers and Vestas.

As a part of Vestas Technology & Operations, the Modelling & Analytics, Plant Data team is responsible for the creation and management of products and services related to Vestas Plant Data Offerings. Our accomplished and diverse team of Data Engineers is focused on designing products that facilitate data collection, processing and storage from thousands of power plants across the world. The team also supports data storage and conducts data analytics on a hybrid data platform setup that supports multiple data applications for our customers.

Our overarching mission is to reduce the cost of energy by harnessing the extensive data collected and stored by Vestas from power plants worldwide. Join us in this mission to make a meaningful impact on the future of renewable energy.

Responsibilities

Potential candidate is expected to be 70% hands on with the data engineering team and engage with the architects and other stakeholders (PM, PO etc) for the remainder.

Perform upstream and downstream impact analysis of complex data flows which involved multiple source systems.
Contribute actively to design and delivery of migrating data products from legacy to cloud setup.
Facilitate key POC’s & mentor team data engineers on technical solutions.
Facilitate and contribute to formal Code & design reviews.
Oversight and contribution to managing operational data products (Level 3 Support).
Working with Architects, SME’s, business and product stakeholders in identifying data products and workloads in legacy warehouse.
Participate and co-own product architecture and drive strategic roadmap for plant data warehouse.

Qualifications

Master's degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Software engineering or related fields are preferences.
+7 years of experience in on-prem & cloud data warehousing domain.
Formidable command on advanced SQL & ELT design patterns & data flow/ workload performance optimization.

We envision that you possess experience in designing, building, and maintaining data products within hybrid environments.

Additionally, you should identify with at least one of the following qualifications:

Experience in data workload migration from on prem to cloud ETL + Data Warehouse.
Experience in Azure services + Snowflake + DBT would be an added advantage.
Extensive hands-on data modelling experience in cloud data warehouse and data structures.
Experience with SQL server, SSIS & SSAS would be a positive factor.
Familiarity with agile development methodologies and DevOps practices.
Experience with data mesh implementation,
Python, Py-Spark, Databricks would a bonus.

Competencies

On individual capacity, we anticipate that you:

Possess a collaborative and open-minded nature, eager to contribute to a globally diverse cross-functional team within the organization
Display curiosity and enthusiasm for developing innovative data products that generate value
Thrive in diverse environments and exhibit flexibility in adapting to evolving conditions
Exhibit good communication skills, coupled with a practical, problem-solving approach to accomplishing tasks
Embrace a commitment to continuous learning and a desire to contribute to the collective growth of the team

What We Offer

An aspirational position that lets you work on the key data areas in Vestas and be part of projects that redefine the Vestas data landscape.

Opportunity to work with and address challenges related to processing, developing and delivering value from true large scale industrial IOT data.

Take part in creating a green & sustainable future for the planet.

Additional information

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. To apply for this opportunity please submit your resume in English.




BEWARE – RECRUITMENT FRAUDIt has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

DEIB StatementAt Vestas, we recognize the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About VestasVestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore. Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field. With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future. Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity. To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance Portuguese speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.




This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.




Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & Portuguese
You must be living in Portugal for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Portugal
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.




Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.




Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?

Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss
Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle
Be a part of an online community




TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com







If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us at sourcingteam121@telusinternational.ai
